RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_DATA
RegisterGroup.description:
GPIO_DATA is a GPIO data register used to cache the input/output data.
When a bit of GPIO_DIR is set to output, the value written to the GPIO_DATA register will be output to the corresponding pin (note that the pin multiplexing is properly configured). If the bit is set to input, the value of the corresponding input pin will be read.

Caution:
When a bit of GPIO_DIR is set to input, the validly read result will return the value of the pin. When the bit is set to output, the read value should be the same as the written value.
With the PADDR[9:2], the GPIO_DATA register masks the read/write operation on the register bits. This register corresponds to 256 addresses. The PADDR[9:2] bits correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] bits respectively. If a specific bit is high, the read/write operation is allowed on the corresponding bit. If a specific bit is low, the read/write operation is not allowed. For example:
? If the address is 0x3FC (0b11_1111_1100), operations on the eight bits of GPIO_DATA[7:0] are all valid.
? If the address is 0x200 (0b10_0000_0000), only the operation on GPIO_DATA[7] is valid.

Member.name: gpio_data
Member.description: When the GPIO pins are set to the input pins, these pins are used to input data. When the GPIO pins are set to the output pins, these pins are used to output data. Each bit can be controlled separately. This register works together with the bits of GPIO_DIR.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_DIR
RegisterGroup.description: GPIO_DIR is a GPIO direction control register used to set the GPIO pin directions.

Member.name: gpio_dir
Member.description:
GPIO direction control register. The bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively and can control each bit separately.
0: input.
1: output.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_IS
RegisterGroup.description: GPIO_IS is a GPIO interrupt-triggering register used to set the level-sensitive mode for theGPIO pins.

Member.name: gpio_is
Member.description:
GPIO interrupt-triggering control register. The bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively and can control each bit separately.
0: edge-sensitive interrupt.
1: level-sensitive interrupt.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_IBE
RegisterGroup.description: GPIO_IBE is a GPIO dual-edge sensitive interrupt register used to set the edge-sensitivemode for the GPIO pins.

Member.name: gpio_ibe
Member.description:
GPIO edge-sensitive interrupt control register. The bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively and can control each bit separately.
0: single-edge sensitive interrupt. GPIO_IEV determines the rising/falling edge-sensitive mode of the interrupt.
1: dual-edge sensitive interrupt.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_IEV
RegisterGroup.description: GPIO_IEV is a GPIO interrupt-triggering condition register used to set the interrupt triggeringconditions for the GPIO pins.

Member.name: gpio_iev
Member.description:
GPIO interrupt-triggering condition register. The bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively and can control each bit separately.
0: falling edge-sensitive or low level-sensitive interrupt.
1: rising edge-sensitive or high level-sensitive interrupt.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_IE
RegisterGroup.description: GPIO_IE is a GPIO interrupt mask register used to mask the GPIO interrupts.

Member.name: gpio_ie
Member.description:
GPIO interrupt mask register. The bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively and can control each bit separately.
0: The interrupt is masked.
1: The interrupt is not masked.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_RIS
RegisterGroup.description: GPIO_RIS is a GPIO raw interrupt status register used to query the raw interrupt status of theGPIO pins.

Member.name: gpio_ris
Member.description:
GPIO raw interrupt register. The bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively to indicate the status of the interrupts before masking. The raw interrupt status is not controlled by the GPIO_IE register.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_MIS
RegisterGroup.description: GPIO_MIS is a GPIO masked interrupt register used to query the interrupt status of the GPIOpins after masking.

Member.name: gpio_mis
Member.description:
GPIO masked interrupt register. The bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively to indicate the interrupt status after masking. The masked interrupt status is controlled by the GPIO_IE register.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_IC
RegisterGroup.description: GPIO_IC is a GPIO interrupt clear register used to clear the interrupts generated by the GPIOpins and the clear the GPIO_RIS and GPIO_MIS registers.

Member.name: gpio_ic
Member.description:
GPIO interrupt clear register. The bit[7:0] correspond to GPIO_DATA[7:0] respectively and can control each bit separately.
0: no effect.
1: The interrupt is cleared.

RegisterGroup.name: GPIO_RESERVED
RegisterGroup.description: GPIO_RESERVED is a GPIO reserved register and should be configured as required.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: This register must be set to 0x00.

RegisterGroup.name: IR_EN
RegisterGroup.description: IR_EN is an IR receive enable control register.Caution:You must set IR_EN[ir_en] to 1 using software before configuring other registers; otherwise,the configuration does not take effect. If the register IR_EN[ir_en] is set to 0, other registersare only readable and the read values are the reset values of the registers.

Member.name: ir_en
Member.description:
IR receive module enable.
0: The IR receive module is disabled.
1: The IR receive module is enabled.

Member.name: ir_max_level_width
Member.description:
These bits do not take effect when IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 0.
Maximum symbol level width (in 10 μs) used to determine the end of a symbol stream when IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 1.

Member.name: ir_format
Member.description:
Code pattern when IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 0.
00: NEC with simple repeat code data format.
01: TC9012 code data format.
10: NEC with full repeat code data format.
11: SONY code data format.
For details about the relations between the code pattern and the code classification, see Table 10-7 to Table 10-9.
Symbol format when IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 1.
bit[15]: reserved.
The meaning of bit[14] is as follows:
0: The symbol format is low level first and the symbol stream ends at a high level.
1: The symbol format is high level first and the symbol stream ends at a low level.

Member.name: ir_bits
Member.description:
Number of data bits in a frame when IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 0.
0x00–0x2F: corresponds to 1–48 data bits in a frame.
0x30–0x3F: reserved.
If the software sets this field to a value within the range of 0x30–0x3F, the configuration does not take effect and the value of ir_bits remains unchanged.
Received symbol interrupt threshold when IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 1.
bit[13]: reserved.
bit[12:8]: 0x0–0x1F, corresponding to at least 1–32 symbols in the FIFO, which triggers an interrupt.

Member.name: ir_mode
Member.description:
IR operating mode.
0: Output a complete decoded data frame.
1: Only output the symbol width.

Member.name: ir_freq
Member.description:
Clock divider of the working clock.
0x00–0x7F: corresponds to the clock divider 1–128 of the working clock.

Member.name: cnt_leads_min
Member.description:
Minimum pulse width of the lead code start bit.
0x000–0x007: reserved.

Member.description:
Maximum pulse width of the lead code start bit.
0x000–0x007: reserved.

Upper 16 bits of the received decoded data when IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 0.
Number of symbols in the symbol FIFO when IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 1.

RegisterGroup.name: IR_DATAL
RegisterGroup.description: IR_DATAL is an IR-received decoded data lower 32 bits register (when IR_CFG[ir_mode] =0) or is an IR unit-received symbol width register (when IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 1).

Member.name: ir_datal
Member.description:
Lower 32 bits of the received decoded data when IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 0.
Symbol width received by the IR unit when IR_CFG[ir_mode] = 1.
The definitions of bit[31:16] are as follows:
High level width of the received symbol (in 10 μs) when the symbol is low level first.
Low level width of the received symbol (in 10 μs) when the symbol is high level first.
The definitions of bit[15:0] are as follows:
Low level width of the received symbol (in 10 μs) when the symbol is low level first.
High level width of the received symbol (in 10 μs) when the symbol is high level first.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_CAP1
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_GHC_CAP1 is a feature support register 1.

Member.name: s64a
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 0 indicates that the 64-bit data structure access is not supported.

Member.name: sncq
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that the NCQ operation is supported.

Member.name: ssntf
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that the port SNTF register is supported.

Member.name: smps
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 0 indicates that the mechanical hot plugging is not supported.

Member.name: sss
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that staggered spin-up is supported.

Member.name: salp
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that power management is supported.

Member.name: sal
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that the LED can blink or be steady on.

Member.name: sclo
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that command linked list overwriting is supported.

Member.name: iss
Member.description: These bits with the fixed value 0x2 indicate that the supported maximum transmission rate is 3 Gbit/s.

Member.name: sam
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that only the AHCI mode is supported.

Member.name: spm
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that the port multiplier is supported.

Member.name: fbss
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 0 indicates that FIS-based switching is not supported.

Member.name: pmd
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that the PIO module does not support the transfer of multiple DRQ blocks.

Member.name: ssc
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that the slumber state is supported.

Member.name: psc
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that the partial state is supported.

Member.name: ncs
Member.description: These bits with the fixed value 0x1F indicate that 32 command slots are supported.

Member.name: cccs
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that the CCC is supported.

Member.name: ems
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 0 indicates that enclose management is not supported.

Member.name: sxs
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that the external SATA is supported.

Member.name: np
Member.description: These bits with the fixed value 0x03 indicate that one port is supported.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_GHC
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_GHC_GHC is a global control register.

Member.name: ahci_en
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that the software can interact with the controller only through the AHCI mechanism.

Member.name: int_enable
Member.description:
Controller interrupt enable.
0: disabled.
1: enabled.

Member.name: hba_rst
Member.description:
Controller soft reset control.
0: not reset.
1: reset.
Write 1 to reset the controller. After the reset, the bit is automatically cleared. If this bit is set to 0, the controller is not affected. The controller reset does not affect the registers SATA_GHC_BOHC, SATA_PORT_FB and SATA_PORT_CLB.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_IS
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_GHC_IS is an interrupt status register.

Member.name: ips_ccc
Member.description:
CCC interrupt status.
0: No CCC interrupt is generated.
1: A CCC interrupt is generated.

Member.name: ips_port1
Member.description:
Port 1 interrupt status.
0: No interrupt is reported.
1: reserved.

Member.name: ips_port0
Member.description:
Port 0 interrupt status.
0: No interrupt is reported.
1: An interrupt is reported.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_PI
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_GHC_PI is a port implement register.

Member.name: port_imp
Member.description:
Port validity indicator.
0: The port is invalid.
1: The port is valid.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_VS
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_GHC_VS is an AHCI version identification register.

Member.name: ahci_vs
Member.description: The supported AHCI version is V1.2.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_CCC_CTL
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_GHC_CCC_CTL is a command completion coalescing (CCC) control register

Member.name: ccc_tv
Member.description:
CCC timeout parameter, in ms.
When the CCC function is enabled, the timeout counter loads the value of this parameter. If the commands are executed at the ports involved in the CCC function, the counter decreases by one every other 1 ms until the counter value reaches 0 and triggers an interrupt. After a CCC interrupt is generated, the counter re-loads this parameter and starts counting again.
These bits cannot be set to 0.

Member.name: ccc_cc
Member.description:
CCC command completion upper threshold.
When the CCC function is enabled, the command completion counter is cleared and accumulates the number of commands completed at the ports involved in the CCC function. If the counter value is greater than or equal to the value of this parameter, a CCC interrupt will be generated. After the CCC interrupt is generated, the counter is cleared and starts accumulating again.
If these bits are set to 0, the command completion interrupt will be disabled. In this case, the CCC interrupt can be triggered only by timeout events.

Member.name: ccc_int
Member.description: CCC interrupt vector number. The value of this parameter is 0x1F (31), indicating that the CCC interrupt status is specified by SATA_GHC_IS bit[31].

Member.name: ccc_en
Member.description:
CCC function enable.
0: disabled.
1: enabled.
When the CCC function is enabled, the values of the ccc_tv and ccc_cc parameters cannot be changed.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_CCC_PORTS
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_GHC_CCC_PORTS is a CCC port enable register.

Member.name: ccc_prt
Member.description:
Port involved in the CCC function.
0: The port is not involved in CCC counting.
1: The port is involved in CCC counting.
You can configure this register at any time, and the value will take effect immediately.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_CAP2
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_GHC_CAP2 is a feature support register 2.

Member.name: cap_boh
Member.description: This bit with the fixed value 1 indicates that the BIOS/OS handover management control is supported.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_BOHC
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_GHC_BOHC is a BIOS/OS handover control register.

Member.name: bohc_bb
Member.description:
BIOS busy indicator.
0: The BIOS is not busy.
1: The BIOS is busy with related operations and prepares to hand the control right over to the OS.

Member.name: bohc_ooc
Member.description: When the bohc_oos signal transits from 0 to 1, the value of this bit is locked to 1. This bit can be cleared by writing 1 and takes no effect when the bit is set to 0.

Member.name: bohc_sooe
Member.description:
Message interrupt enable.
0: No message interrupt is generated.
1: When bohc_ooc is set to 1, a message interrupt is generated.

Member.name: bohc_oos
Member.description:
OS controller request.
0: The OS does not apply for the controller control right.
1: The OS applies for the controller control right. If bohc_oos is set to 1 and bios_bos is set to 0, the OS has obtained the control right over the SATA controller. This bit is not affected by the controller reset specified by the bit SATA_GHC_GHC[hab_rst].

Member.name: bohc_bos
Member.description:
Flag indicating that the BIOS has the control right.
0: The BIOS does not have the controller control right.
1: The BIOS sets up the control right over the controller. If the OS applies for the controller control right, the BIOS clears this bit. This bit is not affected by the controller reset specified by the bit SATA_GHC_GHC[hab_rst].

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_GHC_TM
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_GHC_TM is a TM test status register.

Member.name: req_sel
Member.description:
DMAC that currently has the right to use the AHB master.
0x0: The port 0 transmit DMAC obtains the channel.
0x1: The port 0 receive DMAC obtains the channel.
Other values: reserved.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PHY0_CTLL
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PHY0_CTLL is a PHY0 global control register lower bits.

Member.name: mpll_prescale
Member.description:
The value of this parameter varies with the reference clock.
00: Directly use the ref_clk frequency.
01: Double the ref_clk frequency.
10: Divide the ref_clk frequency by two.
11: reserved.

Member.name: mpll_ncy
Member.description: An MPLL working parameter in the PHY, used together with mpll_ncy5 to indicate the used frequency multiplication value.

Member.name: mpll_ncy5
Member.description: An MPLL working parameter in the PHY, used together with mpll_ncy to indicate the used frequency multiplication value.

Member.name: mpll_int_ctl
Member.description: MPLL internal bandwidth control selection signal. The value must be 0b000.

Member.name: mpll_prop_ctl
Member.description: MPLL internal bandwidth proportion control signal. The value must be 0b111. You can modify the value only when the MPLL is reset or invalid.

Member.name: tx_lvl
Member.description: Transmit level parameter related to the selected SATA protocol. The value must be 0b01100.

Member.name: los_lvl
Member.description:
LOS signal detection level control.
When the transmission rate of the SATA port is in 1.5 Gbit/s mode, these bits are set to 0b01111.
When the transmission rate of the SATA port is in 3 Gbit/s mode, these bits are set to 0b10001.

Member.name: acjt_lvl
Member.description: ACJTAG receiver comparator level control. The value must be 0b00010.

Member.name: pddq_h
Member.description: IDDQ test signal. To perform the IDDQ test, all the lanes and support modules should be powered off before pddq_h takes effect. In normal conditions, this bit must be set to 0.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PHY0_CTLH
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PHY0_CTLH is a PHY0 global control register upper bits.

Member.name: use_refclk_alt
Member.description:
PHY reference clock selection signal.
0: Use the refclk differential signal set.
1: Use the refclk_alt differential signal set.

Member.name: mpll_ck_off
Member.description:
MPLL power on control signal. The signal control should comply with the following rules:
1. When the refclk differential signal set is provided for the MPLL, set mpll_ck_off to 0.
2. Before setting this signal to 0, set mpll_ncy, mpll_ncy5 and mpll_prescale to proper values.
3. If the refclk differential signal set is suspended or switched or mpll_ncy, mpll_ncy5 and mpll_prescale need to be modified, you should first set mpll_ck_off to 1.

Member.name: mpll_pwron
Member.description:
Power on of the MPLL.
0: The cko_word clock becomes invalid.
1: The internal MPLL is reset, and the cko_word clock signal is generated subsequently based on the refclk frequency.
Before the MPLL is disabled, tx_en must be in OFF state or CM state and rx_en and rx_pll_pwron must be set to 0.

Member.name: mpll_ss_en
Member.description:
Spread spectrum function enable.
0: disabled.
1: enabled.
If the spread spectrum function is already used on the refclk, this bit must be set to 0.

Member.name: cko_word_con
Member.description: cko_word output selection signal.

Member.name: cko_alive_con
Member.description:
cko_alive output signal selection.
00: no effect.
01: Output the prescaler frequency.
10: Output a low frequency that is prescaler/16.
11: reserved.

Member.name: rtune_do_tune
Member.description:
Resistance adjustment enable signal.
0: not tuned.
1: The resistance is retuned.

Member.name: reset_n
Member.description: Reset signal. The signal should be kept for at least 5 ns.

Member.name: wide_xface
Member.description:
Interface bit width control.
0: 10-bit interface.
1: 20-bit interface.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PHY0_STS
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PHY0_STS is a PHY0 global status register.

Member.name: phy0_sts
Member.description: SATA PHY0 common part status register.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_OOB_CTL
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_OOB_CTL is a PHY OOB control register.

Member.name: oob_ctrl_valid
Member.description: OOB detection parameter configuration bit. When this bit is high level, the parameter configuration of this register is selected.

Member.name: min_comiwake
Member.description: Minimum space count value required by the COMWAKE space detection.

Member.name: max_comwake
Member.description: Maximum space count value required by the COMWAKE space detection.

Member.name: min_cominit
Member.description: Minimum space count value required by the COMINIT space detection.

Member.name: max_cominit
Member.description: Maximum space count value required by the COMINIT space detection.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_CLB
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_CLB is a command list base address register.

Member.name: port_clb
Member.description: Base address of the command list in the memory. The register value is not affected by the controller reset specified by the bit SATA_GHC_GHC[hab_rst].

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_FB
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_FB is a received FIS base address register

Member.name: port_fb
Member.description: Base address of the port-received frames in the memory. The register value is not affected by the controller reset specified by the bit SATA_GHC_GHC[hab_rst]

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_IS
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_IS is a port interrupt status register.

Member.name: pxis_tfes
Member.description:
TFD error interrupt status.
0: The detected value of the bit SATA_PORT_TFD[tfd_sts] ERR is not 1.
1: The detected value of the bit SATA_PORT_TFD[tfd_sts] ERR is 1.

Member.name: pxis_hbds
Member.description:
Internal bus error interrupt.
0: No error occurs when the DMAC accesses the memory.
1: An error occurs when the DMAC accesses the memory.

Member.name: pxis_ifs
Member.description:
Fatal error interrupt status.
0: No error occurs during the data frame transfer.
1: An error occurs during the data frame transfer.

Member.name: pxis_infs
Member.description:
Non-fatal error interrupt status.
0: No error occurs during the non-data frame transfer.
1: An error occurs during the non-data frame transfer.

Member.name: pxis_ofs
Member.description:
Data transfer overflow interrupt status.
0: No overflow is detected.
1: During the data frame transfer, if the detected data memory used by commands is smaller than the actual size of the transferred data, an interrupt is reported at the end of the data transfer.

Member.name: pxis_ipms
Member.description:
PM port error interrupt status.
0: No port number error is detected during frame reception.
1: A port number error is detected during frame reception.

Member.name: pxis_prcs
Member.description:
PHY status change interrupt status.
0: No change of the phyrdy signal is detected.
1: A change of the phyrdy signal is detected.
This bit directly reflects the value of the bit SATA_PORT_SERR[diag_n].

Member.name: pxis_pcs
Member.description:
Port connection change interrupt status.
0: No COMINIT signal from the device is detected.
1: A COMINIT signal from the device is detected.
This bit directly reflects the value of the bit SATA_PORT_SERR[diag.x].

Member.name: pxis_dps
Member.description:
Linked list termination interrupt status.
0: Transfer of the linked list including the PRD bit I with the value of 1 is not complete.
1: The transfer of the linked list including the PRD bit I with the value of 1 is complete.

Member.name: pxis_ufs
Member.description:
Unknown FIS interrupt status.
0: No Unknown FIS is received.
1: An Unknown FIS is received.

Member.name: pxis_sdbs
Member.description:
Set Device Bits FIS interrupt status.
0: no effect.
1: A Set Device Bits FIS is received and the value of bit I is 1.

Member.name: pxis_dss
Member.description:
DMA Setup FIS interrupt status.
0: meaningless.
1: A DMA Setup FIS is received and the value of bit I is 1.

Member.name: pxis_pss
Member.description:
PIO Setup FIS interrupt status.
0: meaningless.
1: A PIO Setup FIS is received and the value of bit I is 1.

Member.name: pxis_drhs
Member.description:
D2H Register FIS interrupt status.
0: meaningless.
1: A D2H Register FIS is received and the value of bit I is 1.

Fatal error interrupt mask.

Non-fatal error interrupt mask.

1: not mask.

Data transfer overflow interrupt mask.

PM port error interrupt mask.

PHY status change interrupt mask.

Linked list end interrupt mask.

Unknown FIS interrupt mask.

Set Device Bits FIS interrupt mask.
0: masked.
1: not masked.

Member.name: pxie_dse
Member.description:
DMA Setup FIS interrupt mask.

1: not masked.

PIO Setup FIS interrupt mask.
0: masked.
1: not masked.

Member.name: pxie_drhe
Member.description:
D2H Register FIS interrupt mask.
0: masked.
1: not masked.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_CMD
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_CMD is a port command and status register.

Member.name: cmd_icc
Member.description:
Interface communication control signal.
0x0: no operation, indicating that a new interface status request can be transmitted.
0x1: Request the interface to enter the active state.
0x2: Request the interface to enter the partial state.
0x6: Request the interface to enter the slumber state.
Other values: reserved.
When the software writes a non-reserved value, the controller performs the corresponding operation and clears cmd_icc. When the software requests the interface to enter its current state, the controller directly clears cmd_icc. If the software requests the interface to enter another low-power mode from a low-power mode, such as from the partial state to the slumber state, the software should first request the interface to enter the active state from the partial state and then request the interface to enter the slumber state from the active state.

Member.name: cmd_asp
Member.description:
The interface automatically enters the slumber/partial state for power management.
0: Automatically enter the partial state.
1: Automatically enter the slumber state.

Member.name: cmd_alpe
Member.description:
Automatic power management enable.
0: disabled.
1: enabled.
If the registers SATA_PORT_CI and SATA_PORT_SACT are cleared, the controller automatically enters the power management state. If the value of cmd_asp is 1, the controller enters the partial state. If the value of cmd_asp is 0, the controller enters the slumber state.

Member.name: cmd_dlae
Member.description:
LED driving enable in ATAPI mode.
0: If the value of cmd_atapi is 0 and certain commands are being executed, the driving of the LED pins is valid.
1: If certain commands are being executed, the driving of the LED pins is valid.

Member.name: cmd_atapi
Member.description:
ATAPI device indicator.
0: The current device is a non-ATAPI device.
1: The current device is an ATAPI device.

Member.name: cmd_esp
Member.description: The value of this bit is always 1, indicating that the external SATA device is supported.

Member.name: cmd_pma
Member.description:
Port multiplier device indicator.
0: The port does not connect with a port multiplier device.
1: The port connects with a port multiplier device.

Member.name: cmd_cr
Member.description:
Command list processing indication signal.
0: No command is being executed
1: A command is being executed.

Member.name: cmd_fr
Member.description:
FIS reception processing indication signal.
0: No FIS is being received.
1: An FIS is being received.

Member.name: cmd_ccs
Member.description:
Slot number of the current command.
These bits take effect when cmd_st is 1 and are cleared when cmd_st is 0.

Member.name: cmd_fre
Member.description:
FIS receive enable control signal.
0: Forbid writing the received FIS to the system memory.
1: Enable the FIS receiving function and write the received FIS to the system memory.
The software should first set the received FIS base address SATA_PORT_FB and then enable this bit to receive FISs. If the value of cmd_st is 1, the value of this bit must be 1.

Member.name: cmd_clo
Member.description:
Busy/Drq clear control. The software can forcibly clear the BSY and DRQ bits by setting this bit and transmit commands to devices.
0: no effect.
1: The BSY and DRQ bits of the SATA_PORT_TFD[tfd_sts] register will be cleared. This bit is automatically cleared after the BSY and DRQ bits are cleared.
This bit can be set to 1 only before the value of cmd_st transits from 0 to 1. The software must set cmd_st to 1 after this bit is cleared.

Member.name: cmd_sud
Member.description:
Spin-up device control.
0: When SATA_PORT_SCTL[det] is set to 0, the controller enters the listen mode.
1: After the system power on or the HBA reset, the controller starts and transmits the COMRESET sequence to initialize the hard disk device.

Member.name: cmd_st
Member.description:
Command list processing enable.
0: The controller enters the idle state.
1: The controller processes the commands corresponding to the slots starting from slot 0 that are indicated as valid by the SATA_PORT_CI register.
The cmd_st can be set to 1 only after the value of cmd_fre is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_TFD
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_TFD is a port task file register.

Member.name: tfd_err
Member.description:
Task file error register value.
The controller updates this register when receiving the D2H register/PIO setup/SDB FIS.

Member.name: tfd_sts
Member.description:
Task file status register value.
bit[7]: BSY bit, indicating that the device is busy.
bit[6:4]: The meanings of these bits vary with commands.
bit[3]: DRQ bit, indicating that the device has data to be transferred.
bit[2:1]: The meanings of these bits vary with commands.
bit[0]: ERR bit, indicating that an error occurs on the device during data transfer.
The controller updates this register when receiving the D2H register/PIO setup/SDB FIS.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SIG
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_SIG is a port signature register.

Member.name: signature
Member.description:
LBA address and sector addressing. The specific address allocation relationship is as follows:
bit[31:24]: LBA upper bit address.
bit[23:16]: LBA middle bit address.
bit[15:8]: LBA lower bit address.
bit[7:0]: sector count.
The first received D2H register FIS after the reset of the hard disk device updates this register.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SSTS
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_SSTS is an interface status register.

Member.name: pxssts_ipm
Member.description:
Current interface status.
0x0: No device exists or no communication is set up.
0x1: in active state.
0x2: in partial state.
0x6: in slumber state.
Other values: reserved.

Member.name: pxssts_spd
Member.description:
Negotiated communication rate status of the interface.
0x0: No device exists or no communication is set up.
0x1: The communication rate 1 is used as the negotiation result.
0x2: The communication rate 2 is used as the negotiation result.
0x3: The communication rate 3 is used as the negotiation result.
Other values: reserved.

Member.name: pxssts_det
Member.description:
Device detection status and PHY status.
0x0: No device is detected and the PHY communication is not set up.
0x1: Devices are detected but the PHY communication is not established.
0x3: Devices are detected and the PHY communication is established.
0x4: The PHY is in offline or BIST state.
Other values: reserved.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SCTL
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_SCTL is an interface control register.

Member.name: pxsctl_ipm
Member.description:
Interface power management status control.
0x0: no special requirements.
0x1: Forbid the interface to enter the partial state.
0x2: Forbid the interface to enter the slumber state.
0x3: Forbid the interface to enter the partial or slumber state.
Other values: reserved.

Member.name: pxsctl_spd
Member.description:
Interface communication rate.
0x0: no special requirements.
0x1: Restrict to communication rate 1.
0x2: Restrict to communication rate 2.
0x3: Restrict to communication rate 3.
Other values: reserved.

Member.name: pxsctl_det
Member.description:
Device detection and interface initialization.
0x0: no device detection or initialization request.
0x1: Request the interface to reset the initialization sequence COMRESET.
0x4: Force the interface to enter the offline state.
Other values: reserved.
When pxsctl_det is set to 1, the controller transmits the COMRESET sequence to the device. The software must keep the value 1 of pxsctl_det unchanged for at least 1 ms to ensure that the device receives the COMRESET sequence.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SERR

Member.name: diag_x
Member.description:
Device detection status.

1: A COMINIT signal from the device is detected.

Member.name: diag_f

Detection status of the Unknown FIS.

1: This bit is set to 1 when an Unknown FIS is received and no error is detected through CRC.

Member.name: diag_s

1: A state transition error occurs on the link layer.

Member.name: diag_h
Member.description:

1: One or more R_ERR primitives from the device are received.

Member.name: diag_c
Member.description:
CRC error status.
0: No CRC error occurs in the received FIS.
1: A CRC error occurs in the received FIS.

Member.name: diag_b
Member.description:
Decoding error status.
0: No 10B to 8B decoding error is detected.
1: A 10B to 8B decoding error is detected.

Member.name: diag_w
Member.description:
COMWAKE status.
0: No COMWAKE signal from the device is detected.
1: A COMWAKE signal from the device is detected.

Member.name: diag_i
Member.description:
PHY internal error status.
0: No PHY internal error is detected.
1: A PHY internal error is detected.

Member.name: diag_n
Member.description:
PhyRdy signal change status.
0: The PhyRdy signal does not change.
1: The PhyRdy signal changes.
This bit is set to 1 when the PhyRdy signal changes from 1 to 0 or from 0 to 1.

Member.name: err_p
Member.description:
SATA protocol violation error status.
0: No device action violating the SATA protocol is detected.
1: A device action violating the SATA protocol is detected.

Member.name: err_t
Member.description:
Data integrity error status.
0: No data integrity error is detected.
1: A data integrity error is detected.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SACT
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_SACT is an NCQ command identification control register.

Member.name: port_sact
Member.description:
NCQ command identification control register.
Each bit in this register corresponds to a tag number and an NCQ command in the memory. That is, bit[31:0] correspond to the tag 31 to tag 0 and the commands of slot 31 to slot 0 respectively. The following description takes bit[3] for example to explain the meaning of each bit:
0: The slot 3 command is a non-NCQ command.
1: The slot 3 command is an NCQ command. The software should set bit[3] of this register before setting the bit SATA_PORT_CI[3]. After the command data transfer is complete, the device will transmit an SDB FIS and the controller will clear bit[3] according to the SActive in the received FIS.
The software can set this register only when the value of cmd_st is 1. When the value of cmd_st is 0, the software clears this register.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_CI
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_CI is a command transmit control register.

Member.name: port_ci
Member.description:
Control of the commands to be transmitted.
Each bit of this register represents a command in the memory. That is, bit[31:0] correspond to the commands of slot 31 to slot 0 respectively. The following description takes bit[3] for example to explain the meaning of each bit:
0: Slot 3 has no command to be transmitted or run.
1: The slot 3 command is created in the memory. The controller can now issue this command. The bit[3] is cleared when the controller executes the command, receives a corresponding FIS, and clears the bits BSY, DRQ, and EER of the register SATA_PORT_TFD.
The bits in this register can be set only when the value of cmd_st is 1. When the value of cmd_st is 0, the register is cleared.

RegisterGroup.name: SATA_PORT_SNTF
RegisterGroup.description: SATA_PORT_SNTF is an asynchronous notification event indication register.

Member.name: pxsntf_pmn
Member.description:
Asynchronous notification event status.
If the controller receives the SDB FIS of the device from the PM and the value of bit N of the FIS is 1, set the bit corresponding to the PM port number of the device to 1.
The following description takes bit[3] for example to explain the meaning of each bit:
0: No asynchronous notification event occurs on the device whose PM port number is 3.
1: An asynchronous notification event occurs on the device whose PM port number is 3.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_DATA
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_DATA is an SCI data register used to transmit or receive characters and functions as adata interface between the SCI and the software.The software can write the register only after setting SCI_CR1[mode] to 1. Whenwrite operation does not take effect.Register Name

Member.name: parity
Member.description:
Parity check error flag. This bit is transmitted with the data. When receiving the data, the software determines whether the parity check is correct according to this bit.
0: correct.
1: incorrect.

Member.name: scidata
Member.description: 8-bit character for the data read/write operation.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CR0
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_CR0 is an SCI control register 0 used to control the information such as clock stop, parity check, handshake mechanism, and transferred bit definition.

Caution:
? SCI_CR0[paritybit] is the functional bit determining whether to enable the parity check during data transmission or reception. When the value of this bit is 0, the received or transmitted frame structure does not contain parity bit. The T0 or T1 protocol requires that this bit is set be 1.
? SCI_CR0[clkdis] and [clkval] are used to configure the smart card clock enable and the pin status after the clock is disabled.
? SCI_CR0[rxnak] and [txnak] are used to enable the handshake mechanism between the SCI and the smart card. The handshaking refers to the condition that the receiver detects parity check error in the data transmitted by the transmitter and requests the transmitter to re-transmit the character by pulling down the data line (I/O). The handshake mechanisms for transmission and reception are separately enabled. The maximum retry count of transmission or reception is specified by the SCI_RETRY register. Because character re-transmission is not allowed during ATR reception, the handshake mechanism should be disabled, that is, the related transmission or reception control bit should be set to 0.
? SCI_CR0[rxparity] and [txparity] are used to control the parity check mode in the receive or transmit mode.
In direct convention, the low level of the data line (I/O) represents the logic 0 and indicates that the least significant bit (LSB) of the data follows the start position of a frame. SCI_CR0 bit[1:0] with value 0b00 indicates the direct convention.
In inverse convention, the low level of the data line (I/O) represents the logic 1 and indicates that the most significant bit (MSB) of the data follows the start position of a frame. SCI_CR0 bit[1:0] with value 0b11 indicates the inverse convention.
Note:
? You can separately set the bit order and set whether to negate the data bits and parity bit. Therefore, the SCI can be configured to support non-standard protocol (indirect convention or inverse convention).
? Before the starting TS character of the ATR is received, SCI_CR0 bit[1:0] must be set to 0b00. If the TS character indicates that the smart card complies with the inverse convention, SCI_CR0 bit[1:0] must be set to 0b11 before the register receives the next ATR character.

Member.name: detect_inv
Member.description:
Configuration of the valid level for the detct input signal.
0: active high.
1: active low.

Member.name: vccen_inv
Member.description:
Configuration of the valid level for the vccen output signal.
0: active high.
1: active low.

Member.name: paritybit

Parity bit transfer enable.
0: disabled.
1: enabled.

Member.name: clkval

Smart card clock status when the clock stops.

1: high level.

Control bit for starting and stopping the clock.

Action control in the transmit mode. The receiver indicates the parity check error by pulling down the I/O line. This bit can be used to control whether to detect that the receiver has pulled down the I/O line.
0: The SCI does not detect whether the receiver has pulled down the I/O line.
1: The SCI detects whether the receiver has pulled down the I/O line.

Member.name: rxparity
Member.description:
Parity check mode control in the receive mode.
0: even parity check.
1: odd parity check.

Member.name: txnak
Member.description:
Action control in the transmit mode.
0: The SCI does not detect whether the receiver has pulled down the I/O line.
1: The SCI detects whether the receiver has pulled down the I/O line to indicate parity check error.

Member.name: txparity
Member.description:
Parity check mode control in the transmit mode.
0: even parity check.
1: odd parity check.

Member.name: order
Member.description:
Bit order of the character.
0: LSB is received/transmitted by following the start bit.
1: MSB is received/transmitted by following the start bit.

Member.name: sense
Member.description:
Detect the data bits and parity bit on the I/O line after these bits are negated.
0: Detect directly.
1: Detect after the bits are negated.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CR2
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_CR2 is an SCI control register 2. The write operation on the related bits of this register triggers the SCI to activate, release and soft-reset the card. When the SCI is releasing the smart card, the write operation on the register will be omitted. In other cases, the SCI immediately transmits the card release sequence when SCI_CR2[finish] is set to 1.

Caution:
? The software is allowed to perform write operation on the register only at proper card operation stage. An improper write operation will cause unexpected results.
? The software can soft-reset the card only after the smart card is activated.

Member.name: wreset
Member.description:
Soft reset operation on the card.
0: no effect.
1: Soft-reset the card.
Note: This bit is writable only after the activation sequence is complete. Otherwise, the write operation does not take effect.

Member.name: finish
Member.description:
Release operation on the smart card.
0: no effect.
1: Release the smart card.
Note: This bit is writable only after the smart card is detected by the card reader. Otherwise, the write operation does not take effect.

Member.name: startup
Member.description:
Activate operation on the smart card.
0: no effect.
1: Activate the smart card.
Note: This bit is writable only after the smart card is detected by the card reader. Otherwise, the write operation does not take effect.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CLKICC
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_CLKICC is a smart card clock frequency register defining the clock divider of theexternal smart card clock. The calculation formula of the smart card clock frequency isFSCI_CLK=FREFCLK/2(clkicc+1) where FSCI_CLK indicates the clock frequency, FREFCLKindicates the reference clock frequency, and clkicc indicates the configuration value of

Member.name: clkicc
Member.description: Clock divider of the smart card clock that is obtained from the clock prescale of the reference clock can be set to a value ranging from 0 to 255.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_VALUE
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_VALUE is an intra-ETU SCI_BAUD cycle register used to calculate the ETU. Theregister can be configured with a value ranging from 5 to 255. The ETU calculation formula isETU=value(1+baud)/FREFCLK where FREFCLK indicates the reference clock frequency, baudindicates the configuration value of SCI_BAUD[baud], and value indicates the configurationvalue of SCI_VALUE[value].

Member.name: value
Member.description: Number of SCIBAUD cycles of each ETU.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BAUD

Member.name: baud

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_TIDE

Member.name: rxtide

Member.name: rxdmae

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_STABLE
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_STABLE is a smart card insertion stabilization time register. After the smart card verifies that the SCI_DETECT signal is valid, the signal must keep stable for the fixed time TSTABLE specified by this register. After the TSTABLE ends (in seconds), an interrupt can be triggered, indicating that the smart card is correctly inserted. The specific operations are as follows:
? When the entire internal down counter is selected, that is, when SCI_CR1[exdbnce] is set to 0, TSTABLE=（stable+1）*TREFCLK*65535. In this formula, TREFCLK indicates the SCI reference clock cycle (1/48 MHz) and stable indicates the configuration value of SCI_STABLE[stable].
? When the unprogrammable part of the down counter is bypassed, that is, when SCI_CR1[exdbnce] is set to 1, TSTABLE=stable*TREFCLK.

Member.name: stable
Member.description: Time during which the card stably keeps the high level.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_ATIME
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_ATIME is a smart card activation time register. The SCI_ATIME[atime] bit correspondsto SCIATIME in Figure 10-8 and is used to indicate the hold time of the three stages of cardreset and activation.Note:To reset the card, you must set SCI_ATIME[atime] to at least 40000 smart card clock (SCI_CLK)cycles.The setting of this parameter must meet the requirement of the smart card for stable power.

Member.name: atime
Member.description: Hold time for each of the three stages of the card activation sequence. The timing for the SCI to release the smart card is shown in Figure 10-8.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_DTIME
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_DTIME is a smart card release time register. The SCI_DTIME[dtime] bit corresponds toSCIDTIME in Figure 10-8 and is used to indicate the duration of the three stages for cardrelease.

Member.name: dtime
Member.description: Duration (SCI reference clock cycles) for each of the three stages of the card release sequence. The timing for the SCI to release the smart card is shown in Figure 10-9.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_ATRSTIME
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_ATRSTIME is an ATR wait-to-receive time threshold register. The SCI_ATRSTIME[dtime] bit corresponds to SCIATRSTIME in Figure 10-8. This register defines the thresholdof the time starting from the end of the smart card release to the beginning of the reception ofthe first ATR character. If the ATR wait-to-receive period times out, an interrupt will betriggered and SCI_RIS[atrstoutim] will be set to 1.Note:SCI_ATRSTIME[atrstime] must be initialized to 40000 SCI_CLK smart card clock cycles.

Member.name: atrstime
Member.description: Time threshold for the ATR reception start timeout (SCI card clock SCI_CLK cycles).

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_ATRDTIME
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_ATRDTIME is an ATR receive time threshold register. When the SCI receives the ATR(starting from the reception of the first ATR character to the completion of the last ATRcharacter reception), if the whole reception process exceeds the time defined in this register(with ETU as the unit), an interrupt will be triggered and SCI_RIS[atrdtoutris] will be set to 1.Note:Before this register is used, SCI_CR1[atrden] must be set to 1 to enable the counting mechanism.Set the register to 19200 ETUs, that is 0x4B00, as required by the protocol.

Member.name: atrdtime
Member.description: Time threshold (with ETU as the unit) for the timeout of the ATR reception starting from the start bit of the first ATR character.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_STOPTIME
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_STOPTIME is a clock stop time register. When the clock stops and the time defined bySCI_STOPTIME passes (with SCI smart card clock SCI_CLK cycle as the unit), the smartcard clock becomes invalid, an interrupt is triggered, and SCI_RIS[clkstpris] is set to 1.Note:The minimum value of this register should be 1860 SCI clock cycles as required by the protocol, that is,SCI_STOPTIME[stoptime] should be set to 0x744.

Member.name: stoptime
Member.description: Smart card clock stop time (SCI smart card clock SCI_CLK cycles).

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_STARTTIME
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_STARTIME is a smart card clock restoration time register. When the start clock restoresand the time defined by SCI_STARTTIME passes (with SCI smart card clock SCI_CLK cycleas the unit), the SCI and the smart card can transfer data to each other, an interrupt is triggeredand SCI_RIS[clkactris] is set to 1.Note:The minimum value of this register should be 700 SCI clock cycles as required by the protocol, that is,SCI_STARTTIME[starttimr] should be set to at least 0x2BC.

Member.name: starttime
Member.description: Duration from the start of the card clock to the time when data transfer is possible (with SCI card clock SCI_CLK cycle as the unit).

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_RETRY
RegisterGroup.description:
SCI_RETRY is a transmit/receive retry count register. This register defines the number of allowable receive or transmit retries.
? When SCI_CR0[txnak] is enabled, the SCI detects whether the receiver marks a parity check error. SCI_RETRY[rxretry] defines the maximum number of re-transmission attempts when a parity check error occurs. If the retry count exceeds the maximum number, an interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[txerrris] is set 1.
? When SCI_CR0[rxnak] is enabled, the SCI detects whether the received data includes a parity check error. SCI_RETRY[txretry] defines the maximum number of re-transmission attempts when a parity check error occurs. If the retry count exceeds the maximum number and the parity check error persists, SCI_DATA[parity] is set 1.

Member.name: rxretry
Member.description: Maximum receive retry count when a parity check error occurs in the received data.

Member.name: txretry
Member.description: Maximum transmit retry count when a parity check error occurs in the transmitted data.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CHTIMELS
RegisterGroup.description:
Caution:
The SCI_CHTIME register consists of the lower 16 bits register SCI_CHTIMELS and the upper 16 bits register SCI_CHTIMEMS. When the software writes the SCI_CHTIMEMS register, SCI_CHTIME does not take effect immediately. When the software writes the SCI_CHTIMELS register, SCI_CHTIME takes effect immediately. Therefore, when configuring SCI_CHTIME, you need to set the upper 16 bits first and then set the lower 16 bits.
SCI_CHTIMELS is a character reception interval timeout threshold lower 16 bits register.
The SCI_CHTIME register defines the maximum interval (with ETU as the unit) between the start edges of two received consecutive characters. If the interval between two received characters times out, an interrupt will be triggered and SCI_RIS[chtoutris] is set to 1.

Member.name: chtimels
Member.description: Lower 16 bits of the character reception interval timeout threshold register SCICHTIME.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CHTIMEMS
RegisterGroup.description:
Caution:
The SCI_CHTIME register consists of the lower 16 bits register SCI_CHTIMELS and the upper 16 bits register SCI_CHTIMEMS. When the software writes the SCI_CHTIMEMS register, SCI_CHTIME does not take effect immediately. When the software writes the SCI_CHTIMELS register, SCI_CHTIME takes effect immediately. Therefore, when configuring SCI_CHTIME, you need to set the upper 16 bits first and then set the lower 16 bits.
SCI_CHTIMELS is a character reception interval timeout threshold lower 16 bits register.
The SCI_CHTIME register defines the maximum interval (with ETU as the unit) between the start edges of two received consecutive characters. If the interval between two received characters times out, an interrupt will be triggered and SCI_RIS[chtoutris] is set to 1.

Member.name: chtimems
Member.description: Upper 16 bits of the character reception interval timeout threshold register SCICHTIME.

Member.name: blktimels
Member.description: Lower 16 bits of the block reception interval timeout threshold register SCIBLKTIME.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BLKTIMEMS
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_BLKTIMES is a block reception interval timeout threshold upper 16 bits register.

Member.name: blktimems
Member.description: Upper 16 bits of the block reception interval timeout threshold register SCIBLKTIME.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_CHGUARD
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_CHGUARD is an inter-character guard interval register. The register defines theminimum extra guard interval (with ETU as the unit) between the start edges of twoconsecutive characters when the SCI continuously transfers characters to the card. Theregister value is determined by the global interface byte TC1 (obtained from the ATRsequence) defined in the protocol.

Member.name: scichguard
Member.description: Inter-character guard interval (with ETU as the unit).

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_BLKGUARD
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_BLKGUARD is an inter-block guard interval register. When two consecutive charactersare transmitted reversely, the interval between the start edges is SCI_BLKGUARD.

Member.name: sciblkguard
Member.description: Minimum period (with ETU as the unit) between the two consecutive characters transmitted reversely.

RegisterGroup.name: SCI_RXTIME
RegisterGroup.description: SCI_RXTIME is a receive FIFO read timeout threshold register. When characters in thereceive FIFO are not read within the time defined by SCI_RXTIME, a receive FIFO readtimeout interrupt is triggered and SCI_RIS[rtoutris] is set to 1.Caution:In the normal use of the receive FIFO read timeout interrupt function, SCI_RXTIME[rxtime]cannot be set to 0x0000.

Member.name: rxtime
Member.description: Receive FIFO read timeout value (with SCI card clock SCI_CLK cycle as the unit).

RegisterGroup.name: SPICR0

Member.name: scr
Member.description:
Serial clock rate ranging from 0 to 255. The SCR value is used to generate the transmit and receive bit rates of the SPI. The bit rate is FSPICLK/(CPSDVSR x (1 + SCR)).
CPSDVSR is an even value ranging from 2 to 254, set by the SPICPSR register.

Member.name: sph
Member.description: SPICLKOUT phase. For details, see the SPI frame formats in section 10.11.4 "Timing of Three Types of Peripheral Buses."

Member.name: spo
Member.description: SPICLKOUT polarity. For details, see the SPI frame formats in section 10.11.4 "Timing of Three Types of Peripheral Buses."

Member.name: frf
Member.description:
Frame format selection.
00: Motorola SPI frame format.
01: TI synchronous serial frame format.
10: National Microwire frame format.
11: reserved.

Member.name: dss
Member.description:
Data bit width.
0011: 4 bits.
1000: 9 bits.
1101: 14 bits.
0100: 5 bits.
1001: 10 bits.
1110: 15 bits.
0101: 6 bits.
1010: 11 bits.
1111: 16 bits.
0110: 7 bits.
1011: 12 bits.
0111: 8 bits.
1100: 13 bits.
Other values: reserved.

Member.name: waitval
Member.description: Number of beats of the waiting time between the read operation and the write operation when the National Microwire frame format is used. These bits take effect when WaitEn value is 1 and the National Microwire frame format is used.

Member.name: bigend

Little endian and the large endian modes.
0: The little endian mode ends.

Member.name: sse

SPI enable.
0: disabled.

Member.name: lbm
Member.description:
Loopback mode.

Member.name: rorim
Member.description:
Receive overrun interrupt mask.

When the bit value is 1, the hardware flow control function is enabled, that is, the SPI stops transmitting data after the receive FIFO is full.

Member.description: Receive overrun interrupt clear.

RegisterGroup.name: SPIDMACR
RegisterGroup.description: SPIDMACR is a DMA control register.

Member.name: txdmae
Member.description:
DMA transmit FIFO enable.
0: disabled.
1: enabled.

Member.name: rxdmae
Member.description:
DMA receive FIFO enable.
0: disabled.
1: enabled.

RegisterGroup.name: SPITXFIFOCR
RegisterGroup.description: SPITXFIFOCR is a transmit FIFO control register.

Member.name: txintsize
Member.description:
Threshold for the transmit FIFO to transmit the interrupt request. That is, when the number of data segments in the transmit FIFO is smaller than or equal to the value of TXINTSize, TXRIS takes effect.
000: 1.
001: 4.
010: 8.
011: 16.
100: 32.
101: 64.
110: 64.
111: 64.

Member.name: dmatxbrsize
Member.description:
Threshold for the transmit FIFO to transmit the request for the DMA burst transfer. That is, when the number of data segments in the transmit FIFO is smaller than or equal to the number of words determined by the result of (256 – DMATXBRSize), DMATXBREQ takes effect. The word length is 16 bits.
000: 1.
001: 4.
010: 8.
011: 16.
100: 32.
101: 64.
110: 128.
111: 128.

RegisterGroup.name: SPIRXFIFOCR
RegisterGroup.description: SPIRXFIFOCR is a receive FIFO control register.

Member.name: rxintsize
Member.description:
Threshold for the receive FIFO to transmit interrupt request. That is, when the number of data segments in the receive FIFO is greater than or equal to the number of words determined by the result of (256 – RXINTSize), RXRIS takes effect. The word length is 16 bits.
000: 1.
001: 4.
010: 8.
011: 16.
100: 32.
101: 64.
110: 64.
111: 64.

Member.name: dmarxbrsize
Member.description:
Threshold for the receive FIFO to transmit the request for the DMA burst transfer. That is, when the number of data segments in the receive FIFO is greater than or equal to the number of words specified by DMARXBRSize, DMARXBREQ takes effect.
000: 1.
001: 4.
010: 8.
011: 16.
100: 32.
101: 64.
110: 128.
111: 224.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_DR
RegisterGroup.description: UART_DR is a UART data register used to store the receive data and transmit data. Thereception status can be read from this register.

Member.name: oe
Member.description:
Overrun error.
0: No overrun error occurs.
1: An overrun error occurs. The full receive FIFO receives an additional data segment.

Member.name: be
Member.description:
Break error.
0: No break error occurs.
1: A break error occurs. The period for maintaining the low level of the input of the receive data is longer than the transfer time of a full word (including start bit, data, parity bit and stop bit).

Member.name: pe
Member.description:
Parity check error.
0: No parity check error occurs.
1: A parity check error occurs.

Member.name: fe
Member.description:
Frame error.
0: No frame error occurs.
1: A frame error occurs (incorrect stop bit).

Member.name: data
Member.description: Receive data and transmit data.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_RSR
RegisterGroup.description: UART_RSR is a receive status register/error clear register.When the read operation is performed, the register functions as the receive status register.When the write operation is performed, the register functions as the error clear register.The receive status can also be read from UART_DR. The status information about the break,frame and parity read from UART_DR has a higher priority than the information read fromUART_RSR (that is, the status change in UART_DR is faster than that in UART_RSR).Any write operations performed on the UART_RSR register will reset the register.

Member.name: oe
Member.description:
Overrun error.
0: No overrun error occurs.
1: An overrun error occurs.
When the FIFO is full, the contents in the FIFO are kept valid because no more data will be written to the FIFO. The offset register, however, will overrun. The CPU must read the data immediately to empty the FIFO.

Member.name: be
Member.description:
Break error.
0: No break error occurs.
1: A break error occurs.
Occurrence condition of break errors: The period for maintaining the low level of the input of the receive data is longer than the transfer time of a full word (with defined start bit, data, parity bit and stop bit).

Member.name: pe
Member.description:
Parity check error.
0: No parity check error occurs.
1: A parity check error occurs in the receive data.
In FIFO mode, the parity check error is related to the data at the top of the FIFO.

Member.name: fe
Member.description:
Frame error.
0: No frame error occurs.
1: The stop bit in the received data is incorrect (the valid stop bit is 1).

RegisterGroup.name: UART_FR
RegisterGroup.description: UART_FR is a UART flag register.

Member.name: txfe
Member.description:
The meaning of this bit is determined by the UART_LCR_H[fen] status.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the transmit holding register is empty.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the transmit FIFO is empty.

Member.name: rxff
Member.description:
The meaning of this bit is determined by the UART_LCR_H[FEN] status.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the receive holding register is full.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the receive FIFO is full.

Member.name: txff
Member.description:
The meaning of this bit is determined by the UART_LCR_H[FEN] status.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the transmit holding register is full.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the transmit FIFO is full.

Member.name: rxfe
Member.description:
The meaning of this bit is determined by the UART_LCR_H[FEN] status.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit is set to 1 when the receive holding register is empty.
If UART_LCR_H[fen] is 1, this bit is set to 1 when the receive FIFO is empty.

Member.name: busy
Member.description:
UART busy/idle state.
0: The UART is idle or the data transmission is complete.
1: The UART is busy with data transmission.
After this bit is set, the state persists until the whole byte (including all the stop bits) is completely transmitted from the offset register.
This bit is set once the transmit FIFO is not empty, no matter whether the UART is enabled or not.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_IBRD
RegisterGroup.description: UART_IBRD is an integral baud rate register.

Member.name: bauddivint
Member.description: Clock divider of the integral baud rate. All the bits are cleared during reset.

Member.name: banddivfrac
Member.description: Clock divider of the fraction baud rate. All the bits are cleared during reset.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_LCR_H
RegisterGroup.description: UART_LCR_H is a transfer mode control register. The registers UART_LCR_H,UART_IBRD and UART_FBRD, you should also update UART_LCR_H at the same time.Total Reset Value

Member.name: sps
Member.description:
Parity check select.
When bit[1], bit[2] and bit[7] of this register are set, the parity bit will be transmitted and detected as 0.
When bit[1] and bit[7] of this register are set and bit[2] is 0, the parity bit will be transmitted and detected as 1.
When bit[1], bit[2] and bit[7] are all cleared, the stick parity is disabled.

Member.name: wlen
Member.description:
Number of bits in a received or transmitted data frame.
00: 5 bits.
01: 6 bits.
10: 7 bits.
11: 8 bits.

Member.name: fen
Member.description:
Transmit and receive FIFOs enable control.
0: The transmit and receive FIFOs are disabled.
1: The transmit and receive FIFOs are enabled.

Member.name: stp2
Member.description:
Presence of the 2-bit wide stop bit at the end of a transmitted frame.
0: No 2-bit wide stop bit exists at the end of a transmitted frame.
1: A 2-bit wide stop bit exists at the end of a transmitted frame.
The receive logic does not check the 2-bit wide stop bit during data reception.

Member.name: eps
Member.description:
Selection of the odd or even parity check in the data transmitting and receiving processes.
0: The odd parity bit is generated or checked in the data transmitting and receiving processes.
1: The even parity bit is generated or checked in the data transmitting and receiving processes.
When UART_LCR_H[fen] is 0, this bit does take effect.

Member.name: pen
Member.description:
Parity check select bit.
0: The parity check is not used.
1: The transmit direction generates a parity bit, and the receive direction performs parity check.

Member.name: brk
Member.description:
Transmission break.
0: no effect.
1: After the current data is transmitted, the UTXD continuously outputs low levels.
Note: The software must set this bit to 1 and maintain the value for a period longer than the transfer time of two full frames to ensure that the break command is correctly performed. Generally, this bit should be cleared.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_CR
RegisterGroup.description: UART_CR is a UART control register.Perform the following steps to configure UART_CR:Write 0 to UART_CR[uarten] to disable the UART.Wait for the current data to be completely transmitted or received.Clear UART_LCR_H[fen].Configure UART_CR.Write 1 to UART_CR[uarten] to enable the UART.----End

Member.name: ctsen
Member.description:
CTS hardware flow control enable.
0: The CTS hardware flow control is not enabled.
1: The CTS hardware flow control is enabled. Data is transmitted only when the nUARTCTS signal is valid.

Member.name: rtsen
Member.description:
RTS hardware flow control enable.
0: The RTS hardware flow control is not enabled.
1: The RTS hardware flow control is enabled. The request for data reception is transmitted only when the receive FIFO has room for the data.

Member.name: rts
Member.description:
Request to transmit.
This bit indicates the negating of the status output signal nUARTRTS of the UART modem.
0: The output signal is not changed.
1: This bit is set to 1. As a result, the output signal is 0.

Member.name: dtr
Member.description:
Data transmission preparation.
This bit indicates the negating of the status output signal nUARTDTR of the UART modem.
0: The output signal is not changed.
1: This bit is set to 1. As a result, the output signal is 0.

Member.name: rxe
Member.description:
UART receive enable.
0: disabled.
1: enabled.
If the UART is disabled during data reception, the reception of the current data will terminate before the reception properly stops.

Member.name: txe
Member.description:
UART transmit enable.
0: disabled.
1: enabled.
If the UART is disabled during data transmission, the transmission of the current data will terminate before the transmission properly stops.

Member.name: lbe
Member.description:
Loopback enable.
0: disabled.
1: The UARTTXD output is looped back to UARTRXD.

Member.name: uarten
Member.description:
UART enable.
0: disabled.
1: enabled.
If the UART is disabled during data transmission or reception, the transmission or reception of the current data will terminate before the transmission or reception properly stops.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_IFLS
RegisterGroup.description: UART_IFLS is a FIFP interrupt threshold selection register used to set the trigger lines(UART_TXINTR or UART_RXINTR) of FIFO interrupts.

Member.name: rxiflsel
Member.description:
Threshold selection for the receive interrupt FIFO. The trigger points for the receive interrupts are as follows:
000: receive FIFO ≥ 1/8full
001: receive FIFO ≥ 1/4full
010: receive FIFO ≥ 1/2full
011: receive FIFO ≥ 3/4full
100: receive FIFO ≥ 7/8full
101–111: reserved.

Member.name: txiflsel
Member.description:
Threshold selection for the transmit interrupt FIFO. The trigger points for the transmit interrupts are as follows:
000: transmit FIFO ( 1/8full
001: transmit FIFO ( 1/4full
011: transmit FIFO ( 3/4full
010: transmit FIFO ( 1/2full
100: transmit FIFO ( 7/8full
101–111: reserved.

RegisterGroup.name: UART_DMACR
RegisterGroup.description: UART_DMACR is a DMA control register used to enable the DMA of the transmit FIFO andthe receive FIFO.

Member.name: dmaonerr
Member.description:
Receive channel DMA enable control upon the occurrence of the UART error interrupt (UARTEINTR).
0: The output request of the receive channel DMA (UARTRXDMASREQ or UARRTXDMABREQ) is valid when the UART error interrupt (UARTEINTR) is valid.
1: The output request of the receive channel DMA (UARTRXDMASREQ or UARRTXDMABREQ) is invalid when the UART error interrupt (UARTEINTR) is valid.

Member.name: txdmae
Member.description:
DMA enable control of the receive FIFO.

1: enabled.

Member.name: rxdmae
Member.description:
DMA enable control of the transmit FIFO.
0: disabled.
1: enabled.

RegisterGroup.name: INSNREG00
RegisterGroup.description: INSNREG00 is a micro-frame length configuration register.

Member.name: val
Member.description: Value of the micro-frame counter. This register is used only for emulation. In normal working conditions, the micro-frame length is 125 μs defined by the protocol. During emulation, you can configure the register to change the micro-frame length to shorten the emulation period.

Member.name: en
Member.description:
Enable the register.
0: disabled.
1: enabled.

RegisterGroup.name: INSNREG04

Member.name: auto_en
Member.description:
Automatic gauge enable.
0: enabled. (When the software resets the run/stop bit and the hchalted bit is not set, the suspend signal takes effect.)
1: disabled. (That is, the port is not suspended when the software clears the run/stop bit.)
The default value is 0.

Member.name: nak_reldfix_en
Member.description:
NAK reloading enable.

1: disabled.

Member.name: scaledwn_enum_time

Reduce the port enumeration time.

1: enabled.

HCCPARAMS register write enable.

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_CRG12
RegisterGroup.description: PERI_CRG12 is an AO0 clock divider configuration register.

Member.name: ao_ckcfg0
Member.description: Clock divider of AO MCLK0. The configured value is calculated as follows: (MCLK0/frequency of the SIO clock source) x 2^27.

RegisterGroup.name: PERI_CRG13
RegisterGroup.description: PERI_CRG13 is an AO0 clock select configuration register.

Member.name: fsclk_div0
Member.description:
Division relationship between the bit clock BCLK and the sampling clock FS.
000: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 16.
001: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 32.
010: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 48.
011: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 64.
100: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 128.
101: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 256.
Other values: The FS is generated by dividing the BCLK by 8.

Member.name: bclk_div0
Member.description:
Division relationship between the main clock MCLK and the bit clock BCLK.
0000: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 1.
0001: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 3.
0010: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 2.
0011: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 4.
0100: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 6.
0101: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 8.
0110: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 12.
0111: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 16.
1000: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 24.
1001: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 32.
1010: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 48.
1011: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 64.
Other values: The BCLK is generated by dividing the MCLK by 8.

Member.name: ao0_cken
Member.description:
AO0 clock status.
0: disabled
1: enabled
