1: empty

Member.name: fifo_tx_watermark
Member.description:
Whether the FIFO reaches the transmit watermark level.
0: no
1: yes

Member.name: fifo_rx_watermark
Member.description:
Whether the FIFO reaches the receive watermark level.
0: no
1: yes

RegisterGroup.name: MMC_FIFOTH
RegisterGroup.description: MMC_FIFOTH is a FIFO threshold register.

Member.name: rx_wmark
Member.description:
FIFO threshold watermark level during data read. If the data amount in the FIFO is above the threshold, a DMA request is enabled. After a data transfer, a DMA request is raised for transferring the remaining data no matter whether the threshold is reached.
In non-DMA mode, the RXDR interrupt is enabled. If the data amount in the FIFO is not above the threshold after a data transfer, no interrupt is generated. In this case, the software needs to read the remaining data by querying the DTD interrupt.
If a data transfer is complete in DMA mode, the DMA raises a single transfer request to read data until the DTD interrupt is generated even though the remaining data amount is below the threshold.
Restriction: RX_WMark ( FIFO_DEPTH – 2
Recommendation: A request is raised when the threshold is (FIFO_DEPTH/2) – 1.

Member.name: tx_wmark
Member.description:
FIFO threshold watermark level during data transmittal. If the data amount in the FIFO is below the threshold, a DMA request is enabled. After a data transfer, a DMA request is raised for transferring the remaining data no matter whether the threshold is reached.
In non-DMA mode, the RXDR interrupt is enabled. If the data amount in the FIFO is not above the threshold after a data transfer, no interrupt is generated. In this case, the software needs to read the remaining data by querying the DTD interrupt.
If a data transfer is complete in DMA mode, the DMA raises a single transfer request to read data until the DTD interrupt is generated even though the remaining data amount is below the threshold.
Restriction: TX_WMark ( FIFO_DEPTH – 2
Recommendation: A request is raised when the value of [(FIFO_DEPTH/2) – 1] is above the threshold.

RegisterGroup.name: MMC_CDETECT
RegisterGroup.description: MMC_CDETECT is a card detection register.

Member.name: card_detect_n
Member.description:
Card detection signal.
The value depends on the SDIO_CARD_DETECT pin.

RegisterGroup.name: MMC_WRTPRT
RegisterGroup.description: MMC_WRTPRT is a card write protection register.

Member.name: write_protect
Member.description:
Card write protection signal.
The value depends on the SDIO_CWPR pin.

RegisterGroup.name: MMC_TCBCNT
RegisterGroup.description: MMC_TCBCNT is a count of bytes transmitted to the card register.

Member.name: trans_card_byte_count
Member.description:
Count of bytes transmitted from the CIU to the card.
When this register is accessed through a 32-bit AHB, the 32-bit data needs to be read at a time. This avoids the read-coherency error.

RegisterGroup.name: MMC_TBBCNT
RegisterGroup.description: MMC_TBBCNT is a count of bytes transmitted from the BIU FIFO register.

Member.name: trans_fifo_byte_count
Member.description:
Count of bytes transferred between the CPU/DMA and BIU FIFO.
When this register is accessed through a 32-bit AHB, the 32-bit data needs to be read at a time. This avoids the read-coherency error.

RegisterGroup.name: MMC_BMOD
RegisterGroup.description: MMC_BMOD is a bus mode register.

Member.name: pbl
Member.description:
Length of the IDMAC burst transfer.
000: 1 transfer
001: 4 transfers
010: 8 transfers
011: 16 transfers
1xx: reserved.

Member.name: de
Member.description:
IDMAC enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: dsl
Member.description: Span between two descriptors, that is, number of words between two non-linked descriptors. This field is valid only for the dual-buffer descriptors.

Member.name: fb
Member.description:
Fixed burst length type.
0: single and INCR burst types
1: single, INCR4, INCR8, and INCR16 burst types

Member.name: swr
Member.description:
Soft reset control for the internal register of the IDMAC.
0: not reset
1: reset
After reset, this bit is automatically cleared one clock cycle later.

RegisterGroup.name: MMC_PLDMND
RegisterGroup.description: MMC_PLDMND is poll demand register.

Member.name: pd
Member.description: If DES0[OWN] is 0, the IDMAC enters the suspend state. The CPU can write any value to this register to enable the IDMAC to obtain descriptors again.

RegisterGroup.name: MMC_DBADDR
RegisterGroup.description: MMC_DBADDR is a base address register of the descriptor linked list.

Member.name: sdl
Member.description: Start address of the descriptor linked list, that is, the base address of the first descriptor.

RegisterGroup.name: MMC_IDSTS
RegisterGroup.description: MMC_IDSTS is an IDMAC status register.

Member.name: fsm
Member.description:
Current state of the IDMAC state machine.
0: DMA_IDLE
1: DMA_SUSPEND
2: DESC_RD
3: DESC_CHK
4: DMA_RD_REQ_WAIT
5: DMA_WR_REQ_WAIT
6: DMA_RD
7: DMA_WR
8: DESC_CLOSE

Member.name: eb
Member.description:
Bus error type.
001: The transmit operation is aborted.
010: The receive operation is aborted.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: ais
Member.description: Abnormal total interrupt. The value of this bit is obtained after the values of FBE, DE, and CES bits are ORed. Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: nis
Member.description: Normal total interrupt. The value of this bit is obtained after the values of the TI and RI bits are ORed. Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: ces
Member.description: Card error indicator. This bit indicates the card status when data is being received.

Member.name: du
Member.description: Descriptor invalid interrupt. When DES0[OWN] is 0, this bit is set to 1. Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: fbe
Member.description: Fatal bus error interrupt. If this bit is set to 1, the IDMAC stops all accesses through the bus. Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: ri
Member.description: Receive done interrupt. This bit indicates that the data for a descriptor is received. Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: ti
Member.description: Transmit done interrupt. This bit indicates that a descriptor finishes transmitting data. Writing 1 clears this bit.

RegisterGroup.name: MMC_IDINTEN
RegisterGroup.description: MMC_IDINTEN is an IDMAC interrupt enable register.

Member.name: ai
Member.description:
Abnormal interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: The FBE/DU/CES interrupts are enabled.

Member.name: ni
Member.description:
Normal interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: The TI/RI interrupts are enabled.

Member.name: ces
Member.description:
Card error interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: du
Member.description:
Descriptor invalid interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: fbe
Member.description:
Fatal bus error interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ri
Member.description:
Receive interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ti
Member.description:
Transmit interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: MMC_DSCADDR
RegisterGroup.description: MMC_DSCADDR is an address register of the current descriptor.

Member.name: had
Member.description: Descriptor pointer. The value is automatically refreshed during data transfer. The register points to the start address of the descriptor that will be used by the IDMAC.

RegisterGroup.name: MMC_BUFADDR
RegisterGroup.description: MMC_BUFADDR is an address register of the current data buffer.

Member.name: hba
Member.description: Data buffer pointer. The value is automatically refreshed during data transfer. The register points to the start address of the data buffer that is being used by the IDMAC.

RegisterGroup.name: MMC_DATA
RegisterGroup.description: MMC_DATA is a data register for storing the FIFO entrance address. Before the FIFO is reador written, MMC_STATUS[fifo_count] must be read to query the remaining space of theFIFO. This confirms the data bytes to be read or written based on the remaining space. In thisway, FIFO overflow is avoided.

Member.name: data
Member.description: Address for reading/writing to the FIFO. If the address ranges from 0x100 to 0x100+FIFO_DEPTH, the FIFO is selected.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_CON
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_CON is an NANDC configuration register.

Member.name: edo_en
Member.description:
NAND flash data read enable in EDO mode.
0: normal mode
1: EDO mode
This function must be used according to the requirements of specific memories.

Member.name: ecc_type
Member.description:
ECC mode select.
000: non-ECC mode
001: 1-bit mode
010: 4-bit mode
011: reserved
100: 24-bit mode for 1 KB
101–111: reserved
The reset value depends on the pin NFC_ECC_TYPE.

Member.name: rb_sel
Member.description:
This field is valid when multiple external NAND flash memories (multiple CSs) are connected.
0: The NAND flash memories share a ready/busy signal.
1: The NAND flash memories use their own ready/busy signals.
When only one NAND flash is connected, only cs0 and ready/busy 0 are used.

Member.name: cs_ctrl
Member.description:
CS control.
0: When the NAND flash is busy, the CS signal is fixed at 0.
1: When the NAND flash is busy, the CS signal to is set to 1.
This mode maps to the "cs do not care" mode of the NAND flash.

Member.name: bus_width
Member.description:
Data line width of the NAND flash.
0: 8 bits
1: 16 bits
The reset value depends on the pin NFC_BUS_WIDE.

Member.name: pagesize
Member.description:
Page size of the NAND flash.
01: 2 KB
10: 4 KB
11: 8 KB
Other values: reserved
The reset value depends on the pin NFC_PAGE_SIZE.

Member.name: op_mode
Member.description:
Operating mode of the NANDC.
0: boot mode
1: normal mode

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_PWIDTH
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_PWIDTH is a read/write pulse width configuration register.

Member.name: rw_hcnt
Member.description:
High-level width of the read/write signal of the NAND flash.
0x0–0xF: 1–16 clock cycles.

Member.name: r_lcnt
Member.description:
Low-level width of the read signal of the NAND flash.
0x0–0xF: 1–16 clock cycles.

Member.name: w_lcnt
Member.description:
Low-level width of the write signal of the NAND flash.
0x0–0xF: 1–16 clock cycles.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_OPIDLE
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_OPIDLE is an operation interval configuration register.

Member.name: frb_wait
Member.description: When a number of cycles are delayed after a read/write command is sent, the ready signal is detected to check whether it becomes high. The number of delay cycles is frb_wait x 8.

Member.name: cmd1_wait
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles after command 1 is sent.
0x0–0xF: 1–16 clock cycles.

Member.name: addr_wait
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles after the address is sent.
0x0–0xF: 1–16 clock cycles.

Member.name: write_data_wait
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles after data is written.
0x0–0xF: 1–16 clock cycles.

Member.name: cmd2_wait
Member.description:
Number of wait cycles after command 2 is sent.
0x0–0xF: 1–16 clock cycles.

Member.name: frb_idle
Member.description:
A read signal can be sent only when a number of cycles are delayed after the ready signal of the NAND flash becomes high.
The number of delay cycles is frb_idle x 8.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_CMD
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_CMD is a command word configuration register.

Member.name: read_status_cmd
Member.description: Read status command word.

Member.name: cmd2
Member.description: Command 2 that is sent to the NAND flash by the NANDC.

Member.name: cmd1
Member.description: Command 1 that is sent to the NAND flash by the NANDC.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_ADDRL
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_ADDRL is a lower-bit address configuration register.

Member.name: addr_l
Member.description: Lower 32-bit address of the NAND flash.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_ADDRH
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_ADDRH is a upper-bit address configuration register.

Member.name: addr_h
Member.description: Upper 16-bit address of the NAND flash.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_DATA_NUM
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_DATA_NUM is a read/written data count configuration register.

Member.name: nfc_data_num
Member.description:
Number of data segments that are read and written randomly by the NANDC. The maximum value is 2368 bytes.
Note: This field is valid only when ecc_type is 00.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_OP
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_OP is an operation register.

Member.name: address_cycles
Member.description: Number of address cycles sent to the NAND flash.

Member.name: nf_cs
Member.description:
NAND flash CS signal select.
00: cs0
01: cs1
Other values: reserved

Member.name: cmd1_en
Member.description:
Command 1 transmit enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: addr_en
Member.description:
NAND flash address write enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: write_data_en
Member.description:
NAND flash data write enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: read_data_en and write_data_en cannot be 1 at the same time.

Member.name: cmd2_en
Member.description:
Command 2 transmit enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: wait_ready_en
Member.description:
Wait ready/busy high enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: read_data_en
Member.description:
NAND flash data read enable by enabling the read status machine.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: read_data_en and write_data_en cannot be 1 at the same time.

Member.name: read_status_en
Member.description:
When this bit is 1, the command 0x70 for reading the status is sent to the NAND flash and the status data is read from the NAND flash. After that, the returned data is written to the NFC_STATUS field of the NANDC status register instead of the internal buffer.
After the NAND flash is erased and programmed, the results need to be read to check whether the operations are successful. If this bit is enabled, the operations such as erasing and programming can be performed at a time, and the data indicating whether the operation is successful can be returned from the NAND flash. In this way, the CPU intervention is reduced.
Note: When read_data_en is 1, this bit is invalid.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_STATUS
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_STATUS is a status register.

Member.name: nf_status
Member.description:
Status data read from the NAND flash.
This field is valid only when both NFC_OP[read_status] and NFC_STATUS[nfc_ready] are 1.

Member.name: nf1_ready
Member.description:
Status of the ready/busy signal of the NAND flash corresponding to CS1.
This bit is valid when multiple flash memories are connected and they use their own ready_busy signals.
This is because multiple NAND flash memories share a ready/busy signal by default. The reset value of the bit is 0.

Member.name: nf0_ready
Member.description:
Status of the ready/busy signal of the NAND flash corresponding to CS0.
This bit is valid when multiple flash memories are connected and they use their own ready_busy signals.
This is because multiple NAND flash memories share a ready/busy signal by default. The reset value of the bit is 0.

Member.name: nfc_ready
Member.description:
Status of the ready/busy signal of the NANDC.
0: The NANDC is working.
1: The operation is complete and the next command can be received.
When the NANDC is enabled by writing to NFC_OP, this bit is cleared automatically.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_INTEN
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_INTEN is an interrupt enable register.

Member.name: wr_lock_en
Member.description:
Lock address write error interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ahb_op_en
Member.description:
CPU read/write NANDC buffer error interrupt enable when the NANDC is reading/writing data from/to the NAND flash.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: err_invalid
Member.description: Uncorrectable error interrupt.

Member.name: err_valid
Member.description: Correctable error interrupt.

Member.name: cs1_done_en
Member.description:
CS 1 ready/busy signal going high interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: cs0_done_en
Member.description:
CS 0 ready/busy signal going high interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: op_done_en
Member.description:
Current operation terminal interrupt enable of the NANDC.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_INTS
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_INTS is an interrupt status register.

Member.name: wr_lock_en
Member.description:
Interrupt generated when the lock address is written.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: ahb_op_en
Member.description:
Interrupt generated when the CPU reads and writes the NANDC buffer in the process of reading/writing data from/to the NAND flash by the NANDC.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: err_invalid
Member.description:
Uncorrectable error interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
In 1-bit ECC mode, if errors occur in two or more bits of the checked 512-byte data, an interrupt is generated.
In 4-bit ECC mode, if errors occur in five or more bits of the checked 512-byte data, an interrupt is generated.
In 8-bit ECC mode, if errors occur in eight or more bits of the checked 512-byte data, an interrupt is generated.

Member.name: err_vavid
Member.description:
Correctable error interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
In 1-bit ECC mode, if an error occurs in one bit of the checked 512-byte data, an interrupt is generated.
In 4-bit ECC mode, if errors occur in one to four bits of the checked 512-byte data, an interrupt is generated.
In 8-bit ECC mode, if errors occur in one to eight bits of the checked 512-byte data, an interrupt is generated.

Member.name: cs1_done
Member.description:
CS 1 ready/busy signal going high interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
This bit is valid when two flash memories are connected and the two flash memories use their own ready/busy signals. Otherwise, the bit is fixed at 0.

Member.name: cs0_done
Member.description:
CS 0 ready/busy signal going high interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
This bit is valid when two flash memories are connected and the two flash memories use their own ready/busy signals. Otherwise, the bit is fixed at 0.

Member.name: op_done
Member.description:
Current operation terminal interrupt of the NANDC.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
After NFC_OP is written, this bit is automatically cleared.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_INTCLR
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_INTCLR is an interrupt clear register.

Member.name: wr_lock_en
Member.description:
wr_lock_en interrupt clear.
0: not cleared
1: cleared

Member.name: ahb_op_en
Member.description:
ahb_op_en interrupt clear.
0: not cleared
1: cleared

Member.name: r_5bit_err_clr
Member.description:
r_5bit_err interrupt clear.
0: not cleared
1: cleared

Member.name: r_4bit_err_clr
Member.description:
r_4bit_err interrupt clear.
0: not cleared
1: cleared

Member.name: cs1_done_clr
Member.description:
cs1_done interrupt clear.
0: not cleared
1: cleared

Member.name: cs0_done_clr
Member.description:
cs0_done interrupt clear.
0: not cleared
1: cleared

op_done interrupt clear.

1: cleared

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_LOCK

Member.name: lock_excmd_en
Member.description:
Protection address write-protection enable according to the extended write command (new commands may be added to new memories).
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: lock_en
Member.description:
Flash lock enable. When this control bit is 1, if the erased or programmed address is between the start lock address and the end lock address, the erasing and programming operations are invalid.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: global_lock_en
Member.description:
Flash global lock enable. When this bit is 1, the NAND flash cannot be erased or programmed.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: lock_down
Member.description:
NAND flash lock mode.
0: lock mode
1: lock-down mode. After the value 1 is written, this bit cannot be written any more. In addition, this bit can be cleared only when hardware is reset.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_EXPCMD

Member.name: ex_pcmd3
Member.description: Extended page write command 3 of the NAND flash.

Member.name: ex_pcmd2
Member.description: Extended page write command 2 of the NAND flash.

Member.name: ex_pcmd1
Member.description: Extended page write command 1 of the NAND flash.

Member.name: ex_pcmd0
Member.description: Extended page write command 0 of the NAND flash.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_EXBCMD
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_EXPCMD is an extended block command register.

Member.description: Extended block write command 1 of the NAND flash.

Member.description: Extended block write command 0 of the NAND flash.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_ECC_TEST
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_ECC_TEST is an ECC test register.

Member.name: ecc_mask
Member.description:
ECC function mask.
0: Whether the ECC check and correction are performed depends on the value of ecc_type.
1: The ECC check and correction are forbidden. The structure of the data read from or written to the NAND flash is still converted based on the format of ecc_type.

Member.name: dec_only
Member.description:
Decoding only enable.
When 1 is written to this bit, ECC encoding is enabled, but the NAND flash is not read or written.
When the bit is read, the value 0 is returned.

Member.name: enc_only
Member.description:
Encoding only enable.
When 1 is written to this bit, ECC encoding is enabled, but the NAND flash is not read or written.
When this bit is read, the return value 1 indicates that ECC encoding and decoding are complete and the value 0 indicates that ECC encoding and decoding are being performed.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_DMA_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_DMA_CTRL is a DMA control register.

Member.name: wr_cmd_disable
Member.description:
0: The NANDC initiates a complete timing for reading/writing to the NAND flash.
1: The NANDC initiates a timing for reading/writing data rather than command.
That is, the NANDC initiates CS signals and read/write pulse signals for reading/writing data rather than the CLE and ALE signals.

Member.name: rw_nf_disable
Member.description:
0: The DMA operation and the read/write operation on the NAND flash are performed at the same time.
1 Data is transferred between the buffer and DDR, but the NAND flash is not read or written.

Member.name: dma_nf_cs
Member.description:
NAND flash CS select for operating the DMA.
00: CS0
01: CS1
Other values: reserved

Member.name: dma_addr_num
Member.description:
Number of addresses.
0: five addresses
1: four addresses

Member.name: burst16_en
Member.description:
Burst 16 enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: burst8_en
Member.description:
Burst 8 enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: burst4_en
Member.description:
Burst 4 enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: oob_area_en
Member.description: OOB area write enable. This bit is valid only in 1-bit ECC mode.

Member.name: data_area_en
Member.description: Data area write enable. This bit is valid only in 1-bit ECC mode.

Member.name: dma_wr_en
Member.description:
DMA read/write enable.
0: read
1: write

Member.name: dma_start
Member.description:
DMA operation start.
When the value 1 is written to this bit, the DMA operations are started. The bit remains 1 until the DMA operations are complete. Writing 0 to this bit has no effect.
If the value 0 is returned after this bit is read, the DMA operations are complete.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_BADDR_D
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_BADDR_D is a base address register of the data transfer area in DMA mode.

Member.name: base_addr_d
Member.description: Base address of the DDR data area that stores the data to be read or written.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_BADDR_OOB
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_BADDR_OOB is a base address register of the OOB area in DMA mode.

Member.name: base_addr_oob
Member.description:
Base address of OOB area that stores the data to be read.
This register is valid only when the NAND flash is written in DMA mode.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_DMA_LEN
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_DMA_LEN is a transfer length register in DMA mode.

Member.name: len_oob
Member.description: Length of the OOB area when the NAND flash is written in DMA mode. The long words must be 4-byte aligned. This field is valid only in ECC0 mode. In other modes, the OOB length is fixed.

Member.name: len_data
Member.description:
Length of the data to be read or written in DMA mode.
This field is valid only when rw_nf_disable is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_OP_PARA
RegisterGroup.description: NF_OP_PARA is an operation parameter register.

Member.name: ext_len
Member.description:
Length of the extended data area to be corrected.
In 24-bit ECC mode, this field indicates the length of the extended data area in each ECC data block. In boot mode, when the page size is 4 KB, the default length is 8 bytes; when the page size is 8 KB, the default length is 4 bytes.
01: 4 bytes
11: 8 bytes
Other values: reserved

Member.name: oob_ecc_en
Member.description:
ECC correction enable in OOB area.
0: disabled
1: enabled
This field is valid only when data is read.

Member.name: data_ecc_en
Member.description:
ECC correction enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
This field is valid only when data is read.

Member.name: oob_edc_en
Member.description:
OOB area check enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
In programming mode, the function of generating the ECC code of the OOB area is enabled.
In data read mode, the check on the OOB area is enabled.

Member.name: data_edc_en
Member.description:
Check enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
In programming mode, ECC code is generated.
In data read mode, the check is enabled.

Member.name: oob_rw_en
Member.description:
Read/write redundancy enable for the data area of the NAND flash.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: data_rw_en
Member.description:
Read/write enable for the data area of the NAND flash.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_VERSION
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_VERSION is a version register.

Member.name: version_id
Member.description: Version number.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_BUF_BADDR
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_BUF_BADDR is a NANDC buffer base address register.

Member.name: buf_baddr_rd
Member.description:
Indicates the base address from which the buffer is read in DMA mode when rw_nf_disable is 1.
Indicates undefined when rw_nf_disable is 0.

Member.name: buf_baddr_wr
Member.description:
Indicates the base address from which the buffer is written in DMA mode when rw_nf_disable is 1.
Indicates undefined when rw_nf_disable is 0.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_RD_LOGIC_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_RD_LOGIC_ADDR is a logic address register for reading the NAND flash in DMAmode

Member.name: rd_logic_addr
Member.description:
Start address (including the ECC code) for reading data. For example, if you want to read data from the bad block flag, you can set the field value to 2,048 for the 2 KB page size or 4,096 for the 4 KB page size. After data is read in DMA mode, the field value is automatically accumulated based on the value of the len_data field of NFC_DMA_LEN.
The rd_logic_addr field is valid only when data is read in DMA mode and the rw_nf_disable field of NFC_DMA_CTRL is 0.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_RD_LOGIC_LEN
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_RD_LOGIC_LEN is a logic length register for reading the NAND flash in DMA mode.

Member.name: rd_logic_len
Member.description:
Length (excluding the length of the ECC code) of the data read from the NAND flash in DMA mode. After data is read in DMA mode, the field value is returned to 0 automatically.
The rd_logic_len field is valid only when data is read in DMA mode and the rw_nf_disable field of NFC_DMA_CTRL is 0.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_FIFO_EMPTY
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_FIFO_EMPTY is an internal FIFO status register.

Member.name: empty_dbg
Member.description: Empty status of the internal FIFO, for debugging only.

RegisterGroup.name: NFC_BOOT_SET
RegisterGroup.description: NFC_BOOT_SET is a boot parameter configuration register.

Member.name: addr_num
Member.description:
Number of addresses sent to the NAND flash by the NANDC during booting.
0: four address cycles
1: five address cycles
The reset value depends on the nfc_addr_num pin.

Member.name: block_size
Member.description:
Bus width of the NAND flash during booting.
0: 64 pages
1: 128 pages
The reset value depends on the nfc_block_size pin.

RegisterGroup.name: NF_STATUS
RegisterGroup.description: NF_STATUS is a NAND flash status register.

Member.name: status
Member.description:
Status data read from the NAND flash.
This field is valid when NFC_OP is written and the read_status_en field of NFC_OP is 1.

RegisterGroup.name: CONFIG
RegisterGroup.description: CONFIG is an SFC configuration register.

Member.name: wr_ins
Member.description: Operator for writing data.

Member.name: rd_ins
Member.description: Operator for reading data.

Member.name: prefetch_cnt
Member.description:
Clock cycle for prefetching data when the flash memory is accessed at a variable data length through the bus.
00: not prefetched (default)
01: prefetch the data in one clock cycle
10: prefetch the data in two clock cycles
11: prefetch the data in three clock cycles

Member.name: rd_delay
Member.description:
Number of delayed clock cycles for reading data from the SPI.
00: no delay (default)
01: one clock cycle
10: two clock cycles
11: three clock cycles

Member.name: flash_addr_mode
Member.description:
SPI address mode.
0: 3-byte address mode (default)
1: 4-byte address mode
Writing to this bit has no effect when the start bit of the CMD register is 1.

Member.name: wip_locate
Member.description:
Position of the write in progress (WIP) bit in the flash status register.
000: bit 0 of the flash status register (default)
001: bit 1 of the flash status register
010: bit 2 of the flash status register
011: bit 3 of the flash status register
100: bit 4 of the flash status register
101: bit 5 of the flash status register
110: bit 6 of the flash status register
111: bit 7 of the flash status register

Member.name: dummy_byte
Member.description:
Number of dummy bytes when the flash memory is accessed through the bus.
0: no dummy byte
1: one dummy byte

Member.name: mem_if_type
Member.description:
Type of the connected SPI flash interface.
000–011: standard SPI. This interface type corresponds to the standard SPI mode.
100: dual-input SPI. When the flash memory is read through the bus, the dual SPI mode0 interface mode is used; when the flash memory is accessed through registers or the flash memory is written through the bus, the standard SPI mode is used.
101: dual I/O SPI. When the flash memory is accessed through the bus, the dual SPI mode0 interface mode is used; when the flash memory is accessed through registers, the standard SPI mode is used.
110: quad I/O SPI. When the flash memory is accessed through the bus, the quad SPI mode0 interface mode is used; when the flash memory is accessed through registers, the standard SPI mode is used.
111: serial quad I/O interface. This interface type corresponds to the quad SPI mode2 interface mode.
Note: In non-standard SPI mode, the rd_ins and wr_ins fields must be configured. The interface types of the flash memories connected to the two CSs must be the same. Otherwise, you must reconfigure the SFC configuration register and command register before using another flash memory.

Member.name: mode
Member.description:
SPI mode.
0: mode0
1: mode3

RegisterGroup.name: CMD
RegisterGroup.description: CMD is a command register.

Member.name: data_cnt
Member.description:
Number of bytes to be read or written.
When wrdata_en is 1, this field indicates the number of bytes to be written.
When rddata_en is 1, this field indicates the number of bytes to be read.
0x00: One byte is read or written.
0x01–0x1E: (n+1) bytes are read or written.
0x1F: 32 bytes are read or written.
Note: n can be set to 0, 1, 2, …, or 31.

Member.name: dummy_byte_cnt
Member.description:
Number of dummy bytes when the flash memory is accessed through registers.
000: 0 bytes (default)
001: 1 byte
010: 2 bytes
011: 3 bytes
100: 4 bytes
101: 5 bytes
110: 6 bytes
111: 7 bytes

Member.name: addr_en
Member.description:
Address enable for the current operation.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: wp_en
Member.description:
Hardware write-protection enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: rddata_en
Member.description:
Data return enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: When rddata_en is 1, wrdata_en cannot be 1.

Member.name: wrdata_en
Member.description:
Write data enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: When wrdata_en is 1, rddata_en cannot be 1.

Member.name: sel_cs
Member.description:
CS select.
0: CS0
1: CS1

Member.name: start
Member.description:
Instruction operation start.
0: The operation is complete.
1: The operation starts.
After the operation is complete, the bit returns to 0 automatically.

In 3-byte address mode, bits[23:0] are accessed; in 4-byte address mode, the upper two bits are padded with 0.

RegisterGroup.description: CS0CONFIG is CS0 configuration register.

Member.description:
Capacity of the SPI flash connected to CS0.
0000: No SPI flash is connected.
0001: 512 kbits
0010: 1 Mbit
0011: 2 Mbits

0110: 16 Mbits

RegisterGroup.name: TIMING
RegisterGroup.description: TIMING is a timing parameter register.

Member.name: trpd
Member.description: Delay for the first access to the flash after reset, in clock cycle.

Member.name: tcsh
Member.description:
CS hold time.
000–111: n + 1 clock cycles (n = 0, 1, 2, …, or 7)

Member.name: tcss
Member.description:
CS setup time.
000–111: n + 1 clock cycles (n = 0, 1, 2, …, or 7)

Member.name: tshwl
Member.description:
Write protect hold time.
0000–1111: n clock cycles (n = 0, 1, 2, …, or 15)

Member.name: tshsl
Member.description:
Indicates the deselect time of the CS. It is equal to the interval between two flash operations.
0000–1111: n + 2 clock cycles (n = 0, 1, 2, …, or 15)

RegisterGroup.name: INTRAWSTATUS
RegisterGroup.description: INTRAWSTATUS is a raw interrupt status register.

Member.name: op_end_raw_status
Member.description:
Raw instruction operation terminal interrupt status (not masked).
0: The operation is not complete.
1: The operation is complete.

RegisterGroup.name: INTSTATUS
RegisterGroup.description: INTSTATUS is a masked interrupt status register.

Member.name: op_end_status
Member.description:
Masked instruction operation terminal interrupt status.
0: The operation is not complete.
1: The operation is complete.

RegisterGroup.name: INTMASK
RegisterGroup.description: INTMASK is an interrupt mask register.

Member.name: op_end_mask
Member.description:
Instruction operation terminal interrupt mask.
0: masked
1: not masked

RegisterGroup.name: INTCLEAR
RegisterGroup.description: INTCLEAR is an interrupt clear register.

Member.name: clear_op_end
Member.description:
Instruction operation terminal interrupt clear. Writing 1 to this bit clears INTRAWSTATUS bit[0] and INTSTATUS bit[0].
0: not cleared
1: cleared
After a clear operation is complete, this bit returns 0 automatically.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BIDCYR0
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BIDCYR0 is SMI bank 0 idle cycle register. It controls the wait cycle between read andwrite operations.

Member.name: idcy
Member.description:
TWSTIDLY indicates the idle cycle between read and write operations. The cycle is calculated as follows:
TWSTIDLY=idcy*（1/fSMICLK）
Where, idcy is the number of working clock cycles of the SMI controller configured by the system; fSMICLK is the frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BWSTRDR0
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BWSTRDR0 is SMI bank 0 write wait cycle register. It controls the read wait cycle.

Member.name: wstrd
Member.description:
TWSTRD indicates the read wait cycle.
In the non-burst read, it indicates the read wait cycle.
In the burst read, it indicates the initial burst read wait cycle. The subsequent read wait cycles are configured using SMI_BWSTBRDR0. The wait cycle is calculated as follows:
TWSTRD=wstrd*（1/fSMICLK）
Where, wstrd is the number of working clock cycles of the SMI controller configured by the system; fSMICLK is the frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BWSTWRR0
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BWSTWRR0 is SMI bank 0 read enable cycle register. It controls the write wait cycle.

Member.name: wrdlyen
Member.description:
Write wait enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled.

Member.name: wrdly
Member.description:
Wait cycle of the write signal. The cycle is calculated as follows:
Twrdly=wrdly*(1/fSMICLK)
Where, wrdly is the number of working clock cycles of the SMI controller configured by the system; fSMICLK is the frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller.

Member.name: wstwr
Member.description:
TWSTWR indicates the write wait cycle. The cycle is calculated as follows:
TWSTWR =wstoen*(1/fSMICLK)
Where, wstwr is the number of working clock cycles of the SMI controller configured by the system; fSMICLK is the frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller.
Note: The number of configured working clock cycles must be greater than 2.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BWSTOENR0
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BWSTOENR is SMI bank0 read enable wait cycle register. It controls the wait cyclefrom the output of a valid CS signal to the output of a valid read enable signal.

Member.name: wstoen
Member.description:
TWSTOEN indicates the wait cycle from the output of a valid CS signal to the output of a valid read enable signal. The cycle is calculated as follows:
TWSTOEN=wstoen*(1/fSMICLK)
Where, wstoen is the number of working clock cycles of the SMI controller configured by the system; fSMICLK is the frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BWSTWENR0
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BWSTWENR0 is SMI bank 0 write enable wait cycle register. It controls the wait cyclefrom the output of a valid CS signal to the output of a valid write enable signal.

Member.name: wstwen
Member.description:
TWSTWEN indicates the wait cycle from the output of a valid CS to the output of a valid write enable signal. The cycle is calculated as follows:
TWSTWEN=wstwen*(1/fSMICLK)
Where, wstwen is the number of working clock cycles of the SMI controller configured by the system; fSMICLK is the frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BCR0
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BCR0 is SMI bank 0 control register. It is used to configure the transfer parametersrelevant to bank 0.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. This bit must be set to 1.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. This bit must be set to 1.

Member.name: burstlenwrite
Member.description:
Burst length, that is, the amount of data to be transferred in the next burst write operation in burst mode.
00: burst 4
01: burst 8
10 and 11: reserved

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. This bit must be set to 0.

Member.name: bmwrite
Member.description:
Write mode.
0: write to an external component in non-burst mode
1: write to an external component in burst mode

Member.name: wrapread
Member.description:
Wrap read enable. The burst transfer with 16 data segments can be implemented only using a 16-bit external component.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. This bit must be set to 1.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. This bit must be set to 1.

Member.name: burstlenread
Member.description:
Burst length, that is, the amount of data to be transferred in the next burst read in burst mode.
00: burst 4
01: burst 8
10: burst 16
11: reserved

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. This bit must be set to 0.

Member.name: bmread
Member.description:
Read mode configuration bit.
0: non-burst read
1: burst read

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. This bit must be set to 0.

Member.name: mw
Member.description:
Data width of the external device of SMI bank 0.
00: 8 bits
01: 16 bits
10 and 11: reserved

Member.name: wp
Member.description:
Write protection for the connected external component. This bit controls whether to write-protect the external component.
0: not write-protected, for example, the writable SRAM.
1: write-protected, for example, the ROM.

Member.name: waiten
Member.description:
Wait signal enable of SMI bank 0.
0: disabled. The SMI bank 0 is not controlled by the externally input wait signal. Data is transferred based on the configuration parameters of the internal timing register.
1: enabled The SMI bank 0 transfers data according to the externally input wait signal.

Member.name: waitpol
Member.description:
Valid polarity select of the externally input wait signal.
0: active low
1: active high

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved. This bit must be set to 0.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BSR0
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BSR0 is SMI bank 0 status register. It shows the current status of bank 0.

Member.name: waittouterr
Member.description:
External wait timeout error flag.
In read operation:
0: No external wait timeout error occurs.
1: An external wait timeout error occurs.
In write operation:
0: Invalid.
1: The external wait timeout error flag is cleared.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BWSTBRDR0
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BWSTBRDR0 is SMI bank 0 burst read wait cycle register. It controls the wait cycle ofany subsequent burst read operation rather than the initial read operation.

Member.name: wstbrd
Member.description:
TWSTBURSTRD indicates the burst read wait cycle. In the non-burst read, the timing parameter is not used.
In the burst read, this timing parameter controls the wait cycle of any subsequent burst read operation rather than the initial read operation.
The wait cycle of the initial burst read operation is configured using SMI_BWSTRDR0. The cycle is calculated as follows:
TWSTBURSTRD=wstbrd*(1/fSMICLK)
Where, wstbrd is the number of working clock cycles of the SMI controller configured by the system; fSMICLK is the frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BIDCYR1
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BIDCYR1 is SMI bank 1 idle cycle register. It controls the wait cycle between read andwrite operations.

Member.name: idcy
Member.description:
TWSTIDLY indicates the bus turnaround (idle) cycle, which controls the wait cycle between the read and write operations. The cycle is calculated as follows:
TWSTIDLY=idcy*(1/fSMICLK)
Where, idcy indicates the number of working clock cycles of the SMI controller configured by the system; fSMICLK indicates the frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BWSTRDR1
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BWSTRDR1 is SMI bank 1 read wait cycle register. It controls the read wait cycle.

Member.name: wstrd
Member.description:
TWSTRD indicates the read wait cycle.
In the non-burst read, it controls the subsequent read wait cycle.
In the burst read, it controls the initial burst read wait cycle. The subsequent read wait cycles are configured using SMI_BWSTRDR0. The cycle is calculated as follows:
TWSTRD=wstrd*(1/fSMICLK)
Where, wstrd indicates the number of working clock cycles of the SMI controller configured by the system; fSMICLK indicates the frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BWSTWRR1
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BWSTWRR1 is SMI bank 1 write wait cycle register. It controls the write wait cycle.

Member.name: wrdlyen
Member.description:
Write wait enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: wrdly
Member.description:
Wait cycle of the write signal. The cycle is calculated as follows:
Twrdly=wrdly*(1/fSMICLK)
Where, wrdly indicates the number of working clock cycles of the SMI controller configured by the system; fSMICLK indicates the frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller.

Member.name: wstwr
Member.description:
TWSTWR indicates the write wait cycle. The cycle is calculated as follows:
Twrdly= wstwr *(1/fSMICLK)
Where, wstwr indicates the number of working clock cycles of the SMI controller configured by the system; fSMICLK indicates the frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller.
Note: The number of configured working clock cycles must be greater than 2.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BWSTOENR1
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BWSTOENR1 is SMI bank 1 read enable cycle register. It controls the wait cycle fromthe output of a valid CS signal to the output of a valid read enable signal.

Member.name: wstoen
Member.description:
TWSTOEN indicates the wait cycle from the output of a valid CS signal to the output of a valid read enable signal. The cycle is calculated as follows:
TWSTOEN=wstoen*(1/fSMICLK)
Where, wstoen indicates the number of working clock cycles of the SMI controller configured by the system; fSMICLK indicates the frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BWSTWENR1
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BWSTWENR1 is SMI bank 1 write enable cycle register. It controls the wait cycle fromthe output of a valid CS signal to the output of a valid write enable signal.

Member.name: wstwen
Member.description:
TWSTWEN indicates the wait cycle from the output of a valid CS signal to the output of a valid write enable signal. The cycle is calculated as follows:
TWSTWEN=wstwen*(1/fSMICLK)
Where, wstwen indicates the number of working clock cycles of the SMI controller configured by the system; fSMICLK indicates the frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_BWSTBRDR1
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_BWSTBRDR1 is SMI bank 0 burst read wait cycle register. It controls the wait cycle ofany subsequent burst read operation rather than the initial read operation.

Member.name: wstbrd
Member.description:
TWSTBURSTRD indicates the burst read wait cycle. In the non-burst read, the timing parameter is not used.
In the burst read, this timing parameter controls the wait cycle of any subsequent burst read operation rather than the initial read operation.
The initial burst read wait cycle is configured using SMI_BWSTRDR1. The cycle is calculated as follows:

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_SR
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_SR is an SMI asynchronous wait status register. It shows the asynchronous wait status inasynchronous wait mode.

0: The wait signal is invalid.
1: The wait signal is valid.

RegisterGroup.name: SMI_CR
RegisterGroup.description: SMI_CR is an SMI working clock configuration register. It controls the relationship betweenthe working clock of the SMI controller and the system bus clock.

Member.name: memclkratio
Member.description:
Configuration of the working clock of the SMI controller.
01: The frequency of the working clock of the SMI controller is half of that of the system bus clock.
Other values: reserved

Member.description: Reserved. This bit must be set to 1.

RegisterGroup.name: EQU_CTRL_3
RegisterGroup.description: equ_ctrl_3 is equalization control register 3.

Member.name: step_lms
Member.description: Equalizer step in least mean square (LMS) mode. It is set to 0x0–0x7 in normal mode.

Member.name: step_blind
Member.description: Equalizer step in blind mode. It is set to 0x0–0x7 in normal mode.

RegisterGroup.name: EQU_CTRL_4
RegisterGroup.description: equ_ctrl_4 is equalization control register 4.

Member.name: tap_center
Member.description:
Position of the equalization central tap.
0000: The central tap is tap10.
0001: The central tap is tap9.
0010: The central tap is tap8.
0011: The central tap is tap7.
0100: The central tap is tap6.
0101: The central tap is tap11.
0110: The central tap is tap12.
0111: The central tap is tap13.
1000: The central tap is tap14.
1001: The central tap is tap15.
1010: The central tap is tap16.
1011: The central tap is tap17.
1100: The central tap is tap18.
1101: The central tap is tap19.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: eq_para_up
Member.description:
Tap coefficient update of the equalizer.
00 and 11: forcible update
01: test mode
10: not update
This field is set to 00 or 11 in normal mode.

Member.name: eq_fsm_en
Member.description: Test register. It is set to the reset value in normal mode.

RegisterGroup.name: EQU_CTRL_6
RegisterGroup.description: equ_ctrl_6 is equalization control register 6.

Member.name: tap_wr
Member.description:
Read/write control for the equalizer tap coefficients.
0: read (default)
1: write
Before equalizer tap coefficients are written, equ_ctrl_4[eq_para_up] must be set to 0x10.

Member.name: tap_pos
Member.description:
Position of the equalizer tap coefficient.
After this field is configured, you can set tap_wr to 0, and read tap_rd_real and tap_rd_imag to obtain the real part and imaginary part of the corresponding tap coefficient.
For example, after tap_pos is set to 0x0A, you can read tap_rd_real and tap_rd_imag to obtain the real part and imaginary part of equalizer tap coefficient 10.

RegisterGroup.name: EQU_CTRL_7
RegisterGroup.description: equ_ctrl_7 is equalization control register 7.

Member.name: tap_wr_real
Member.description:
Indicates the operation of writing the upper eight bits of the real part of the tap_posth equalizer tap coefficient
.

Member.description: Indicates the operation of writing the lower eight bits of the real part of the tap_posth equalizer tap coefficient.

Member.name: tap_wr_imag
Member.description: Indicates the operation of writing the upper eight bits of the imaginary part of the tap_posth equalizer tap coefficient.

RegisterGroup.name: EQU_CTRL_10

Member.description: Indicates the operation of writing the lower eight bits of the imaginary part of the tap_posth equalizer tap coefficient.

RegisterGroup.name: EQU_STAT_2
RegisterGroup.description: equ_stat_2 is equalization status register 2.

Member.name: noise_cal
Member.description:
Upper eight bits of the internal noise estimation accumulator.
The value of the accumulator is related to the dispersion degree of the constellation diagram. The value reflects the average distance between the calculated constellation point and the mapped constellation point. In addition, a lookup table is used to calculate equivalent noise level (equivalent C/N estimation).
For details on how to use the lookup table, see the description of cr_ctrl_21.

Member.name: itpl_ratio
Member.description:
Upper three bits of the ratio of the sampling clock to the symbol rate.
The ratio is calculated as follows:
[Fsample/(2*Fsymbol)]*2^14
Where, Fsample is the sampling frequency of the ADC.

Member.name: cr_kprop_scale12
Member.description:
Scaling tributary coefficient value of the carrier recovery module.

The lower four bits are the value of scale2 and are valid in equalization state 3.

RegisterGroup.name: CR_KPROP_SCALE34
RegisterGroup.description: cr_kprop_scale34 is a carrier recovery control register.

Member.name: cr_kprop_scale34
Member.description:
Scaling tributary coefficient value of the carrier recovery module.
The upper four bits are the value of scale3 and are valid in equalization state 4, 5, or 6.
The lower four bits are the value of scale4 and are used in equalization state 7 when the frequency is stable.

Member.name: cr_kint_scale12
Member.description:
Integration tributary coefficient value of the carrier recovery module.
The upper four bits are the value of scale1 and are valid in equalization state 2.
The lower four bits are the value of scale2 and are valid in equalization state 3.

RegisterGroup.name: MCTRL_1
RegisterGroup.description: mctrl_1 is main control register 1.

Member.name: version
Member.description: QAM version of 001.

Member.name: rst_agc
Member.description:
Soft reset.
0: The QAM module works normally.
1: The AGC and ADC are reset.
This bit cannot be cleared automatically. During reset, software needs to write 1 and then 0 to the bit.

Member.name: rst_eq
Member.description:
Equalizer reset.
0: The QAM module works normally.
1: The equalizer is reset.
This bit cannot be cleared automatically. During reset, software needs to write 1 and then 0 to the bit.

Member.name: rst_rs
Member.description:
RS module reset.
0: The QAM module works normally.
1: The RS module is reset.
This bit cannot be cleared automatically. During reset, software needs to write 1 and then 0 to the bit.

Member.name: rst_dec
Member.description:
Channel decoding reset.
0: The QAM module works normally.
1: The deinterleaver, frame sync module, and descrambler are reset.
This bit cannot be cleared automatically. During reset, software needs to write 1 and then 0 to the bit.

Member.name: rst_qam
Member.description:
Channel demodulation reset.
0: The QAM module works normally.
1: The channel demodulation is reset.
This bit cannot be cleared automatically. During reset, software needs to write 1 and then 0 to the bit.

1: The pins agc1 and agc2 are open drain (OD) outputs.

Member.description:
ITU standard select.
1: J83B
0: J83AC

Member.name: mf_roll_sel
Member.description: Mode of using the matched filter.

Member.name: swap

0: normal format
1: exchange between upper and lower bits

Member.name: data_formate
Member.description:
AD data format conversion.
0: normal format.
1: The MSB is inverted.

Member.name: itu_sel
Member.description:
ITU-J83 mode select.

1: ITU-J83C mode

Member.name: qam_input_ctrl
Member.description:
Input control.
00: The QAM starts to work only after the AGC is locked.
01 and 10: The QAM starts to work even the AGC is not locked.
11: The QAM starts to work only after the AGC is locked once and the subsequent unlock operation is ignored.

RegisterGroup.name: BER_1
RegisterGroup.description: ber_1 is BER control register 1.

Member.name: bert_en
Member.description:
BER enable.
BER statistic enable before RS correction, active high.
When ber_ctrl is 0 and an overflow occurs in the internal byte counter (above the BER statistic threshold), ber_en is automatically cleared.

Member.name: err_source
Member.description:
BER statistic error source.
0: Error bits are counted.
1: Error bytes are counted.

Member.name: err_mode
Member.description:
BER statistical mode.
0: auto-stop statistical mode. When the internal counter reaches the threshold or an overflow occurs in the BER counter, counting stops automatically and ber_en is automatically cleared.
1: auto-repeat statistical mode. When the internal counter reaches the threshold, it is reset automatically and restarts to count until ber_en is 0.

Member.name: nbyte
Member.description:
BER statistic threshold.
The threshold for the overflow of the internal byte counter is 2^(2*2^（2*nbyte+12）） This threshold is valid only when ber_ctrl is 0. The value of the internal byte counter ranges from 4,096 to 2^26.

RegisterGroup.name: BER_2
RegisterGroup.description: ber_ctrl_2 is BER control register 2.

Member.name: error_cnt
Member.description:
Upper eight bits of the internal error bit/byte counter.
This result is the count of raw bit/byte errors, including all errors in the RS check bytes.
For details, see the description of cr_ctrl_21.

RegisterGroup.name: BER_3
RegisterGroup.description: ber_ctrl_3 is BER control register 3.

Member.name: error_cnt
Member.description:
Medium eight bits of the internal error bit/byte counter.
This result is the count of raw bit/byte errors, including all errors in the RS check bytes.
For details, see the description of cr_ctrl_21.

RegisterGroup.name: BER_4
RegisterGroup.description: ber_ctrl_4 is BER control register 4.

Member.name: error_cnt
Member.description:
Lower eight bits of the internal error bit/byte counter.
This result is the count of raw bit/byte errors, including all errors in the RS check bytes.
For details, see the description of cr_ctrl_21.

RegisterGroup.name: TS_CTRL_1
RegisterGroup.description: ts_ctrl_1 is output control register 1. This register varies according to chips (the Hi3716H,Hi3716M, and Hi3716L).

Member.name: sync_byte_inv
Member.description:
Sync byte invert.
0: The inverse sync byte is not inverted.
1: The inverse sync byte is reverted and the value 0xB8 is restored to 0x47.
This bit is set to 1 in normal mode.

Member.name: bend_bypass
Member.description:
Decoding module bypass.
0: The decoding module is not bypassed.
1: All modules related to decoding such as deinterleaver, RS decoding module, and descrambler are bypassed.

Member.name: test2
Member.description: Test register. It is set to the reset value in normal mode.

Member.name: parity_en
Member.description:
Output enable of the RS check bit.
0: The RS check bit is not output (discarded).
1: All MPEG-TS streams are output.

Member.name: sp_sel
Member.description:
Mode select of the parallel port.
1: serial mode
0: parallel mode 2
This bit is valid only when ts_ctrl_2[comm_if_en] is 0.

Member.name: tei_enable
Member.description:
Transport error indicator (TEI) bit enable.
0: The MPEG-2 TEI bit is not enabled even when an uncorrectable frame error is found.
1: The MPEG-2 TEI bit is enabled when an uncorrectable frame error is found.

Member.name: ds_enable
Member.description:
Descrambling enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
This bit is set to 1 in normal mode.

RegisterGroup.name: TS_CTRL_2
RegisterGroup.description: ts_ctrl_2 is output control register 2. This register varies according to chips (the Hi3716H,Hi3716M, and Hi3716L).

Member.name: sync_drop
Member.description:
Sync byte discard.
0: The sync bytes in the MPEG-TS frame header are output.
1: The sync bytes in the MPEG-TS frame header are not output (the corresponding ts_val is invalid).

Member.name: comm_if_en
Member.description:
Mode enable of the parallel port.
1: mode 1 of the parallel port
0: mode 2 of the parallel port or serial port mode. The mode is controlled by ts_ctrl_1[sp_sel].

Member.name: comm_if_clk_ctrl
Member.description:
Output polarity of ts_clk.
0: ts_clk is output directly.
1: ts_clk is output reversely.

Member.name: comm_if_clk_base
Member.description:
Output polarity of ts_clk.
0: ts_clk is output directly.
1: ts_clk is output reversely.

Member.name: test
Member.description: Test register. It is set to the reset value in normal mode.

Member.description: Test register. It is set to the reset value in normal mode.

For details about how to use this register, see the description of cr_ctrl_21.

Member.name: pkt_corr
Member.description:
Upper eight bits of the corrected TS frame counter.
After being enabled, this register is used to count the TS frames corrected by the RS module. For details, see the description of rs_ctrl_8 bits[5:4].
For details about how to use this register, see the description of cr_ctrl_21.

RegisterGroup.name: RS_CTRL_4
RegisterGroup.description: rs_ctrl_4 is RS decoding status register 4.

Member.name: pkt_corr
Member.description:
Lower eight bits of the corrected TS frame counter.
After being enabled, this register is used to count the TS frames corrected by the RS module. For details, see the description of rs_ctrl_8 bits[5:4].
For details about how to use this register, see the description of cr_ctrl_21.

RegisterGroup.name: RS_CTRL_5
RegisterGroup.description: rs_ctrl_5 is RS decoding status register 5.

Member.name: pkt_uncorr
Member.description:
Upper eight bits of the uncorrected TS frame counter.
After being enabled, this register is used to count the TS frames that cannot be corrected by the RS module. For details, see the description of rs_ctrl_8 bits[5:4].
For details about how to use this register, see the description of cr_ctrl_21.

RegisterGroup.name: RS_CTRL_6
RegisterGroup.description: rs_ctrl_6 is RS decoding status register 6.

Member.name: pkt_uncorr
Member.description:
Lower eight bits of the uncorrected TS frame counter.
After being enabled, this register is used to count the TS frames that cannot be corrected by the RS module. For details, see the description of rs_ctrl_8 bits[5:4].
For details about how to use this register, see the description of cr_ctrl_21.

RegisterGroup.name: RS_CTRL_8
RegisterGroup.description: rs_ctrl_8 is RS decoding status register 8.

Member.name: rs_corr_dis
Member.description:
RS correction mask.
0: The RS module works normally (default).
1: The correction function of the RS module is masked, but other functions are not affected.

Member.name: static_hold
Member.description:
Counter hold.
0: The preceding counters work normally.
1: The TS frame counter (pkt_cnt), corrected TS frame counter (pkt_corr), and uncorrected TS frame counter (pkt_uncorr) retain the corresponding count values.

Member.name: static_clear
Member.description:
Counter clear.
0: The preceding counters work normally.
1: The TS frame counter (pkt_cnt), corrected TS frame counter (pkt_corr), and uncorrected TS frame counter (pkt_uncorr) are cleared.

RegisterGroup.name: BS_CTRL_1
RegisterGroup.description: bs_ctrl_1 is blind scanning control register 1.

Member.name: spec_inv_en
Member.description:
Spectrum invert.
0: The demodulator is not allowed to process any spectrum inversion caused by the transfer channel.
1: The demodulator is allowed to process any spectrum inversion caused by the transfer channel.

Member.name: spec_search_en
Member.description:
Spectrum auto-inversion control.
0: disabled
1: enabled
For details about the actual spectrum mode, see the description of bs_stat_1.

Member.name: rate_search_en
Member.description:
Symbol rate blind scanning control.
0: disabled
1: enabled
For details about the found QAM mode and symbol rate, see the description of bs_stat_1.

Member.name: qam_search_en
Member.description:
Modulation mode blind scanning control.
0: disabled
1: enabled
For details about the found modulation mode, see the description of bs_stat_1.

RegisterGroup.name: BS_CTRL_2
RegisterGroup.description: bs_ctrl_2 is blind scanning control register 2.

Member.name: rate_search
Member.description:
Indicates the range of the found symbol rate when the symbol rate blind scanning function is enabled. When the function is disabled, it is meaningless to configure this register.
000: invalid
001: 1.8–0.9 MBaud
010: 3.6–1.8 MBaud
011: 3.6–1.8 Mbaud or 1.8–0.9 MBaud
100: 7.2–3.6 MBaud
101: 7.2–3.6 Mbaud or 1.8–0.9 MBaud
110: 7.2–3.6 Mbaud or 3.6–1.8 MBaud
111: 7.2–3.6 Mbaud, 3.6–1.8 Mbaud, or 1.8–0.9 MBaud

Member.name: qam_search
Member.description:
Modulation mode
Indicates the modulation mode configured by users when qam_search_en is 0. The details are as follows:
0x01: QAM16
0x02: QAM32
0x04: QAM128
0x08: QAM256
0x10: QAM64
Other values: reserved
When qam_search_en is 1, multiple bits are valid, that is, multiple modulation modes can be searched for. For example:
0x18: QAM64 and QAM256

RegisterGroup.name: BS_STAT_1
RegisterGroup.description: bs_stat_1 is blind scanning status register 1.

Member.name: qam_mode
Member.description:
QAM mode.
0x01: QAM16
0x02: QAM32
0x04: QAM128
0x08: QAM256
0x10: QAM64
Other values: reserved

Member.name: rate_range
Member.description:
Range of the symbol rate obtained after blind scanning.
00: 7.2–3.6 MBaud
01: 3.6–1.8 MBaud
10: 1.8–0.9 MBaud
11: reserved

Member.name: spec_inv
Member.description:
Spectrum invert.
0: not inverted
1: inverted

RegisterGroup.name: BS_STAT_2
RegisterGroup.description: bs_stat_2 is blind scanning status register 2.

Member.name: qam_search_status
Member.description:
Result of modulation mode blind scanning. This field is valid only when the modulation mode blink scanning function is enabled.
00: Blind scanning is not complete.
01: Invalid.
10: Blind scanning is complete but failed.
11: Blind scanning is complete and successful.

Member.name: rate_search_status
Member.description:
Result of symbol rate blind scanning.
00: Blind scanning is not complete.
01: Invalid.
10: Blind scanning is complete but failed.
11: Blind scanning is complete and successful.

RegisterGroup.name: BS_STAT_3
RegisterGroup.description: bs_stat_3 is blind scanning status register 3.

Member.name: rate_ratio
Member.description:
After symbol rate blind scanning is complete, the symbol rate can be calculated as follows:
Fs=Fad/(2^(rate_range+1))*rate_ratio/2^14
When rate_range is 0, Fad is 28.8 MHz.
When rate_range is 1, Fad is 14.4 MHz.
When rate_range is 2, Fad is 7.2 MHz.
This bit is the MSB of rate_ratio.

RegisterGroup.name: BS_STAT_4
RegisterGroup.description: bs_stat_4 is blind scanning status register 4.

Member.name: rate_ratio
Member.description:
After symbol rate blind scanning is complete, the symbol rate can be calculated as follows:
Fs=Fad/(2^(rate_range+1))*rate_ratio/2^14
When rate_range is 0, Fad is 28.8 MHz.
When rate_range is 1, Fad is 14.4 MHz.
When rate_range is 2, Fad is 7.2 MHz.
These bits are the upper eight bits of rate_ratio.

RegisterGroup.name: BS_STAT_5
RegisterGroup.description: bs_stat_5 is blind scanning status register 5.

Member.name: rate_ratio
Member.description:
After symbol rate blind scanning is complete, the symbol rate can be calculated as follows:
Fs=Fad/(2^(rate_range+1))*rate_ratio/2^14
When rate_range is 0, Fad is 28.8 MHz.
When rate_range is 1, Fad is 14.4 MHz.
When rate_range is 2, Fad is 7.2 MHz.
These bits are the lower eight bits of rate_ratio.

RegisterGroup.name: FS_CTRL_1
RegisterGroup.description: fs_ctrl_1 is scanning control register 1.

Member.name: test
Member.description: Test register. It is set to the reset value in normal mode.

Member.name: fre_init
Member.description:
Upper six bits of the initial demodulation frequency.
The demodulation frequency is calculated as follows:
=fre_init*fclk/2*pi*2^11
The frequency scanning circuit works under the sampling clock. Where, fclk/2*pi*2^11 is the resolution precision. For example, when fclk is 28.8 MHz, the resolution precision is 2,238 Hz.

RegisterGroup.name: FS_CTRL_2
RegisterGroup.description: fs_ctrl_2 is scanning control register 2.

Member.name: fre_init
Member.description:
Lower eight bits of the initial demodulation frequency.
The demodulation frequency is calculated as follows:
=fre_init*fclk/2*pi*2^11
The frequency scanning circuit works under the sampling clock.
Where, fclk/2*pi*2^11 is the resolution precision. For example, when fclk is 28.8 MHz, the resolution precision is 2,238 Hz.

RegisterGroup.name: FS_CTRL_4
RegisterGroup.description: fs_ctrl_4 is scanning control register 4.

Member.name: test
Member.description: Test register. It is set to the reset value in normal mode.

Member.name: scan_interval
Member.description:
Upper five bits of the scanning interval step.
The step between two continuous frequencies that are to be demodulated is calculated as follows:
scan_int erval*fclk/2^(11*2*PI)

RegisterGroup.description: fs_ctrl_5 is scanning control register 5.

Member.description:

Member.description:
Whether TCM automatically searches the phase to initialize the configuration in J83B mode.
1: automatic search
1: manual configuration

Member.name: reg2j83b_phase
Member.description: TCM phase that is configured manually in J83B mode.

RegisterGroup.name: J83B_TCM_2
RegisterGroup.description: j83b_tcm_2 is J83B TCM control register 2.

Member.name: reg2j83b_thres
Member.description: TCM lock threshold in J83B mode.

RegisterGroup.name: J83B_TCM_3
RegisterGroup.description: j83b_tcm_3 is J83B TCM control register 3.

Member.name: reg2j83b_lost_num
Member.description: TCM unlock count in J83B mode. When this count is reached, the TCM unlock status is reported. The value 0 indicates that the unlock status is reported when the TCM is unlocked once; the value 1 indicates that the unlock status is reported when the TCM is unlocked twice, and so on.

Member.name: reg2j83b_syncnum
Member.description: TCM sync count in J83B mode. When the count is reached, the TCM is locked. The value 0 indicates that the TCM is locked after the TCM is synchronized once; the value 1 indicates that the TCM is locked after the TCM is synchronized twice, and so on.

Member.name: reg2j83b_stanum
Member.description:
In J83B mode, the number of TCM sync symbols is calculated as follows:
256 x 2(mc2tcm_stacnt x 15)

Member.description: MPEG frame sync lock threshold in J83B mode.

RegisterGroup.name: J83B_MFSYNC_2

RegisterGroup.name: J83B_FFSYNC_1
RegisterGroup.description: j83b_ffsync_1 is J83B FFSYNC control register 1.

Member.name: reg2j83b_fra_locken
Member.description:
The frame sync module is locked after a sync sequence and consecutive n valid frames are detected in sequence. The value of n is calculated as follows:
n = fra_acqmode + 1

Member.name: reg2j83b_fra_lostlen
Member.description:
After the frame sync module is unlocked, if the positions of consecutive m sync sequences are incorrect, the frame sync module is unlocked and sync sequences are detected again. The value of m is calculated as follows:
m =fra_trkmode + 1

RegisterGroup.name: J83B_FFSYNC_2
RegisterGroup.description: j83b_ffsync_2 is J83B FFSYNC control register 2.

Member.name: reg2j83b_unlock_toler
Member.description:
When the frame sync module is not locked, the sync sequences of consecutive P frames do not transmit the phase change pulse to the TCM. The value of p is calculated as follows:
p = unlock_toler + 2

Member.name: reg2j83b_lock_mismatch
Member.description: Number of allowed error bits of the sync sequence before the frame sync module is locked. If the value is 0, no bit error is allowed.

RegisterGroup.name: J83B_FFSYNC_3
RegisterGroup.description: j83b_ffsync_3 is J83B FFSYNC control register 3.

Member.name: reg2j83b_lost_mismatch
Member.description: Number of allowed error bits of the sync sequence after the frame sync module is locked. If the value is 0, no bit error is allowed.

RegisterGroup.name: MDIO_RWCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: MDIO_RWCTRL is an MDIO command word register.The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: cpu_data_in
Member.description:
Data that is written to the PHY by the MDIO module.
On write, the CPU first writes the 16-bit data to be written by the MDIO module to this register.

Member.name: finish
Member.description:
PHY read/write operation complete.
0: not complete
1: complete
When another read/write operation is required, the CPU must clear this bit first.

Member.name: rw
Member.description:
PHY read or write access control.
0: read
1: write

Member.name: phy_exaddr
Member.description:
Physical address of the external PHY.
One MDIO interface can be used to read or write multiple external PHYs. Each PHY maps to one address. When only one external PHY is connected, this bit is equivalent to UD_MDIO_PHYADDR[phy0_addr] or UD_MDIO_PHYADDR[phy1_addr].

Member.name: frq_dv
Member.description:
Clock divider of the MDC (MDIO interface clock) when the external PHY is read or written.
The following describes the mapping between frq_dv and MDC frequency by taking the frequency 100 MHz of the main clock as an example:
000: The frequency of the working main clock is divided by 50 and the obtained frequency is 2 MHz.
001: The working main clock is divided by 100 and the obtained frequency is 1 MHz.
010: The working main clock is divided by 200 and the obtained frequency is 512 kHz.
011: The working main clock is divided by 400 and the obtained frequency is 256 kHz.
100: The working main clock is divided by 800 and the obtained frequency is 128 kHz.
101: The working main clock is divided by 1,600 and the obtained frequency is 64 kHz.
110: The working main clock is divided by 3,200 and the obtained frequency is 32 kHz.
111: The working main clock is divided by 6,400 and the obtained frequency is 16 kHz.

Member.name: phy_inaddr
Member.description: Internal register address of the external PHY. This address is presented by a 5-bit binary number.

RegisterGroup.name: MDIO_RO_DATA
RegisterGroup.description: MDIO_RO_DATAMDIO is a read data register. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: cpu_data_out
Member.description: Data register used by the MDIO module to perform read operation on the PHY. The MDIO module first writes the 16-bit data read from the PHY to this register.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_MDIO_PHYADDR
RegisterGroup.description: UD_MDIO_PHYADDR is a PHY physical address register. The register does not support softreset.

Member.name: phy_addr
Member.description: Physical address of the external PHY.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_MDIO_RO_STAT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_MDIO_RO_STAT is a PHY status register. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: speed_mdio2mac
Member.description:
Port speed obtained from the MDIO interface, that is, 10 Mbit/s or 100 Mbit/s working mode.
0: 10 Mbit/s
1: 100 Mbit/s

Member.name: link_mdio2mac
Member.description:
Port link status obtained from the MDIO interface.
0: No link exists.
1: A link exists.

Member.name: duplex_mdio2mac
Member.description:
Port duplex working status obtained from the MDIO interface.
0: half-duplex
1: full-duplex

RegisterGroup.name: UD_MDIO_ANEG_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: UD_MDIO_ANEG_CTRLPHY is an offset address configuration register for PHY statuses.The register does not support soft reset.Note:If the PHY speed status bit is bit[14] of the register with the address of 17, internal_addr_speed is set to0x11 and speed_index is set to 0xE. In this case, the bit value can be read by using the MDIO interfaceand served as the current working speed mode of the PHY.

Member.name: internal_addr_speed
Member.description: Address of the register in the PHY to store the status information (speed). The default value is set according to Intel 9785.

Member.name: internal_addr_link
Member.description: Address of the register in the PHY to store the status information (link). The default value is set according to Intel 9785.

Member.name: internal_addr_duplex
Member.description: Address of the register in the PHY to store the status information (duplex). The default value is set according to Intel 9785.

Member.name: speed_index
Member.description: Offset address in the PHY status register that is used to store the speed information. The default value is set according to Intel 9785.

Member.name: link_index
Member.description: Offset address in the PHY status register that is used to store the link information. The default value is set according to Intel 9785.

Member.name: duplex_index
Member.description: Offset address in the PHY status register that is used to store the duplex information. The default value is set according to Intel 9785.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_MDIO_IRQENA
RegisterGroup.description: UD_MDIO_IRQENA is a scan mask register for MDIO status changes. The register does notsupport soft reset.Note:If the status information about the PHY connecting to the port cannot be obtained in scanning modeby configuring UD_MDIO_ANEG_CTRL, you can scan the PHY status register by usingMDIO_RWCTRL to check whether the port status changes and generate an interrupt to instructsoftware to process the interrupt.link_partner status change refers to the change of any bit of link, speed, and duplex.

Member.name: link_partner_ch_mask
Member.description:
Port link partner status scan change interrupt mask.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: speed_ch_mask
Member.description:
Port speed mode scan change interrupt mask.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: link_ch_mask
Member.description:
Port link mode scan change interrupt mask.
0: masked
1: not masked

Member.name: duplex_ch_mask

Port duplex mode scan change interrupt mask.

1: not masked

RegisterGroup.description: UD_MAC_SET is an MAC function configuration register. The register does not support softreset.

Member.name: add_pad_en
Member.description:
Port auto-add PAD enable during transmission.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: crcgen_dis
Member.description:
Port CRC generation disable control.
0: CRC is recalculated for the transmitted frame.
1: CRC is not recalculated for the transmitted frame.

Member.name: cntr_rdclr_en
Member.description:
Port statistics counter read clear enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: cntr_clr_all
Member.description:
Port statistics counter clear control.
0: not clear
1: clear
Note: If cntr_clr_all is set to 1, the next complete clear operation can be performed only after this bit is set to 0 and then to 1.

Member.name: cntr_roll_dis
Member.description:
Port statistics acyclic counter enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: colthreshold
Member.description:
Port collision count statistics threshold.
The default value is 0x1, which indicates the count of frames with one collision.

Member.name: in_loop_en
Member.description:
Port inner loopback enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: Inloop and outer loopback cannot be enabled at the same time. When the network interface is in normal status, you need to perform soft reset on the module after changing the configuration of the inner loopback or outer loopback.

Member.name: ex_loop_en
Member.description:
Port outer loopback enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: Inloop and outer loopback cannot be enabled at the same time. When the network interface is in normal status, you need to perform soft reset on the module after changing the configuration of the inner loopback or outer loopback.

Member.name: pause_en
Member.description:
Port pause frame transmit enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: rx_shframe_en
Member.description:
Port short frame receive enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: If rx_shframe_en is set to 1, the minimum length of the received frame is rx_min_thr. If rx_shframe_en is set to 0, the minimum frame length is 64 bytes (including CRC) by default.

Member.name: rx_min_thr
Member.description:
Minimum length of the received frame.
The value ranges from 42 bytes to 63 bytes. The default value is 42 bytes.
Note: If rx_min_thr is set to a value smaller than 42, 42 is used.

Member.name: len_max
Member.description:
Maximum length of the received frame. The default value is 1,518 bytes.
The value ranges from 1,518 bytes to 1,535 bytes.
Note: If len_max is set to a value greater than 2000, 2000 is used. If len_max is set to a value smaller than 256, 256 is used.

RegisterGroup.name: GLB_FWCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: GLB_FWCTRL is a forward control register. The register does not support soft reset.Note:If the enable control bit for forcibly forwarding frames to the CPU port and an external port is valid,all valid received frames are forcibly forwarded to the CPU port and the external port.If the port forward allow bit is disabled, the port may not receive packets even if the forcibleforwarding bit is enabled.The VLAN function includes VLAN forward control as well as addition, deletion, and replacementof VLAN tags during packet forwarding.

Member.description:

0: Add the VLAN tags of the transmit port.
1: Add the VLAN tags of the receive port.
This bit is valid only when vtag_up is set to 1.

Member.name: vtag_down
Member.description:

1: yes

Member.name: fw_down
Member.description:
Indicates whether to forward the frames without VLAN tags received from the downstream port to the corresponding port.
0: no
1: yes
Where, bit[8] corresponds to the CPU port and bit[9] corresponds to the upstream port.

Member.name: tagsel_up
Member.description:
