RegisterGroup.name: GLB_IRQ_STAT
RegisterGroup.description: GLB_IRQ_STAT is an interrupt status register. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: int_rxd_down
Member.description:
Interrupt status (multi-packet interrupt) for a frame (frames) on the downstream port to be received by the CPU.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. There are frames to be received by the CPU in the receive queue.
After this interrupt is generated, software checks whether there are frames to be received by querying the GLB_IRQ_RAW[iraw_rxd_down].

Member.name: int_freeeq_down
Member.description:
Interrupt status for the transmit queue of the downstream port to change from non-empty to empty, indicating that the transmit queue buffer changes from non-empty to empty and the CPU can write a group of new frames to be transmitted.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The transmit queue changes from non-empty to empty.
After this interrupt is generated, software checks whether the current transmit queue is empty by querying UD_GLB_ADDRQ_STAT[eq_cnt]. If the current transmit queue is not empty, the interrupt is invalid.

Member.name: int_stat_down
Member.description:
Interrupt status for downstream port status changes, indicating that an interrupt is generated when the MDIO obtains the speed change, duplex mode change, and link status change of the PHY in adaptive mode.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The port status changes.
After this interrupt is generated, software determines the status to be changed according to the configuration of UD_MDIO_IRQENA.

Member.name: int_duplex_down
Member.description:
Interrupt status for downstream port duplex mode changes.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The duplex mode changes.
After this interrupt is generated, software checks whether the duplex mode changes by querying UD_MAC_STAT_CHANGE[duplex_stat_ch].

Member.name: int_speed_down
Member.description:
Interrupt status for downstream port speed mode changes.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The speed mode changes.
After this interrupt is generated, software checks whether the speed mode changes by querying UD_MAC_STAT_CHANGE[speed_stat_ch].

Member.name: int_link_down
Member.description:
Interrupt status for downstream port link status changes.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The link status changes.
After this interrupt is generated, software checks whether the link status changes by querying UD_MAC_STAT_CHANGE[link_stat_ch].

Member.name: int_tx_down
Member.description:
Interrupt status for the downstream port to transmit a frame from the CPU.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The frame transmission is complete.
After this interrupt is generated, software determines whether to release the buffer of the transmitted frames by querying UD_GLB_QSTAT[eq_out_index].

Member.name: int_rx_down
Member.description:
Interrupt status for frames on the downstream port to be received by the CPU.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. There are frames to be received by the CPU in the receive queue.
After this interrupt is generated, software checks whether there are frames to be received by querying GLB_IRQ_RAW[iraw_rxd_down].

Member.name: int_unknow_vlanm
Member.description:
Interrupt status for the port to receive unknown VLAN members.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. Unknown VLAN members are received.

Member.name: int_unknow_vlan
Member.description:
Interrupt status for the port to receive unknown VLAN.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. Unknown VLAN is received.

Member.name: int_mdio_finish
Member.description:
Interrupt status for the MDIO to complete the operation required by the CPU.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The MDIO has completed the operation required by the CPU.
After this interrupt is generated, software checks whether the MDIO completes the operation by querying MDIO_RWCTRL[finish].

Member.name: int_rxd_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status (multi-packet interrupt) for a frame (frames) on the upstream port to be received by the CPU.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. There are frames to be received by the CPU in the receive queue.
After this interrupt is generated, software checks whether there are frames to be received by querying GLB_IRQ_RAW[iraw_rxd_up].

Member.name: int_freeeq_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status for the transmit queue of the upstream port to change from non-empty to empty, indicating that the transmit queue buffer changes from non-empty to empty and the CPU can write a group of new frames to be transmitted.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The transmit queue changes from non-empty to empty.
After this interrupt is generated, software checks whether the current transmit queue is empty by querying UD_GLB_ADDRQ_STAT[eq_cnt]. If the current transmit queue is not empty, the interrupt is invalid.

Member.name: int_stat_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status for upstream port status changes, indicating that an interrupt is generated when the MDIO obtains the speed change, duplex mode change, and link status change of the PHY in auto-negotiation mode.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The port status changes.
After this interrupt is generated, software determines the status to be changed according to the configuration of UD_MDIO_IRQENA.

Member.name: int_duplex_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status for upstream port duplex mode changes.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The duplex mode changes.
After this interrupt is generated, software checks whether the duplex mode changes by querying UD_MAC_STAT_CHANGE[duplex_stat_ch].

Member.name: int_speed_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status for upstream port speed mode changes.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The speed mode changes.
After this interrupt is generated, software checks whether the speed mode changes by querying UD_MAC_STAT_CHANGE[speed_stat_ch].

Member.name: int_link_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status for upstream port link status changes.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The link status changes.
After this interrupt is generated, software checks whether the link status changes by querying UD_MAC_STAT_CHANGE[link_stat_ch].

Member.name: int_tx_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status for the upstream port to transmit a frame from the CPU.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. The frame transmission is complete.
After this interrupt is generated, software determines whether to release the buffer of the transmitted frames by querying the current transmit queue address eq_out_index in UD_GLB_QSTAT.

Member.name: int_rx_up
Member.description:
Interrupt status for frames on the upstream port to be received by the CPU.
0: The interrupt is invalid.
1: The interrupt is valid. There are frames to be received by the CPU in the receive queue.
After this interrupt is generated, software checks whether there are frames to be received by querying GLB_IRQ_RAW[iraw_rxd_up].

RegisterGroup.name: GLB_SPEVLANCTRL

Member.name: change_down
Member.description:
Indicates whether to replace the special VLAN with the port VLAN when special VLAN frames received from the downstream port are transmitted with VLAN tags.
0: no.
1: yes
Where, bit[25] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0, bit[26] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 1, and bit[27] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0xFFF.

Member.name: vtag2up_down
Member.description:
Indicates whether to add VLAN tags to the frames to be transmitted when the special VLAN frames received from the downstream port are forwarded to the upstream port.
0: no
1: yes
Where, bit[22] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0, bit[23] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 1, and bit[24] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0xFFF.

Member.name: fw2up_down
Member.description:
Indicates whether to forward the special VLAN frames received from the downstream port to the upstream port.
0: no
1: yes
Where, bit[19] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0, bit[20] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 1, and bit[21] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0xFFF.

Member.name: fw2cpu_down
Member.description:
Indicates whether to forward the special VLAN frames received from the downstream port to the CPU port.
0: no
1: yes
Where, bit[16] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0, bit[17] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 1, and bit[18] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0xFFF.

Member.name: change_up
Member.description:
Indicates whether to replace the special VLAN with the port VLAN when special VLAN frames received from the upstream port are transmitted with VLAN tags.
0: no
1: yes
Where, bit[9] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0, bit[10] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 1, and bit[11] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0xFFF.

Member.name: vtag2down_up
Member.description:
Indicates whether to add VLAN to the frames to be transmitted when the special VLAN frames received from the upstream port are forwarded to the downstream port.
0: no
1: yes
Where, bit[6] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0, bit[7] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 1, and bit[8] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0xFFF.

Member.name: fw2down_up
Member.description:
Indicates whether to forward the special VLAN frames received from the upstream port to the downstream port.
0: no
1: yes
Where, bit[3] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0, bit[4] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 1, and bit[5] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0xFFF.

Member.name: fw2cpu_up
Member.description:
Indicates whether to forward the special VLAN frames received from the upstream port to the CPU port.
0: no
1: yes
Where, bit[0] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0, bit[1] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 1, and bit[2] corresponds to the special VLAN frame whose VID is 0xFFF.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_IRQN_SET
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_IRQN_SET is a multi-packet interrupt configuration register. The register does notsupport soft reset.

Member.name: int_frm_cnt
Member.description:
These bits are used to set the multi-packet interrupt function. That is, how many packets must be received before a multi-packet interrupt can be reported.
Note: The minimum value of int_frm_cnt is 1. In this case, the multi-packet interrupt is equivalent to the single-packet interrupt.

Member.name: age_timer
Member.description:
After the multi-packet interrupt function is enabled, if the number of received packets cannot reach the specified value required for reporting the multi-packet interrupt after a period, this period is defined as the aging time for generating the multi-packet interrupt.
Note: age_timer is counted in the unit of the main clock cycle divided by 256.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_QLEN_SET
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_QLEN_SET is a queue length configuration register. The register does not supportsoft reset.

Member.name: iq_len
Member.description:
Receive (packet receiving) queue length configuration.
Note: iq_len cannot be set to 0; otherwise, it is forcibly set to 1. The sum of iq_len and eq_len cannot be greater than 64. Otherwise, iq_len (non-zero) takes priority over eq_lenis and eq_len is 64 - iq_len.

Member.name: eq_len
Member.description:
Transmit (packet transmitting) queue length configuration.
Note: eq_len cannot be set to 0; otherwise, it is forcibly set to 1.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_FC_LEVEL
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_FC_LEVEL is a traffic control register. The register does not support soft reset.The configured traffic control value of the forward buffer is a multiple of 64 bytes. The upper limit oftraffic control for the forward buffer is 3,072 bytes (two packets with the size of 1,536 bytes each) bydefault. When the bytes stored in the buffer reach 3,072 bytes, the traffic control function is enabled forthe buffer. The lower limit of traffic control for the forward buffer is 1,536 bytes by default. When thebytes stored in the buffer are less than 1,536 bytes, the traffic control function is enabled if the trafficcontrol function is enabled.

Member.name: blimit_up
Member.description:
Upper limit of traffic control for the forward buffer. When the bytes stored in the active forward buffer reach or exceed the upper limit, a traffic control message is transmitted to the peer end if the traffic control for the forward buffer is enabled.
Note: If the upper limit blimit_up is set to 0, the forward buffer is always in traffic control state.
The upper limit blimit_up must be greater than the lower limit blimit_down.

Member.name: blimit_down
Member.description: Lower limit of traffic control for the forward buffer. When the bytes stored in the active forward buffer are less than the lower limit, the current traffic control is disabled.

Member.name: blimit_ena
Member.description:
Traffic control enable for forward buffer.
0: disabled (do not transmit a traffic control message based on the status of the forward buffer)
1: enabled (transmit a traffic control message based on the status of the forward buffer)

Member.name: qlimit_ena
Member.description:
Traffic control enable for the receive queue.
0: disabled (do not transmit a traffic control message based on the status of receive queue).
1: enabled (transmit a traffic control message based on the status of receive queue).

Member.name: qlimit_up
Member.description:
Upper limit of traffic control for the receive queue. When the available space of the receive queue is less than the upper limit, a traffic control message is transmitted to the peer end if the traffic control for receive queue is enabled.
Note: If the upper limit qlimit_up is set to 0, the receive queue fails to enter the traffic control status.
The upper limit qlimit_up must be greater than the lower limit qlimit_down.

Member.name: qlimit_down
Member.description: Lower limit of traffic control for receive queue. When the available space of the receive queue is equal to or greater than the upper limit, the current traffic control is disabled if the receive queue is in traffic control status.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_CAUSE
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_CAUSE is a register for reporting causes to the CPU. The register does not supportsoft reset.

Member.name: vlant_cause
Member.description:
Packet matching result types by querying the VLAN table.
000: VLAN function disable
001: received frame without VLAN tag
010: special VLAN packet (VID = 0x0)
011: special VLAN packet (VID = 0x1)
100: special VLAN packet (VID = 0xFFF)
101: unknown VLAN member packet
110: packet matching the VLAN table (not unknown VLAN member)
111: unknown VLAN packet

Member.name: mact_cause
Member.description:
Packet matching result types by querying the MAC table.
000: forcible forwarding
001: packet whose destination MAC address is the local MAC address
010: broadcast packet
011: packet matching the MAC table
100: Multicast packet not matching the MAC table
101: Unicast packet not matching the MAC table
Others: reserved
Note: When mact_cause is 000 (forcible forwarding), vlant_cause is invalid (ignored).

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_RXFRM_SADDR
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_RXFRM_SADDR is a received frame start address register. The register does notsupport soft reset.

Member.name: rxfrm_saddr
Member.description: Start address of a received frame.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_IQFRM_DES
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_IQFRM_DES is a received frame descriptor register. The register does not supportsoft reset.

Member.name: fd_vlanid
Member.description: VLAN ID copied from the VLAN tag of a received frame (excluding the Pri and CFI fields).

Member.name: fd_vid_vld
Member.description:
Indicates whether the frame descriptor contains the VID (fd_vlanid) field. That is, whether the data in the fd_vlanid field of this register is valid.
0: no
1: yes

Member.name: frm_vlan_vld
Member.description:
Indicates whether the packet transmitted to the CPU port contains a VLAN tag.
0: no
1: yes

Member.name: fd_in_addr
Member.description: Relative address of the first frame to be received in the receive queue. It serves as the index (0 to iq_len-1) of the absolute address of the frame.

Member.name: fd_in_len
Member.description: Length of the frame to be received in the receive queue.

Member.name: startaddr_iq
Member.description: Header address (configured by the CPU) of the storage space corresponding to a received frame. The received frame applies for the bus based on this address.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_BFC_STAT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_BFC_STAT is a counter for traffic control status of forward buffer and aging timeof multi-packet interrupt. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: timerover_cnt
Member.description:
Register for the count of multi-packet interrupt aging time counter overflow events (the count reaches the configured value).
Note: If the value of timerover_cnt is too large during a period, UD_GLB_IRQN_SET[int_frm_cnt] is set inappropriately. Multi-packet interrupt is triggered by the aging time. Therefore, the configured value must be reduced.

Member.name: flowctrl_cnt
Member.description:
Count that the forward buffer of the upstream or downstream port enters the traffic control status.
Note: If the value of flowctrl_cnt is too large during a period, UD_GLB_FC_LEVEL[blimit_up] or UD_GLB_FC_LEVEL[blimit_down] is set to a too small value, or the external network is deteriorated. In this case, the configured value needs to be decreased.

Member.name: add_fd_addr_out
Member.description: Header address of the transmitted frame added by the CPU to the transmit queue.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_EQFRM_LEN
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_EQFRM_LEN is a transmit queue frame length configuration register. The registerdoes not support soft reset.

Member.name: add_fd_len_out
Member.description:
Length of a transmitted frame that is added to the transmit queue by the CPU.
Configure this register to trigger hardware so that software can write the header address and length of the transmitted frame to the transmit queue for transmission. When transmitting a frame, software must write its header address and the length of the frame in sequence.
Note: The frames whose add_fd_len_out is less than 20 bytes or greater than 1600 bytes are dropped. In other words, the allowed frame must range from 20 bytes to 1600 bytes.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_QSTAT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_QSTAT is a queue status register. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: iq_in_index
Member.description: Receive index of the receive (packet receiving) queue.

Member.name: cpuw_index
Member.description: Receive index of frame header address of the receive (packet receiving) queue.

Member.name: eq_in_index
Member.description: Receive index of frame descriptors in the transmit (packet transmitting) queue.

Member.name: eq_out_index
Member.description: Transmit index of frame descriptors in the transmit (packet transmitting) queue.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_ADDRQ_STAT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_ADDRQ_STAT is an address queue status register. The register does not supportsoft reset.

Member.name: cpuaddr_in_rdy
Member.description:
Indicates whether the CPU can configure the frame header address of the receive queue.
0: no
1: yes
Note: The values of cpuaddr_in_rdy and eq_in_rdy are set to 0 during reset. The values, however, are immediately set to 1 by the circuit after reset. In other words, the iq address queue and eq descriptor queue are configurable after reset.

Member.name: eq_in_rdy
Member.description:
Indicates whether the CPU can configure the frame descriptor (header address and length) of the transmit queue.
0: no
1: yes

Member.name: cpu_cnt
Member.description: Header address count for available frames assigned by the CPU to the receive queue.

Member.name: iq_cnt
Member.description: Used length of the receive queue (0 to iq_len).

Member.name: eq_cnt
Member.description: Used length of the transmit queue (0 to eq_len).

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_FC_TIMECTRL
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_FC_TIMECTRL is a traffic control time configuration register. The register doesnot support soft reset.

Member.name: flux_timer_cfg
Member.description: Traffic limit time interval counter, which is used to count the frequency division clock generated by flux_timer_inter. If this counter is set to 0, traffic limit is not enabled.

Member.name: flux_timer_inter
Member.description: Traffic limit time slot counter, which is used to count the main clock. The default count is 100,000. For a 100-MHz main clock, the time slot is 1 ms.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_FC_RXLIMIT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_FC_RXLIMIT is a traffic control limit configuration register. The register does notsupport soft reset.

Member.name: flux_cfg
Member.description: Traffic limit upper threshold register. This group of bits is used to limit the number of frames received by software at the traffic limit time interval. The frames received after the configured upper threshold is exceeded are selectively dropped or received according to the configuration. When these bits are all set to 0, the traffic limit is not enabled.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_GLB_FC_DROPCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: UD_GLB_FC_DROPCTRL is a packet drop control register for traffic limit. The registerdoes not support soft reset.

Member.name: flux_uni
Member.description:
Indicates whether to drop unicast packets when the upper threshold of traffic limit is exceeded.
0: no
1: yes

Member.name: flux_multi
Member.description:
Indicates whether to drop multicast packets when the upper threshold of traffic limit is exceeded.
0: no
1: yes

Member.name: flux_broad
Member.description:
Indicates whether to drop broadcast packets when the upper threshold of traffic limit is exceeded.
0: no
1: yes

RegisterGroup.name: UD_STS_PORTCNT

Member.name: rxeof_cnt

Member.name: rxcrcok_cnt

Member.name: rxcrcbad_cnt

Member.name: txsof_cnt

Member.name: txeof_cnt

Member.name: txcrcok_cnt
Member.description: Count of frames without CRC errors transmitted by the port.

Member.name: txcrcbad_cnt
Member.description: Count of frames with CRC errors transmitted by the port.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_PORT2CPU_PKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_PORT2CPU_PKTS is a register for the total number of packets received by the CPUfrom the upstream or downstream port. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: pkts_cpu
Member.description: Total number of packets received by the CPU port from the upstream or downstream port. Writing 0 clears this register and writing 1 has no effect.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_CPU2IQ_ADDRCNT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_CPU2IQ_ADDRCNT is a register for the count of configuring packet receiving addressqueue by the CPU. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: addr_cpu
Member.description: Count of configuring packet receiving address queue by the CPU successfully. Writing 0 clears this register and writing 1 has no effect.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_RX_IRQCNT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_RX_IRQCNT is a register for the count of reporting single-packet interrupt by theupstream or downstream port. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.description: Count of the frame receive interrupts reported by the upstream or downstream port. Writing 0 clears this register and writing 1 has no effect.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_CPU2EQ_PKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_CPU2EQ_PKTS is a register for the total number of packets transmitted by the CPU tothe upstream or downstream port. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: pkts_cpu2tx
Member.description: Total number of packets transmitted by the CPU to the upstream or downstream port. Writing 0 clears this register and writing 1 has no effect.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_RX_DVCNT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_RX_DVCNT is an RXDV rising edge count register. The register does not support softreset.

Member.name: rxdvrise
Member.description: Count of all RXDV rising edges.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_RX_OCTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_RX_OCTS is the register for the total number of bytes received. The register does notsupport soft reset.

Member.name: ifinoctets
Member.description: Count of all received bytes, including the bytes in correct frames, error frames, and preambles. The frames without valid start of frame delimiters (SFDs) are not counted.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_RX_RIGHTOCTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_RX_RIGHTOCTS is a register for the total number of bytes of received correct packets.The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: octets_rx
Member.description: Count of the received bytes, including the bytes in correct frames and error frames but excluding the bytes in preambles. The frames without valid SFDs are not counted.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_HOSTMAC_PKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_HOSTMAC_PKTS is a register for the count of packets matching the local MAC address.The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: local_mac_match
Member.description: Count of correct received frames whose destination MAC address is the same as the local MAC address, excluding runt frames, jumbo frames, frames with CRC errors, pause frames, and transfer error frames.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_RX_RIGHTPKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_RX_RIGHTPKTS is a register for the total number of packets received by the port. Theregister does not support soft reset.

Member.name: pkts
Member.description: Count of all frames.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_RX_BROADPKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_RX_BROADPKTS is a register for the count of correct broadcast packets. The registerdoes not support soft reset.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_RX_MULTPKTS

RegisterGroup.name: UD_RX_UNIPKTS

Member.name: ifinucastpkts
Member.description: Count of unicast frames with valid length and without CRC errors, excluding pause frames and transfer error frames.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_RX_ERRPKTS

RegisterGroup.name: UD_RX_CRCERR_PKTS

RegisterGroup.name: UD_RX_LENERR_PKTS

Member.name: abnormalsizepkts

RegisterGroup.name: UD_RX_OCRCERR_PKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_RX_OCRCERR_PKTS is a register for the count of packets with odd nibbles and CRCerrors. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: dot3alignmenterr

RegisterGroup.name: UD_RX_PAUSE_PKTS

RegisterGroup.name: UD_FLUX_TOL_DPKTS

RegisterGroup.name: UD_FW2OTHER_PKTS

RegisterGroup.name: UD_NOEXIT_PKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_NOEXIT_PKTS is a register for the total number of received packets without destinationforwarding ports. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: pkts_drop
Member.description: Count of the (dropped) packets neither forwarded to the CPU port nor to another port.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_2ALL_PKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_2ALL_PKTS is a register for the total number of received packets forwarded to anothertwo ports at the same time. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: fw2all_pkts
Member.description: Count of the packets forwarded to both the CPU port and another port.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_FWBUF_OVERCNT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_FWBUF_OVERCNT is a register for the count of forward buffer overflow events. Theregister does not support soft reset.

Member.name: fwbuf_over
Member.description: Count of forward buffer overflow events of the upstream port or downstream port.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_TX_PKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_TX_PKTS is a register for the total number of packets transmitted successfully. Theregister does not support soft reset.

Member.name: pkts_tx
Member.description: Count of all configured transmitted frames, excluding the frames dropped due to timeout and the transmitted frames whose length configured by using UD_GLB_EQFRM_LEN is not within valid range.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_TX_BROADPKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_TX_BROADPKTS is a register for the count of broadcast packets transmittedsuccessfully. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: broadcastpkts_tx
Member.description: Count of broadcast frames transmitted successfully (excluding retransmission).

RegisterGroup.name: UD_TX_MULTPKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_TX_MULTPKTS is a register for the count of multicast packets transmitted successfully.The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: multicastpkts_tx
Member.description: Count of multicast frames transmitted successfully (excluding retransmission).

RegisterGroup.name: UD_TX_UNIPKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_TX_UNIPKTS is a register for the count of unicast packets transmitted successfully. Theregister does not support soft reset.

Member.name: ifoutucastpkts_tx
Member.description: Count of unicast frames transmitted successfully (excluding retransmission).

RegisterGroup.name: UD_TX_OCTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_TX_OCTS is a register for the total number of transmitted bytes. The register does notsupport soft reset.

Member.name: octets_tx
Member.description: Total number of transmitted bytes, including the bytes of retransmitted frames, correct frames, and error frames, but excluding the preamble bytes.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_TX_PAUSE_PKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_TX_PAUSE_PKTS is the register for the count of transmitted pause frames. The registerdoes not support soft reset.

Member.name: dot3outpause
Member.description: Count of transmitted pause frames.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_TX_RETRYCNT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_TX_RETRYCNT is a register for the total number of retransmission. The register doesnot support soft reset.

Member.name: retry_times_tx
Member.description: Count of retransmissions of transmitted frames.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_TX_COLCNT
RegisterGroup.description: UD_TX_COLCNT is a register for the total number of collisions. The register does notsupport soft reset.

Member.name: collisions
Member.description: Count of collisions.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_TX_LC_PKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_TX_LC_PKTS is a register for the count of packets with late collision. The register doesnot support soft reset.

Member.name: dot3latecol
Member.description: Count of packets with late collision.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_TX_COLOK_PKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_TX_COLOK_PKTS is a register for the count of packets transmitted successfully withcollisions. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: dot3col_ok
Member.description: Count of packets transmitted successfully with collisions.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_TX_RETRY15_PKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_TX_RETRY15_PKTS is a register for the count of packets dropped due to more than 15times of retransmission. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: dot3excessivecol
Member.description: Count of the packets dropped due to more than 15 times of retransmission.

RegisterGroup.name: UD_TX_RETRYN_PKTS
RegisterGroup.description: UD_TX_RETRYN_PKTS is a register for the count of packets with the collision count beingequal to the threshold. The register does not support soft reset.

Member.name: dot3colcnt
Member.description: Count of packets with the collision count being equal to the threshold. This register is set by UD_MAC_SET[colthreshold].

RegisterGroup.name: TS_INTERFACE
RegisterGroup.description: TS_INTERFACE is an interface register.

Member.name: port_sel
Member.description:
Port enable control.
0: disabled
1:enabled
The parameters of a port can be configured only when the port is disabled.

Member.name: bit_sel
Member.description:
Input bit select.
0: cdata[7] is the parallel most significant bit (MSB) or a serial data line.
1: cdata[0] is the parallel MSB or a serial data line.

Member.name: serial_sel
Member.description:
Input mode select.
0: parallel input
1: serial input

Member.name: err_pol
Member.description:
Port err signal polarity select.
0: A data error occurs when the err signal is high.
1: A data error occurs when the err signal is low.

Member.name: vld_pol
Member.description:
Port vld signal polarity select.
0: active high
1: active low

Member.name: sync_pol
Member.description:
sync signal polarity select of the S port.
0: active high
1: active low

Member.name: err_bypass
Member.description:
Port err signal mask select. After mask, the input err values are not sampled and considered as invalid values.
0: not mask
1: mask

Member.name: sync_mode
Member.description:
Parallel input mode select.
00: sync/burst mode
01: sync/valid mode
10: nosync_fixed mode. The length of each detected packet is specified by nosync_fixed_204.
11: nosync_188_204 mode. The hardware needs to check whether the packet length is 204 bytes or 188 bytes.

Member.name: nosync_fixed_204
Member.description:
Valid in nosync_fixed mode only.
0: detect 188-byte packets
1: detect 204-byte packets

Member.name: syncoff_th
Member.description: Synchronization loss judgment threshold. This field is valid in nosync mode.

Member.name: syncon_th
Member.description: Synchronization lock judgment threshold. This field is valid in nosync mode.

RegisterGroup.name: ETS_COUNT

Member.name: ets_count_ctrl

11: Reserved.

RegisterGroup.name: TS_AFIFO_WFULL_ERR

Member.description: Reserved (read as 0).

Member.description: Whether an overflow error occurs in the interface FIFO. Reading this bit clears it.

RegisterGroup.name: TS_AFIFO_WFULL_STATUS
RegisterGroup.description: TS_AFIFO_WFULL_STATUS is an interface FIFO full flag register.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved (read as 0).

Overflow flag of the interface FIFO (valid only for the DVB interface).

RegisterGroup.name: TS_SYNC_FLAG

Member.description: Reserved (read as 0).

188 detection success indicator.

Member.name: sync_204_success

204 detection success indicator.
0: failure

RegisterGroup.name: DMX_PID_CTRLN
RegisterGroup.description: DMX_PID_CTRLN is a PID channel configuration register.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved (read as 0).

Member.name: ch_attri
Member.description:
Type of a PID channel.
000: general-purpose channel 0
001: reserved
010: general-purpose channel 2. The PES data length is not checked.
010: general-purpose channel 3. The PES data length is not checked when the PES length field is 0.
100~101: reserved
110: audio channel
111: video channel

Member.name: ts_post_th
Member.description:
Entire TS packet post threshold.
0x00: An SOP interrupt is reported after one TS packet is posted.
0x01~0x3F: An SOP interrupt is reported after a specified number of TS packets are posted.

Member.name: ts_post_mode
Member.description:
Mode select.
0: The TS_POST mode is not selected.
1: The TS_POST mode is selected.

Member.name: cc_equ_rve
Member.description:
Whether to retain CC duplicate packets.
0: drop
1: retain

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved (for internal use).

Member.name: cc_discon_ctrl
Member.description:
CC discontinuity processing mode select.
0: The TS packets with CC discontinuity are not dropped.
1: The TS packets with CC discontinuity are dropped.

Member.name: crc_mode
Member.description:
CRC configuration of a playing channel.
000: No CRC32 check is performed.
001: A CRC32 check is performed and the packets with CRC errors are dropped.
010: A CRC32 check is performed and the packets with CRC errors are posted.
011: The syntax determines whether a CRC32 check is performed and the packets with CRC errors are dropped.
100: The syntax determines whether a CRC32 check is performed and the packets with or without CRC errors are posted.
Others: reserved

Member.name: af_mode
Member.description:
Operating mode select for the adaptation field.
00: The AF is posted.
01: The AF is not posted.
10: The undefined AF is not posted.
11: reserved

Member.name: do_scram
Member.description:
Processing mode select for the scrambled data.
0: The scrambled data is not descrambled.
1: The scrambled data is descrambled.

Member.name: cw_index
Member.description: Descrambling key index, corresponding to 32 groups of CWs.

Member.name: data_type
Member.description:
Data type indicator.
00: Section data
01: PES data
Others: reserved

Whether to filter the TEI bit.

Member.description:
Mode of judging CC repeated packets.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved (read as 0).

Member.description: New filter mask for the SCD channel. The filtering starts after the start code of the ES is masked.

Member.description: Lower limit of the new filter for the SCD channel.

Member.description: Upper limit of the new filter for the SCD channel.

RegisterGroup.name: SCD_NEW_FLT_NEG
RegisterGroup.description: SCD_NEW_FLT_NEG is a filtering mode register of the new filter for the SCD channel. Thisregister is valid for Hi3716M V200 and reserved for other chips.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved (read as 0).

Member.name: new_flt_neg
Member.description:
Filtering mode of the new filter for the SCD channel. If the data passes filtering, it is considered that the data is discarded forcibly. Otherwise, the data is received.
0: received
1: forcibly discarded

RegisterGroup.name: SCD_OLD_FLT_NEG

Member.name: reserved
Member.description: Reserved (read as 0).

Member.name: old_flt_neg
Member.description:
Filtering mode of the old filter for the SCD channel. If the data passes filtering, it is considered that the data is discarded forcibly. Otherwise, the data is received.
0: received
1: forcibly discarded

0: No interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: PVR_VERSION_NUM
RegisterGroup.description: PVR_VERSION_NUM is a PVR version register.

RegisterGroup.name: DMX_FILTERXY
RegisterGroup.description: DMX_FILTERxy is a filter configuration register.

Member.name: wdata_mode
Member.description:
Byte filtering mode.
This field is valid only after bytes are filtered.
0: match
1: not match

Member.name: wdata_content
Member.description: Contents of the filtered byte.

Member.name: wdata_mask
Member.description:
Mask bit corresponding to each filtered byte.
If the mask bit is 0, the corresponding bits of the filtered byte are not compared and considered as matched bits.

RegisterGroup.name: DMX_FILTER_ENN
RegisterGroup.description: DMX_FILTER_ENn is a filtering enable configuration register.

Member.name: dmx_filter_en
Member.description:
32 filters enable of channel n.
Bit 32 to bit 0 each correspond to a filter.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: DMX_FILTER_MINN
RegisterGroup.description: DMX_FILTER_MINn is a minimum filtering byte configuration register.

Member.name: dmx_flt_min_byte
Member.description:
Minimum filtering byte of channel n.
For the Section data, the value of n ranges from 2 to 12, and the minimum data length ranges from 4 bytes to 14 bytes; for the PES data, the value of n ranges from 1 to 12, and the minimum data length ranges from 6 bytes to 17 bytes.

0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iraw_d2b_r_ovfl
Member.description:
Raw overflow interrupt of the internal buffer DMX2BUF of the recording channel.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: INT_STA_TYPE
RegisterGroup.description: INT_STA_TYPE is a same type of interrupt enable register

Member.name: iint_oq_ovfl_err
Member.description:
If an overflow occurs in an output queue and the current descriptor is invalid during PES and Section data processing, an error interrupt is generated because the overflow cannot be processed.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iint_fq_ovfl_err
Member.description:
If an overflow occurs in a free queue and the current descriptor is invalid during PES and Section data processing, an error interrupt is generated because the overflow cannot be processed.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iint_fq_desc_err
Member.description:
Status of the free descriptor configuration error interrupt. This interrupt is generated when the maximum size of the buffer corresponding to a free descriptor is smaller than the length of the Section data.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iint_fq_cfg_err
Member.description:
Status of the free queue configuration error interrupt. This interrupt is generated when a free queue is configured to be used in an output queue, but the free queue is disabled.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iint_d2b_f_ovfl

Member.name: iint_clr_chn
Member.description:
Status of the channel clear done interrupt.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iint_chn_o
Member.description:
Status of the overflow or almost overflow interrupt of linked-list channels.
bit[12] corresponds to linked-list channels 0~31.
bit[13] corresponds to linked-list channels 32~63.
bit[14] corresponds to linked-list channels 64~95.
bit[15] corresponds to linked-list channels 96~127.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iint_eop_o
Member.description:
Status of the EOP all interrupt of linked-list channels.
bit[8] corresponds to linked-list channels 0~31.
bit[9] corresponds to linked-list channels 32~63.
bit[10] corresponds to linked-list channels 64~95.
bit[11] corresponds to linked-list channels 96~127.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iint_desc_o
Member.description:
Status of the descriptor enqueue all interrupt of linked-list channels.
bit[4] corresponds to linked-list channels 0~31.
bit[5] corresponds to linked-list channels 32~63.
bit[6] corresponds to linked-list channels 64~95.
bit[7] corresponds to linked-list channels 96~127.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iint_chn_i
Member.description:
Status of the overflow or almost overflow all interrupt of free queues.
bit[2] corresponds to free queues 0~31.
bit[3] corresponds to free queues 32~39.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: ENA_INT_TYPE
RegisterGroup.description: ENA_INT_TYPE is a same type of interrupt enable register.

Member.name: iena_oq_ovfl_err
Member.description:
If an overflow occurs in an output queue and the current descriptor is invalid during PES and Section data processing, an error interrupt is enabled because the overflow cannot be processed.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iena_fq_ovfl_err
Member.description:
If an overflow occurs in a free queue and the current descriptor is invalid during PES and Section data processing, an error interrupt is enabled because the overflow cannot be processed.
1: An interrupt is generated.
0: No interrupt is generated.

Member.name: iena_fq_desc_err
Member.description:
Enable for the free descriptor configuration error interrupt. This interrupt is generated when the maximum size of the buffer corresponding to a free descriptor is smaller than the length of the Section data.
1: enabled
0: disabled

Member.name: iena_fq_cfg_err
Member.description:
Enable for the free queue configuration error interrupt. This interrupt is generated when a free queue is configured to be used in an output queue, but the free queue is disabled.
1: enabled
0: disabled

RegisterGroup.name: FQ_WR_MASK
RegisterGroup.description: FQ_WR_MASK is a write mask bit configuration register for free queues.

Member.name: fq_msk_ena
Member.description:
This bit is valid only when a free queue is enabled. When this bit is enabled, the fq_mask bit is valid. Then you can write to any domain of the word of a free queue by controlling the fq_mask bit. Otherwise, you can only write to a specified domain of the free queue.
1: Any domain of a free queue can be written forcibly.
0: Only the specified domain of a free queue can be written.

Member.name: fq_mask
Member.description:
Mask bit when a free queue is being written. This bits[3:0] correspond to bit [31:24], bit [23:16], bit [15:8], and bit [7:0] respectively.
1: Eight bits are masked to avoid from being written.
0: No bit is masked.

RegisterGroup.name: OQ_WR_MASK
RegisterGroup.description: OQ_WR_MASK is a write mask bit configuration register for output queues.

Member.name: oq_msk_ena
Member.description:
When an output queue is enabled, you can configure this bit to set a mask bit forcibly by using the software. Then you can write to a specified word. Otherwise, you can only write to a specified domain of the output queue by using the software. When no output queue is enabled, this bit is unavailable.
1: Any domain of an output queue can be written forcibly.
0: Any domain of an output queue cannot be written forcibly.

Member.name: oq_mask
Member.description:
Mask bit when an output queue is being written. This field corresponds to bit [31:24], bit [23:16], bit [15:8], and bit [7:0] respectively.
1: Eight bits are masked to avoid from being written.
0: No bit is masked.

RegisterGroup.name: CLR_WAIT_TIME
RegisterGroup.description: CLR_WAIT_TIME is a maximum clear channel wait time register.

Member.name: clr_wait_time
Member.description: Maximum wait time till channels are cleared. If no data is written, the channel clear operation is automatically completed after the wait time is reached.

RegisterGroup.name: CLR_CHN_CMD
RegisterGroup.description: CLR_CHN_CMD is a channel clear start register.

Member.name: clear_type
Member.description:
If the buffer channel to be cleared is mounted on a playing channel, this field is set to 0.
If the buffer channel to be cleared is mounted on a recording channel, this field is set to 1.
If the buffer channel to be cleared is mounted on an index channel, this field is set to 2.

Member.name: clear_start
Member.description: Channel clear operation start. The channel clear operation is started when this bit is set to 1. After the clear operation, the logic clears this bit automatically.

Member.name: clear_chn
Member.description: ID of the channel to be cleared.

RegisterGroup.name: IPT_SYNC_TH_CFG
RegisterGroup.description: IP0_SYNC_TH_CFG is a synchronization detection configuration register for IP channel t.

Member.name: ipt_sync_type
Member.description:
Synchronization detection type of IP channel t.
00: nosync_188
01: nosync_204
10: nosync_188_204. The hardware needs to check whether the packet length is 204 bytes or 188 bytes.
11: reserved

Member.name: ipt_loss_th
Member.description: Synchronization loss detection threshold of IP channel t.

Member.name: ipt_sync_th
Member.description: Synchronization detection threshold of IP channel t.

RegisterGroup.name: IPT_TS_RATE_CFG

Member.name: ipt_rate_cfg
Member.description: TS output rate of IP channel t. That is, one byte is output every other n clock cycles. The value of n ranges from 3 to 255.

Member.name: rst_busy
Member.description:
JPEG reset.
0: The JPEG is reset.
1: The JPEG is being reset.

Member.name: jpeg_dec_start
Member.description: JPEG decoding start. When 1 is written to this register, the JPEG decoder is started for decoding. After decoding starts, the register is cleared automatically.

Member.name: last_resume_in_pic
Member.description:
Indicates whether the streams are the last segment of resumed streams of the current frame.
0: no
1: yes
Note: This bit must be configured no matter whether the decoder needs to be restarted by resuming streams.

Member.name: jpeg_resume_start
Member.description: JPEG stream resuming start. When 1 is written to this register, streams start to be resumed to the JPEG decoder. After stream resuming starts, the register is cleared automatically.

Member.name: vhb_uv_stride
Member.description: UV component stride, a multiple of 64 bytes.

Member.name: vhb_y_stride
Member.description: Y component stride, a multiple of 64 bytes.

Member.name: pic_height_in_mcu
Member.description: Picture height, in the unit of minimum coded unit (MCU).

Member.name: pic_width_in_mcu
Member.description: Picture width, in the unit of MCU.

Member.name: pic_type
Member.description:
Picture type.
000: YUV400
001: reserved
010: reserved
011: YUV420
100: YUV422 1x2
101: YUV422 2x1
110: YUV444
111: reserved

Member.name: bb_staddr
Member.description: Storage start address of the stream buffer, a multiple of 64 bytes.

Member.name: bb_endaddr
Member.description: Storage end address of the stream buffer, a multiple of 64 bytes.

Member.name: bs_staddr
Member.description: Stream storage start address, in the unit of byte.

Member.name: bs_endaddr
Member.description: Stream storage end address, in the unit of byte.

Member.name: pic_ystaddr
Member.description: Luminance address of the current reconstruction frame, that is, storage address of the Y component of a reconstruction picture (128-byte aligned).

Member.name: pic_uvstaddr
Member.description: Chrominance address of the current reconstruction frame, that is, storage address of U component and V component of a reconstruction picture (128-byte aligned).

Member.name: outstanding
Member.description: Number of AXI outstanding commands. The actual value is the configured value minus 1.

Member.name: freq_scale
Member.description:
Decoding scaling.
00: 1
01: 1/2
10: 1/4
11: 1/8

Member.name: int_over_time
Member.description: Decoding timeout interrupt, active high. This bit is cleared when 1 is written.

Member.name: debug_state
Member.description: State bit, for debugging. In high-level mode, this bit is cleared when 1 is written.

Member.name: int_bs_res
Member.description: Stream exhaust interrupt, active high. This bit is cleared when 1 is written.

Member.name: int_dec_err
Member.description: Decoding error interrupt, active high. This bit is cleared when 1 is written.

Member.name: int_dec_fnsh
Member.description: Current picture decoding completion interrupt, active high. This bit is cleared when 1 is written.

Member.name: intm_over_time
Member.description:
Decoding timeout interrupt mask.
0: not masked
1: masked

Member.name: intm_bs_res
Member.description:
Stream exhaust interrupt mask.
0: not masked
1: masked

Member.name: intm_dec_err
Member.description:
Decoding error interrupt mask.
0: not masked
1: masked

Member.name: intm_dec_fnsh
Member.description:
Decoding completion interrupt mask.
0: not masked
1: masked

Member.name: debug1
Member.description: Debugging bit. When the register works properly, do not change its value.

Member.name: qtab_cr
Member.description: Quantization table of the Cr component.

RegisterGroup.name: DEC_START
RegisterGroup.description: DEC_START is a PNG enable register.

Member.name: png_dec_start
Member.description:
PNG decoding enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
After the PNG decoding is enabled, this bit is cleared automatically.

RegisterGroup.name: RESUME_START
RegisterGroup.description: RESUME_START is a stream resuming start register.

Member.name: png_resume_start
Member.description:
Stream resuming enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
After the stream resuming is enabled, this bit is cleared automatically.

RegisterGroup.name: STRIDE
RegisterGroup.description: STRIDE is a final picture storage stride register.

Member.name: ahb_stride
Member.description: Line stride (16-byte aligned).

RegisterGroup.name: PNG_SIZE
RegisterGroup.description: PNG_SIZE is a picture size register.

Member.name: png_width
Member.description: Picture width (in pixels). The actual value is subtracted 1 from the width.

Member.name: png_height
Member.description: Picture height (in pixels). The actual value is subtracted 1 from the height.

RegisterGroup.name: PNG_TYPE
RegisterGroup.description: PNG_TYPE is a picture attribute register.

Member.name: stream_type
Member.description:
Input stream type select.
0: chunk
1: Z-lib stream

Member.name: png_fun_sel
Member.description:
PGD function select.
0: act as the PNG decoder
1: act as the Z-lib decoder

Member.name: png_interlace_type
Member.description:
Pass extraction select.
0: No pass is extracted.
1: Passes are extracted from seven passes.

Member.name: png_color_type
Member.description:
Picture type.
000: gray picture
010: true color picture
011: index color picture
100: gray picture with α channel data
110: true color picture with α channel data
Other values: reserved

Member.name: png_bitdepth
Member.description:
Bit depth.
0x1: 1 bit
0x2: 2 bits
0x4: 4 bits
0x8: 8 bits
0x10: 16 bits
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: FMT_OUT
RegisterGroup.description: FMT_OUT is a format conversion register.

Member.name: fmt_8_4_para
Member.description:
4-bit format that is converted from the 8-bit format.
000: ARGB4444
001: ARGB1555
010: RGB565
011: RGB555
100: RGB444
Other values: reserved

Member.name: fmt_add_a_para
Member.description:
Transparent color processing mode when channel A is added.
0: do not use the transparent color
1: use the transparent color

Member.name: fmt_16_8_para
Member.description:
Processing mode when a 16-bit format is converted into an 8-bit format.
0: discard the lower eight bits
1: process based on the formula H8 + ((L8 - H8 > 128) ? 1:0)
Where, H8 indicates upper eight bits, and L8 indicates lower eight bits.

Member.name: fmt_8_para
Member.description:
Mode of stuffing lower bits when a 1-bit, 2-bit, or 4-bit format is converted into an 8-bit format.
0: stuff with 0
1: stuff the previous valid bit repeatedly

Member.name: fmt_8_4
Member.description:
Mode of converting a format into a 4-bit format.
0: no reversion
1: set bit[7:0] to ARGB8888, and convert the format into a 4-bit format

Member.name: fmt_16_8
Member.description:
Bit depth conversion.
0: no reversion
1: convert the 16-bit depth into the 8-bit depth

Member.name: fmt_swap_a
Member.description:
A sequence change (8 bits or 16 bits).
0: no change
1: ABGR -> BGRA/AGray -> GrayA

Member.name: fmt_swap_rgb
Member.description:
RGB sequence change (8 bits or 16 bits).
0: no change
1: BGR -> RGB

Member.name: fmt_del_a
Member.description:
Processing mode when channel A is deleted (8 bits or 16 bits).
0: no conversion
1: –A

Member.name: fmt_add_a
Member.description:
Processing mode when channel A is added (8 bits or 16 bits).
0: no conversion
1: +A

Member.name: fmt_gray_rgb
Member.description:
Conversion from a gray picture to an RGB picture (8 bits or 16 bits).
0: no conversion
1: Gray -> BGR/AGray -> ABGR

Member.name: fmt_124_8
Member.description:
Conversion from a 1-bit/2-bit/4-bit gray picture to an 8-bit gray picture.
0: no conversion
1: 1 bit/2 bits/4 bits -> 8 bits

Member.name: fmt_byte_rev
Member.description:
Arrangement of a 1-bit/2-bit/4-bit pixel in a byte.
0: no change
1: change the arrangement

RegisterGroup.name: INT
RegisterGroup.description: INT is an interrupt query register.

Member.name: int_idat_crc_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that an IDAT CRC error occurs.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_adler_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that an Adler32 error occurs.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_zlib_cm_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the Z-lib streams are not compressed in deflate mode.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_zlib_cinfo_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the size of the Z-lib stream deflate window is greater than 32 KB.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_zlib_fdict_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the field of the Z-lib stream dictionary is 1.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_zlib_btype_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the block type of the Z-lib stream is 3.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_zlib_lenth_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that an error occurs when the length of the uncompressed Z-lib stream is checked.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_zlib_hlit_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the length of the dynamic Huffman literal table for decompressing the Z-lib stream is longer than 29.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_zlib_hdist_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the length of the dynamic Huffman distance table for decompressing the Z-lib stream is longer than 31.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_huff_dec_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that there is no corresponding Huffman code.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_dec_cpy_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the number of copy times is not 0 after the tables are decoded.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_flt_type_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the filtering type is greater than 4 during filtering.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_rdc_buf_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the end address is exceeded when the RDC module writes to a buffer.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_flt_buf_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the end address is exceeded when the FLT module writes to a buffer.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_fmt_buf_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the end address is exceeded when the FMT module writes to a buffer.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_dec_err
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that a decoding error occurs.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_bs_res
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the streams are used up.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

Member.name: int_dec_fnsh
Member.description:
Interrupt indicating that the current picture is decoded.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Writing 1 clears this bit.

RegisterGroup.name: CHUNK_IDAT_CNT
RegisterGroup.description: CHUNK_IDAT_CNT is an error count register.

Member.name: chunk_idat_err_cnt
Member.description: Count of error IDAT chunks.

Member.name: chunk_idat_cnt
Member.description: Total count of IDAT chunks.

RegisterGroup.name: RST_BUSY
RegisterGroup.description: RST_BUSY is soft reset readback register.

Member.name: rst_busy
Member.description:
Soft reset status.
0: reset
1: not reset

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_VER
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_VER is the TDE version register.

Member.name: version
Member.description: TDE version register

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_RST
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_RST is the soft reset register. TDE_RST is to soft-reset the TDE (excluding the registerthat is accessible to the CPU). The TDE is in the idle status.

Member.name: reset
Member.description: Soft reset. After the reset takes effect, this bit is set to 0 automatically through the hardware.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_CTRL is the global control register. TDE_CTRL is used to control the internaloperations of the TDE.Note:The CPU can read or write four global control signals at random. The four global control signals do notalways take effect.

Member.name: susp1
Member.description:
Suspend operation 1
0: Suspend operation 1 does not take effect.
1: Perform the suspend operation after the node command is complete.
The TDE is in suspend status. After the control bit is cleared by software, the TDE continues the internal operations.

Member.name: susp2
Member.description:
Suspend operation 2
0: Suspend operation 2 does not take effect.
1: The task is suspended after the current line operation is complete (the vertical resize and anti-flicker need to complete this command).
The TDE is in suspend status. After the control bit is cleared by software, the TDE continues the internal operations.

Member.name: susp3
Member.description:
Suspend operation 3
0: Suspend operation 3 does not take effect.
1: Perform the suspend operation after the latest node command is read.
The TDE is in suspend status. After the control bit is cleared by software, the TDE continues the internal operations.

Member.name: aqstart
Member.description:
AQ start task enable
0: not start
1: Write 1 to start the TDE task. After the TDE is started, this bit is set to 0 automatically by hardware.
When the TDE is in idle status, the AQ is enabled, and AQ start is set to 1, the AQ operation is started.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_SQ_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_SQ_ADDR is the instruction pointer register of the current SQ node. TDE_SQ_ADDRis used to display the current SQ node.Note:When the SQ is in operating status, TDE_SQ_ADDR is saved as the instruction pointer of thecurrent running SQ node.When the SQ is not in operating status, TDE_SQ_ADDR is saved as the last SQ node instructionpointer processed by the previous SQ.

Member.name: cur_sq_node_addr
Member.description: Start address for reporting the current node of the SQ

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_AQ_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_AQ_ADDR is the instruction pointer register of the current AQ node. TDE_AQ_ADDRis used to display the current AQ node.Note:When the AQ is in operating status, TDE_AQ_ADDR is saved as the instruction pointer of thecurrent running AQ node.When the AQ is not in operating status, TDE_AQ_ADDR is saved as the last AQ node instructionpointer processed by the previous AQ.

Member.name: cur_aq_node_addr
Member.description: Start address for reporting the current node of the AQ

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_STA
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_STA is the operating status register. TDE_STA is used to display the internal operatingstatus of the TDE.

Member.name: line_num
Member.description:
Number of lines that the current node has completed.
Note: line_num takes effect only when the TDE is normally or abnormally suspended; otherwise, line_num is invalid.

Member.name: link_empty
Member.description: Empty queue indicator.

Member.name: aqsq_exec
Member.description:
Internal working mode indicator of the TDE.
0: AQ processing mode
1: SQ processing mode

Member.name: dq_busy
Member.description: DMA queue idle indicator.

Member.name: busy
Member.description:
TDE busy indicator
0: idle
1: busy

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_INT
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_INT is the interrupt status register. TDE_INT is used to display the internal interruptstatus of the TDE.Note:The AQ and SQ interrupts do not occur at the same time. Configure the four AQ and SQ interrupts in thefollowing sequence: link_compld > node_compld > line_susp > rdy2start

Member.name: error
Member.description:
An error occurs during the TDE processing, resulting in suspension.
Note: The error interrupt is not controlled by the interrupt mask register. Therefore, it is always valid.

Member.name: aq_rdy2start
Member.description: After reading the latest node command, the AQ is suspended and interrupted.

Member.name: aq_line_susp
Member.description: The current line of the current node in the AQ is suspended and interrupted.

Member.name: aq_node_compld

Member.name: aq_link_compld
Member.description: After all the operations of the AQ are complete, the AQ is interrupted.

Member.name: sq_update

Member.name: sq_rdy2start
Member.description: After reading the latest node command, the SQ is suspended and interrupted.

Member.name: sq_line_susp
Member.description: The current line of the current node in the SQ is suspended and interrupted.

Member.name: sq_node_compld
Member.description: After the operations of the current node in the SQ are complete, the SQ is interrupted.

Member.name: sq_link_compld
Member.description: After all the operations of the SQ are complete, the SQ is interrupted.

Member.name: aq_en
Member.description:
AQ enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: aq_oper_mode
Member.description:
AQ re-trigger mode
0x0: Start the next AQ after the current AQ is complete.
0x4: Start the next AQ after the current line of the current AQ node is complete.
Other values: reserved.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_AQ_NADDR
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_AQ_NADDR is the AQ header pointer register.

Member.name: next_aq_node_addr
Member.description:
Start address for configuring the next node of the AQ.
Note: The start address must be 128-bit aligned, that is, the lower four bits of the address must be 0.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_AQ_UPDATE
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_AQ_UPDATE is the AQ header update parameter flag register.

Member.name: next_aq_update_ind
Member.description:
Indication of the register to be updated by the next AQ node
For example, the value configured in this register is 0010_0000_1011_0001_0000_0000_0100_1110, which indicates that the registers to be updated in the next node are registers 1, 2, 3, 6, 16, 20, 21, 23, and 29. (For details about the registers, see Table 8-1.)

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_NADDR
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_NADDR is the next instruction pointer register of the current operation.

Member.name: next_node_addr

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_UPDATE

Output CSC enable.

Member.name: sq_irq_mask
Member.description:
0x00: interrupt mask
0x01: enable SQ line suspension or line interrupt
0x02: enable the suspension and interrupt when the SQ reads the latest node command but does not start the picture operation
0x04: enable the interrupt when the operations of the current SQ node are complete
0x08: enable the interrupt when the operations of the SQ are complete
0x10: enable the interrupt when the SQ header is updated
Other values: reserved

Member.name: aq_irq_mask
Member.description:
0x0: interrupt mask
0x1: enable AQ line suspension or line interrupt
0x2: enable the suspension and interrupt when the AQ reads the latest node command but does not start the picture operation
0x4: enable the interrupt when the operations of the current AQ node are complete
0x8: enable the interrupt when the operations of the AQ are complete
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mb_en
Member.description: Macroblock operation enable.

Member.name: mb_mode
Member.description:
Macroblock processing mode.
000: high-quality luminance 2D filtering resize, VF/FF/HF
010: high-quality chroma 2D filtering resize or up-sampling, VF/HF
100: perform luminance and chroma combination after the chroma vertical and horizontal high-quality up-sampling (2D)
110: perform luminance and chroma combination (by copying chroma line, horizontal up-sampling of chroma, or not performing any operation on the chroma) and perform the luminance and chroma filtering resize (2D)
001: luminance hybrid mode
Others: reserved

Input CSC enable.

Member.name: src2_mod
Member.description:
Source bitmap 2 operating mode.
00: source bitmap 2 prohibited
01: source bitmap 2 comes from the picture data in the memory
10: source bitmap 2 comes from the pattern data in the memory
11: source bitmap 2 comes from the color fill register

Member.name: src1_mod
Member.description:
Source bitmap 1 operating mode.
000: source bitmap 1 prohibited
001: source bitmap 1 comes from the picture data in the memory (except direct copy)
011: source bitmap 1 comes from the color fill register (except direct filling)
101: perform the direct transfer function for source bitmap 1
111: perform the direct filling function for source bitmap 1
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_S1_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_S1_ADDR is the base address register of the source bitmap 1.

Member.name: s1_base_addr
Member.description:
Base address of source bitmap 1, namely, the address of the bitmap with the coordinate (0,0).
Byte and sub byte data type: The base address must be on the border of the byte. Pitch can be any multiple of byte.
Halfword data type: The base address must be on the border of halfword. Pitch must be a multiple of 2 x byte.
24-bit data type: The base address must be on the border of word. Pitch must be a multiple of 4 x byte.
Word data type: The base address must be on the border of word. Pitch must be a multiple of 4 x byte.
YCbCr422 data type: The base address must be on the border of word. Pitch must be a multiple of 4 x byte.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_S1_TYPE
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_S1_TYPE is the type register of the source bitmap 1.

Member.name: rgb_exp
Member.description:
RGB extension mode.
0: stuff lower bits with 0
1: copy the values of upper bits to lower bits

Member.name: v_scan_ord
Member.description:
Vertical scanning direction.
0: from top to bottom
1: from bottom to top

Member.name: h_scan_ord
Member.description:
Horizontal scanning direction.
0: left to right
1: right to left

Member.name: alpha_range
Member.description:
8-bit alpha range.
0: 0 to 128
1: 0 to 255

Member.name: s1_color_fmt
Member.description:
Source bitmap 1 pixel format.
0x00: RGB444
0x01: RGB555
0x02: RGB565
0x03: RGB888
0x04: ARGB4444
0x05: ARGB1555
0x06: ARGB8565
0x07: ARGB8888
0x08: CLUT1 (the most significant bit (MSB) relates to the most right pixel, similar to little endian)
0x09: CLUT2 (the MSB relates to the most right pixel, similar to little endian)
0x0A: CLUT4 (the MSB relates to the most right pixel, similar to little endian)
0x0B: CLUT8
0x0C: ACLUT44
0x0D: ACLUT88
0x10: A1 (the MSB relates to the most right pixel, similar to little endian)
0x11: A8
0x12: YCbCr888
0x13: AYCbCr8888
0x14: YCbCr422 (start pixel X-coordinate is an even number and the pixel width is an even number
0x16: byte
0x17: halfword
0x18: YCbCr400MB
0x19: YCbCr422MBH(1*2) (start pixel X-coordinate is an even number and the pixel width is an even number)
0x1A: YCbCr422MBV(2*1)
0x1B: YCbCr420MB (start pixel X-coordinate is an even number and the pixel width is an even number)
0x1C: YCbCr444MB
Other values: reserved

Member.name: pitch
Member.description:
Source bitmap 1 stride.
Byte and sub byte data type: The base address must be on the border of the byte. Pitch can be any multiple of byte.
Halfword data type: The base address must be on the border of halfword. Pitch must be a multiple of 2 x byte.
Word data type: The base address must be on the border of word. Pitch must be a multiple of 4 x byte.
YCbCr422 data type: The base address must be on the border of word. Pitch must be a multiple of 4 x byte.

RegisterGroup.description: TDE_S1_XY is the start position register of the source bitmap 1.

Member.description: Y-coordinate of the picture to be processed by source bitmap 1 (related to vertical scanning direction).

Member.name: x_coord
Member.description: X-coordinate of the picture to be processed by source bitmap 1 (related to horizontal scanning direction).

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_S1_FILL
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_S1_FILL is the filling color register of the source bitmap 1.

Member.name: s1_color_fill
Member.description:
Filling color of the source bitmap 1.
Direct filling mode: Fill a pixel value according to the format of the picture supported by source bitmap 1. Lower-bit alignment is required for the filling position, for example, fill the 1bpp pixel into s1_color_fill bit[0].
Color filling mode: Use the ARGB or AYCbCr 32-bit true color configured in the software.

Member.name: alpha_from
Member.description:

00: Value alpha is contained in the output data type. Alpha is the result of alpha blending resize or anti-flicker calculation.
01: Value alpha is contained in the output data type. Alpha comes from source bitmap 1.
10: Value alpha is contained in the output data type. Alpha comes from source bitmap 2.
11: Value alpha in the bitmap comes from the global alpha inside the chip.
Note: alpha_from takes effect except for alu_mode 4, 5, and 8 modes.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_TS_SIZE
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_TS_SIZE is the size register of the target bitmap (source bitmap 1).Note:In the case of non-macroblock operation, if the source bitmap 1 operation is involved, the size ofsource bitmap 1 is the same as that of the target bitmap.In the case of macroblock operation, the size of source bitmap 1 is related to the TDE_S2_SIZEregister. For details, see the TDE_S2_SIZE register.

Member.name: alpha_threshold_hi
Member.description: When the output data is in ARGB1555 format, alpha_threshold (alpha_threshold_hi is high four bit and alpha_threshold_lo is low four bit) is used as the judgment threshold. When the output alpha is greater than or equal to alpha_threshold, the output 1-bit alpha value is 1; otherwise, the output 1-bit alpha value is 0.

Member.name: s1_height
Member.description: Height of the output target/source bitmap 1 picture. (The size of the source bitmap 1 is always the same as that of the target picture.)

Member.name: alpha_threshold_lo
Member.description: When the output data is in ARGB1555 format, alpha_threshold (alpha_threshold_hi is high four bit and alpha_threshold_lo is low four bit) is used as the judgment threshold. When the output alpha is greater than or equal to alpha_threshold, the output 1-bit alpha value is 1; otherwise, the output 1-bit alpha value is 0.

Member.name: s1_width
Member.description: Width of the output target/source bitmap 1 picture. (The size of the source bitmap 1 is always the same as that of the target picture.)

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_COLOR_CONV
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_COLOR_CONV is the CLUT and CSC control register.

Member.name: alpha1
Member.description: In ARGB1555 mode, if the RGB extension mode rgb_exp is 1, the alpha value is 1. When the alpha is extended to 8 bits, the alpha value is alpha1. The value ranges from 0x00 to 0xff. 0x00 indicates full transparent and 0xff indicates not transparent.

Member.name: alpha0
Member.description: In ARGB1555 mode, if the RGB extension mode rgb_exp is 1, the alpha value is 0. When the alpha is extended to 8 bits, the alpha value is alpha0. The value ranges from 0x00 to 0xff. 0x00 indicates full transparent and 0xff indicates not transparent.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_RSZ_HSTEP
