Member.name: h_step
Member.description: Resize step in horizontal direction (4-bit integer and 12-bit decimal)

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_RSZ_Y_OFST
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_RSZ_Y_OFST is the phase offset register of the vertical filter.

Member.name: v_ofst
Member.description:
The offset of output initial pixel to input initial pixel in vertical direction (1-bit sign bit, 4-bit integer, 12-bit decimal)
Caution:
In the case of non-macroblock operation, v_ofst is 0.
In the case of macroblock operation, v_ofst is .

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_RSZ_X_OFST
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_RSZ_X_OFST is the phase offset register of the horizontal filter.

Member.name: h_ofst
Member.description:
The offset of output initial line to input initial line in horizontal direction (1-bit sign bit, 4-bit integer, 12-bit decimal)
Note:
In the case of non-macroblock operation, h_ofst is an integer of .
In the case of macroblock operation, h_ofst is .

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_DFE_COEF0
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_DFE_COEF0 indicates the anti-flicker coefficient 0 register.

Member.name: threshold0
Member.description: If the luminance difference of three adjacent lines is less than the value, use group 0 coefficients.

Member.name: coef0_cur_line
Member.description: Current line (line K) coefficients of group 0 anti-flicker, unsigned integer. The coefficients include 1-bit integer, 6-bit decimal, and <u,1,6>. The lower seven bits are valid.

Member.name: coef0_next_line
Member.description: Previous line (line K-1) and the next line (line K+1) coefficients of group 0 anti-flicker, unsigned integer. The coefficients include 5-bit decimal and <u,0,5>. The lower five bits are valid.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_DFE_COEF1
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_DFE_COEF1 indicates the anti-flicker coefficient 1 register.

Member.name: threshold1
Member.description: If the luminance difference of three adjacent lines is less than theshold1 but equal to or greater than threshold0, use group 1 coefficients.

Member.name: coef1_cur_line
Member.description: Current line (line K) coefficients of group 1 anti-flicker, unsigned integer. The coefficients include 1-bit integer, 6-bit decimal, and <u,1,6>. The lower seven bits are valid.

Member.name: coef1_next_line
Member.description: Previous line (line K-1) and the next line (line K+1) coefficients of group 1 anti-flicker, unsigned integer. The coefficients include 5-bit decimal and <u,0,5>. The lower five bits are valid.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_DFE_COEF2
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_DFE_COEF2 indicates the anti-flicker coefficient 2 register.

Member.name: threshold2
Member.description: If the luminance difference of three adjacent lines is less than threshold1, use group 2 coefficients.

Member.name: coef2_cur_line
Member.description: Current line (line K) coefficients of group 2 anti-flicker, unsigned integer. The coefficients include 1-bit integer, 6-bit decimal, and <u,1,6>. The lower seven bits are valid.

Member.name: coef2_next_line
Member.description: Previous line (line K-1) and the next line (line K+1) coefficients of group 2 anti-flicker, unsigned integer. The coefficients include 5-bit decimal and <u,0,5>. The lower five bits are valid.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_DFE_COEF3
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_DFE_COEF3 indicates the anti-flicker coefficient 3 register.

Member.name: coef3_cur_line
Member.description: Current line (line K) coefficients of group 3 anti-flicker, unsigned integer. The coefficients include 1-bit integer and 6-bit decimal. The lower seven bits are valid.

Member.name: coef3_next_line
Member.description: Previous line (line K-1) and the next line (line K+1) coefficients of group 3 anti-flicker, unsigned integer. The coefficients include 5-bit. The lower five bits are valid.

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_ALU
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_ALU is the ALU and colorkey control register.

Member.name: ck_sel
Member.description:
Colorkey input selection.
00: colorkey operation on source bitmap 1
01: reserved
10: colorkey operation on source bitmap 2 before CLUT
11: colorkey operation on source bitmap 2 after CLUT

Member.name: ck_alpha_mod
Member.description:
Alpha component operating mode in colorkey.
00: colorkey meets Alphamin ( Alpha ( Alphamax
01: colorkey meets Alpha < Alphamin or lpha > Alphamax
10: ignore alpha component in colorkey judgment
11: reserved

Member.name: ck_r_mod
Member.description:
Red component operating mode in colorkey.
00: colorkey meets Rmin ( R ( Rmax
01: colorkey meets R < Rmin and R > Rmax
10: ignore red component in colorkey judgment
11: reserved

Member.name: ck_g_mod
Member.description:
Green component operating mode in colorkey.
00: colorkey meets Gmin ( G ( Gmax
01: colorkey meets G < Gmin and G > Gmax
10: ignore green component in colorkey judgment
11: reserved

Member.name: ck_b_mod
Member.description:
Blue component operating mode in colorkey.
00: colorkey meets Bmin ( B ( Bmax
01: colorkey meets B < Bmin and B > Bmax
10: ignore blue component in colorkey judgment
11: reserved

Member.name: global_alpha
Member.description:
Global alpha value. Default value: 0x80.
If the bitmap contains alpha, multiply this alpha with the pixel alpha to get the alpha value of the alpha blending operation. If the bitmap does not contain alpha, take this alpha as the alpha value of the alpha blending operation. The value ranges from 0x00 to 0xff. 0x00 indicates full transparent and 0xff indicates not transparent.

Member.name: rgb_rop_mod
Member.description: ROP mode of RGB component.

Member.name: alpha_rop_mod
Member.description: ROP mode of alpha component.

Member.name: alpha_threshold_en
Member.description:
Alpha threshold enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: alu_mod
Member.description:
ALU operating mode.
0x0: src1 bypass
0x1: logical mode
0x2: blending mode
0x3: reserved
0x4: clipmask in logical mode, first pass
0x5: clipmask in blending mode
0x6: MB concatenation
0x7: src2 bypass
0x8: clipmask in logical mode, second pass
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_CK_MIN
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_CK_MIN is the colorkey 1 register.

Member.name: alpha_min
Member.description: Minimum alpha value in the case of colorkey comparison. The value ranges from 0x00 to 0xff. 0x00 indicates full transparent and 0xff indicates not transparent.

Member.name: red_min
Member.description: Minimum value of red component in the case of colorkey comparison.

Member.name: green_min
Member.description: Minimum value of green component in the case of colorkey comparison.

Member.name: blue_min
Member.description: Minimum value of blue component in the case of colorkey comparison (the filling position of index value during comparison).

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_CK_MAX
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_CK_MAX is the colorkey 2 register.

Member.name: alpha_max
Member.description: Maximum alpha value in the case of colorkey comparison. The value ranges from 0x00 to 0xff. 0x00 indicates full transparent and 0xff indicates not transparent.

Member.name: red_max
Member.description: Maximum value of red component in the case of colorkey comparison.

Member.name: green_max
Member.description: Maximum value of green component in the case of colorkey comparison.

Member.name: blue_max
Member.description: Maximum value of blue component in the case of colorkey comparison (the filling position of index value during comparison).

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_CLIP_START
RegisterGroup.description: TDE_CLIP_START is the start position register of clip.

Member.name: clip_mod
Member.description:
Clip operating mode.

1: The area to be updated is out of the rectangular indicator scope (excluding border)

Member.name: y_start

RegisterGroup.name: TDE_CLIP_STOP

Code stream CRC error interrupt mask.

1: No interrupt is reported.

Member.name: err_short_m
Member.description:
Mask of an interrupt that occurs when the frame length is shorter than the length indicated by the frame header.

1: No interrupt is reported.

Member.name: err_hdr_m
Member.description:
Mask of an interrupt that occurs when the code stream header information is invalid.
0: An interrupt is reported.
1: No interrupt is reported.

Member.name: dec_done_m
Member.description:
Decoding done interrupt mask.
0: An interrupt is reported.
1: No interrupt is reported.

Member.name: ch_sel2
Member.description:
I2S 2 output audio-left and audio-right channel control.
000: The two audio channels play normally.
001: The two audio channels play the audio on the audio-left channel.
010: The two audio channels play the audio on the audio-right channel.
011: The two audio channels are interchanged.
100: The output of the audio-left and audio-right channels is the sum of the output of the audio-left channel and the output of the audio-right channel.
101: The audio-left channel is muted, and the audio-right channel plays the audio on the original audio-right channel.
110: The audio-right channel is muted, and the audio-left channel plays the audio on the original audio-left channel.
111: The audio-left and audio-right channels are muted.

Member.name: spdif_ch_sel
Member.description:
S/PDIF output audio-left and audio-right channel control.
000: The two audio channels play normally.
001: The two audio channels play the audio on the audio-left channel.
010: The two audio channels play the audio on the audio-right channel.
011: The two audio channels are interchanged.
100: The output of the audio-left and audio-right channels is the sum of the output of the audio-left channel and the output of the audio-right channel.
101: The audio-left channel is muted, and the audio-right channel plays the audio on the original audio-right channel.
110: The audio-right channel is muted, and the audio-left channel plays the audio on the original audio-left channel.
111: The audio-left and audio-right channels are muted.

Member.name: ch_sel1
Member.description:
I2S 1 audio-left and audio-right channel control.
000: The two audio channels play normally.
001: The two audio channels play the audio on the audio-left channel.
010: The two audio channels play the audio on the audio-right channel.
011: The two audio channels are interchanged.
100: The output of the audio-left and audio-right channels is the sum of the output of the audio-left channel and the output of the audio-right channel.
101: The audio-left channel is muted, and the audio-right channel plays the audio on the original audio-right channel.
110: The audio-right channel is muted, and the audio-left channel plays the audio on the original audio-left channel.
111: The audio-left and audio-right channels are muted.

Member.name: lim_rate_mpcm
Member.description:
Fade-in and fade-out rate control of an MPCM channel.
0000: The rate changes once for one sampling point.
0001: The rate changes once for two sampling points.
0010: The rate changes once for four sampling points.
0011: The rate changes once for eight sampling points.
0100: The rate changes once for 16 sampling points.
0101: The rate changes once for 32 sampling points.
0110: The rate changes once for 64 sampling points.
0111: The rate changes once for 128 sampling points.
1000: The rate changes once for 256 sampling points.
1001: The rate changes once for 384 sampling points.
1010: The rate changes once for 512 sampling points.
1011: The rate changes once for 768 sampling points.
1100: The rate changes once for 1024 sampling points.
1101: The rate changes once for 1536 sampling points.
1110: The rate changes once for 2048 sampling points.
1111: The rate changes once for 3584 sampling points.

Member.name: lim_rate_dpcm
Member.description:
Fade-in and fade-out rate control of a DPCM channel.
The values are the same as the values of lim_rate_mpcm.

Member.name: lim_rate_cpcm
Member.description:
Fade-in and fade-out rate control of a CPCM channel.
The values are the same as the values of lim_rate_mpcm.

RegisterGroup.name: AO_MIXING_CTRL1
RegisterGroup.description: AO_MIXING_CTRL1 is mixing control register 1 (soft reset).

Member.name: al_ctrl
Member.description:
Input source control of I2S1 output audio-left channel mixing.
Bit[29] indicates interchange of mixing coefficients.
Bit[28] indicates that the CPCM input is available.
Bit[27] indicates that the DPCM input is available.
Bit[26] indicates that the MPCM input is available if the left and right of the CPCM input data are C0 and C1 respectively, the left and right of the DPCM input data are D0 and D1 respectively, and the left and right of the MPCM input data are M0 and M1 respectively. The mixing coefficients are A1 and A2. In the case of bit[29] = 0, the corresponding expressions of the output and the value of bit[28:24] are as follows:
00101: OUT = 0 * A1 + M1 * A2
00110: OUT = M0 * A1 + 0 * A2
00111: OUT = M0 * A1 + M1 * A2
01001: OUT = 0 * A1 + D1 * A2
01010: OUT = D0 * A1 + 0 * A2
01011: OUT = D0 * A1 + D1 * A2
10001: OUT = 0 * A1 + C1 * A2
10010: OUT = C0 * A1 + 0 * A2
10011: OUT = C0 * A1 + C1 * A2
01100: OUT = D0 * A1 + M0 * A2
01101: OUT = D0 * A1 + M1 * A2
01110: OUT = D1 * A1 + M0 * A2
01111: OUT = D1 * A1 + M1 * A2
10100: OUT = C0 * A1 + M0 * A2
10101: OUT = C0 * A1 + M1 * A2
10110: OUT = C1 * A1 + M0 * A2
10111: OUT = C1 * A1 + M1 * A2
11000: OUT = C0 * A1 + D0 * A2
11001: OUT = C0 * A1 + D1 * A2
11010: OUT = C1 * A1 + D0 * A2
11011: OUT = C1 * A1 + D1 * A2
000xx: OUT = 0
Others: invalid configuration, and OUT = 0
Note: In the case of bit[29] = 1, A1 and A2 in the preceding expressions are interchanged.

Bit[4] indicates that the CPCM input is available.
Bit[3] indicates that the DPCM input is available.
Bit[2] indicates that the MPCM input is available if the left and right of the CPCM input data are C0 and C1 respectively, the left and right of the DPCM input data are D0 and D1 respectively, and the left and right of the MPCM input data are M0 and M1 respectively. The mixing coefficients are A1 and A2. In the case of bit[5] = 0, the corresponding expressions of the output and the value of bit[4:0] are as follows:
00101: OUT = 0 * A1 + M1 * A2
00110: OUT = M0 * A1 + 0 * A2
00111: OUT = M0 * A1 + M1 * A2
01001: OUT = 0 * A1 + D1 * A2
01010: OUT = D0 * A1 + 0 * A2
01011: OUT = D0 * A1 + D1 * A2
10001: OUT = 0 * A1 + C1 * A2
10010: OUT = C0 * A1 + 0 * A2
10011: OUT = C0 * A1 + C1 * A2
01100: OUT = D0 * A1 + M0 * A2
01101: OUT = D0 * A1 + M1 * A2
01110: OUT = D1 * A1 + M0 * A2
01111: OUT = D1 * A1 + M1 * A2
10100: OUT = C0 * A1 + M0 * A2
10101: OUT = C0 * A1 + M1 * A2
10110: OUT = C1 * A1 + M0 * A2
10111: OUT = C1 * A1 + M1 * A2
11000: OUT = C0 * A1 + D0 * A2
11001: OUT = C0 * A1 + D1 * A2
11010: OUT = C1 * A1 + D0 * A2
11011: OUT = C1 * A1 + D1 * A2
000xx: OUT = 0
Others: invalid configuration, and OUT = 0
Note: In the case of bit[5] = 1, A1 and A2 in the preceding expressions are interchanged.

Member.name: es_endian_mod
Member.description:
Big and small endian mode of the ES.
B0, B1, B2, and B3 are data stored from the lower-bit addresses of the memory to the upper-bit addresses. Based on the value of a bit of endian_mode, the data word read value is as follows:
0: B0B1B2B3
1: B3B2B1B0

Member.name: pcmo_endian_mod
Member.description:
Big and small endian mode of the PCMO.
B0, B1, B2, and B3 are data stored from the lower-bit addresses of the memory to the upper-bit addresses. Based on the value of a bit of endian_mode, the data word read value is as follows:
0: B0B1B2B3
1: B3B2B1B0

The read pointer of the PCMO buffer uses audio_pcmo_rptr.
1: The write pointer of the CPCM buffer uses audio_pcmo_wptr.
The read pointer of the PCMO buffer uses audio_cpcm_rptr.

The read pointer of the IPCM buffer uses audio_cpcm_rptr.

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_VERSION
RegisterGroup.description: SIO_VERSION is an SIO version register and used to record the version number of the SIOand perform the self-test for the SIO.

Member.name: sio_loop
Member.description:
Selection of the SIO cycle mode or the normal mode.
0: normal mode
1: SIO transmit and receive data loopback mode. It is used to perform the self-test for the SIO. In this mode, the receive serial data line of the SIO is directly connected to the transmit serial data line of the SIO at the external interface of the SIO.

Member.name: vesion
Member.description: Version number of the SIO.

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_MODE
RegisterGroup.description: It is an SIO mode register and used to select the basic operating mode of the SIO.In master mode, the CRG transmits clock and synchronization signals to the CODEC andthe SIO.In slave mode, the external CODEC transmits clock and synchronization signals to theSIO.Selection of the I2S or PCM master/slave mode is specified by the system control registersPERI_CRG19, PERI_CRG21, and PERI_CRG23. For details, see "Description of SystemRegisters."

Member.name: clk_edge
Member.description:
Selection of the edge of the sampling data clock in PCM multi-channel receive mode.
0: The falling edge is valid.
1: The rising edge is valid.

Member.name: chn_num
Member.description:
Selection of the number of multi-channel receive channels.
00: 2 chn
01: 4 chn
10: 8 chn
11: 16 chn

Member.name: ext_rec_en
Member.description:
In standard mode, the I2S receives data from two audio channels, namely, the audio-left channel and the audio-right channel. The PCM receives data from one audio channel.
In multi-channel receive mode, for the I2S or PCM, the number of receive channels can be configured. In this mode, the data width of a channel must be 8 bits or 16 bits.
0: standard I2S or PCM receive mode
1: extended I2S or PCM multi-channel receive mode.

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_I2S_LEFT_XD
RegisterGroup.description: SIO_I2S_LEFT_XD is an I2S audio-left channel data transmit register.When data is written to the register, valid data should be arranged in the low-bit area of theregister. For example, if the data width is 8 bits, bit[7:0] is valid, and bit[31:8] is invalid; if thedata width is 16 bits, bit[15:0] is valid, and bit[31:16] is invalid. The bits that exceed the validdata width are automatically set to 0 by the SIO module.

Member.name: tx_left_data
Member.description: Audio-left channel transmit data.

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_I2S_RIGHT_XD
RegisterGroup.description: SIO_I2S_RIGHT_XD is an I2S audio-right channel data transmit register. The PCM datatransmit register is multiplexed with the I2S audio-right channel data transmit register.When data is written to the register, valid data should be arranged in the low-bit area of theregister. For example, if the data width is 8 bits, bit[7:0] is valid, and bit[31:8] is invalid; if thedata width is 16 bits, bit[15:0] is valid, and bit[31:16] is invalid. The bits that exceed the validdata width are automatically set to 0 by the SIO module.

Member.name: tx_right_data
Member.description: Audio-right channel transmit data.

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_PCM_XD
RegisterGroup.description: SIO_PCM_XD is a PCM data transmit register. The PCM data transmit register ismultiplexed with the I2S audio-right channel data transmit register.When valid data is written to the register, valid data should be arranged in the low-bit area ofthe register. For example, if the data width is 8 bits, bit[7:0] is valid, and bit[31:8] is invalid; ifthe data width is 16 bits, bit[15:0] is valid, and bit[31:16] is invalid. The bits that exceed thevalid data width are automatically set to 0 by the SIO module.

Member.name: tx_data
Member.description: PCM transmit data.

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_CT_SET
RegisterGroup.description: To facilitate the bit operation for the SIO control register, 0x05C is the address of the settingregister in the SIO. If the corresponding bit of the register is set to 1, the corresponding bit isset to 1. It is invalid if the corresponding bit of the register is set to 0. The attribute of theregister is read and write.

Member.name: rst_n
Member.description:
Reset of an I2S or a PCM channel; valid at the low level.
It resets the I2S or PCM receive and transmit module (including the FIFO). Therefore, the transmit and receive FIFO status register becomes 0. The CPU interface register module is not reset.

1: enabled

Member.name: tx_enable
Member.description:
Transmit channel enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: rx_fifo_disable
Member.description:
Receive FIFO disable.
0: enabled
1: disabled

Member.name: tx_fifo_disable
Member.description:
Transmit FIFO disable.
0: enabled
1: disabled

Member.name: rx_data_merge_en
Member.description:
Data receive combination enable; valid only in the I2S mode when the data width is 16 bits.
0: disabled
1: enabled
If this bit is set to 1, data on the audio-left channel and data on the audio-right channel combine 32-bit data, and the 32-bit data is stored in the FIFO. The 16-bit data on the audio-left channel occupies the upper 16 bits. The 16-bit data on the audio-right channel occupies the lower 16 bits. Therefore, the FIFO usage can be improved to support long-time buffering.
The CPU reads data from the receive FIFO by adhering to the following sequence: The CPU reads 32-bit data (16-bit data on the audio-left channel and 16-bit data on the audio-right channel) from the FIFO on the audio-left channel and reads 32-bit data from the FIFO on the audio-right channel, and so on.

Member.name: tx_data_merge_en
Member.description:
Data transmit combination enable; valid only in the I2S mode when the data width is 16 bits.
0: disabled
1: enabled
If this bit is set to 1, data on the audio-left channel and data on the audio-right channel combine 32-bit data, and the 32-bit data is stored in the FIFO. The 16-bit data on the audio-left channel occupies the upper 16 bits. The 16-bit data on the audio-right channel occupies the lower 16 bits. Therefore, the FIFO usage can be improved to support long-time buffering.
In this case, the CPU writes data into the transmit FIFO by adhering to the following sequence: The CPU writes 32-bit data (16-bit data on the audio-left channel and 16-bit data on the audio-right channel) into the FIFO on the audio-left channel and writes 32-bit data into the FIFO on the audio-right channel, and so on.

Member.name: rx_fifo_threshold
Member.description:
Receive FIFO threshold.
If the condition rx_right_depth ≥ (rx_fifo_threshold + 1) is met, a receive interrupt and a DMA request are reported.

Member.name: tx_fifo_threshold
Member.description:
Transmit FIFO threshold.
If the condition tx_right_depth < (tx_fifo_threshold + 1) is met, a transmit interrupt and a DMA request are reported.

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_CT_CLR
RegisterGroup.description: To facilitate the bit operation for the SIO control register, in the SIO, 0x060 is the address ofthe clear register. If the corresponding bit of the register is set to 1, the corresponding bit iscleared. It is invalid if the corresponding bit of the register is set to 0. The attribute of theregister is write only.

Member.name: rst_n
Member.description:
Reset of an I2S or a PCM channel; valid at the low level.
It resets the I2S or PCM receive and transmit module (including the FIFO). Therefore, the transmit and receive FIFO status register becomes 0. The CPU interface register module is not reset.

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_RX_STA
RegisterGroup.description: SIO_RX_STA is an SIO receive status register.

Member.name: rx_left_depth
Member.description:
Receive FIFO depth on the audio-left channel.
It is valid only in I2S mode.

Member.name: rx_right_depth
Member.description:
Receive FIFO depth on the audio-right channel in I2S mode.
Receive FIFO depth of the PCM in PCM mode.

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_TX_STA
RegisterGroup.description: SIO_TX_STA is an SIO transmit status register.

Member.name: tx_left_depth
Member.description:
Transmit FIFO depth on the audio-left channel.
It is valid only in I2S mode.

Member.name: tx_right_depth
Member.description:
Transmit FIFO depth on the audio-right channel in I2S mode.
Transmit FIFO depth of the PCM in PCM mode.

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_DATA_WIDTH_SET
RegisterGroup.description: The register is used to set the data width in I2S or PCM mode.

Member.name: rx_mode
Member.description:
Length of received data.
000: 8 bits
001: 16 bits
010: 18 bits
011: 20 bits
100: 24 bits
101: 32 bits
110~111: reserved
In I2S mode, 16 bits, 18 bits, 20 bits, 24 bits, and 32bits are supported.
In PCM mode, 8 bits and 16 bits are supported.
For multi-channel receive, in I2S or PCM mode, only 8 bits and 16 bits are supported.

Member.name: tx_mode
Member.description:
Length of transmitted data.
In I2S mode,
000: reserved
001: 16 bits
010: 18 bits
011: 20 bits
100: 24 bits
101: 32 bits
110~111: reserved
In PCM mode,
000: 8 bits
001: 16 bits
010: 32 bits
011: 64 bits
100: 128 bits
101~111: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_I2S_START_POS
RegisterGroup.description: SIO_I2S_START_POS is an I2S audio-left and audio-right channel start positionconfiguration control register.In I2S mode, after combination of the data operation addresses of the audio-left channel andthe data operation addresses of the audio-right channel is enabled, the register controls thestart access channel (from the audio-left channel or from the audio-right channel).

Member.name: start_pos_write
Member.description:
In the case of writing data into the transmit FIFO,
0: The access is started from the audio-left channel
1: The access is started from the audio-right channel

Member.name: start_pos_read
Member.description:
In the case of reading data from the receive FIFO,
0: The access is started from the audio-left channel
1: The access is started from the audio-right channel

RegisterGroup.name: I2S_POS_FLAG
RegisterGroup.description: I2S_POS_FLAG is an I2S audio-left and audio-right channel operation current position statusregister.In I2S mode, after combination of the data operation addresses of the audio-left channel andthe data operation addresses of the audio-right channel is enabled, the register indicates thenext access channel (from the audio-left channel or from the audio-right channel).

Member.name: start_pos_write
Member.description:
In the case of writing data into the transmit FIFO,
0: The next access is started from the audio-left channel
1: The next access is started from the audio-right channel

Member.name: start_pos_read
Member.description:
In the case of reading data from the receive FIFO,
0: The next access is started from the audio-left channel
1: The next access is started from the audio-right channel

Member.name: signed_ext_en
Member.description:
Upper-bit data sign extension enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: merge_en
Member.description:
In I2S mode, combination enable of operation addresses on the audio-left and audio-right channels.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_INTMASK
RegisterGroup.description: SIO_INTMASK is an interrupt mask register.

Member.name: tx_left_fifo_under
Member.description:
In I2S mode, audio-left channel transmit FIFO underflow interrupt mask. In PCM mode, this bit is invalid.
0: not masked
1: masked.

Member.name: tx_right_fifo_under
Member.description:
In I2S mode, audio-right channel transmit FIFO underflow interrupt mask. In PCM mode, PCM transmit FIFO underflow interrupt mask.

1: masked

Member.name: rx_left_fifo_over
Member.description:
In I2S mode, audio-left channel receive FIFO overflow interrupt mask. In PCM mode, this bit is invalid.
0: not masked
1: masked

Member.name: rx_right_fifo_over
Member.description:
In I2S mode, audio-right channel receive FIFO overflow interrupt mask. In PCM mode, PCM receive FIFO underflow interrupt mask.
0: not masked
1: masked

Member.name: tx_intr
Member.description:
Mask of an interrupt that occurs when the transmit FIFO is below the threshold.
0: not masked
1: masked

Member.name: rx_intr
Member.description:
Mask of an interrupt that occurs when the receive FIFO is above the threshold.
0: not masked
1: masked

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_I2S_DUAL_RX_CHN
RegisterGroup.description: SIO_I2S_DUAL_TX_CHN is a received data read register after combination of operationaddresses on the I2S audio-left and audio-right channels is enabled.

Member.name: rx_data
Member.description: Received data.

RegisterGroup.name: SIO_I2S_DUAL_TX_CHN
RegisterGroup.description: SIO_I2S_DUAL_TX_CHN is a transmitted data write register after combination of operationaddresses on the I2S audio-left and audio-right channels is enabled.

Member.name: tx_data
Member.description: Transmitted data.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_PORT_CFG
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_PORT_CFG is a port configuration register and used to configure parameters of eachexternal port.

Member.name: port_scan_mode
Member.description:
Port data input mode.
bit[11]
0: luminance and chroma hybrid mode
Note: Bit[11] must be set to 0.
bit[10]
0: interlaced input mode
1: progressive input mode

Member.name: port_cap_mode
Member.description:
Port data receive mode.
00: BT.656 mode
01: BT.601 mode
10: digital camera mode
Other values: reserved

Member.name: port_mux_mode
Member.description:
Operating mode of port multi-channel time division multiplexing input.
00: single-channel D1
Other values: reserved
Note: This bit must be set to 00.

Member.name: port_vsync
Member.description:
Configuration signal of the VI_P_VSYNC_FIELD pin.
0: field number (odd or even field) or line valid signal
Field number in BT.601 mode.
Line valid signal when a camera interface is available.
1: vertical synchronization pulse

Member.name: port_vsync_neg
Member.description:
Polarity configuration of the VI_P_VSYNC_FIELD pin.
0: The high level is active.
In pulse mode (port_vsync=1), a positive pulse indicates a synchronization pulse.
In field number mode (port_vsync=0), the high level indicates an even field, and the low level indicates an odd field.
In line valid mode, the high level indicates that the line is valid.
1: The low level is active.
In pulse mode (port_vsync=1), a negative pulse indicates a synchronization pulse.
In field number mode (port_vsync=0), the low level indicates an even field, and the high level indicates an odd field.
In line valid mode, the low level indicates that the line is valid.

Member.name: port_hsync
Member.description:
Configuration signal of the VI_P_HSYNC_VD pin.
0: VI_P_HSYNC_VD is a data valid signal.
1: VI_P_HSYNC_VD is a horizontal synchronization pulse signal.
Note: The bit is set to 1 when a 16-bit synchronization interface is available.

Member.name: port_hsync_neg
Member.description:
Polarity configuration of the VI_P_HSYNC_VD pin.
0: The high level is active.
In pulse mode (port_hsync=1), a positive pulse indicates a synchronization pulse.
In data valid mode (port_hsync=0), the high level indicates that the data is valid.
1: The low level is active.
In pulse mode (port_hsync=1), a negative pulse indicates a synchronization pulse.
In data valid mode (port_hsync=0), the low level indicates that the data is valid.

Member.name: port_en
Member.description:
Port enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_CH_CFG
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_CH_CFG is a channel configuration register and used to configure parameters of eachinternal channel.

Member.name: fix_code
Member.description:
Maximum bit configuration of the BT.656 timing reference code.
0: fixed at 1
1: fixed at 0

Member.name: yc_channel
Member.description:
Y/C configuration of the current channel.
0: The current channel is a luminance Y channel.
1: The current channel is a chroma C channel.
Note: This bit is valid only in Y/C separation mode.

Member.name: seav_f_neg
Member.description:
Field indicator bit (F) polarity of the BT.656 timing reference code.
0: 1st field:F = 0, 2nd field:F = 1 (standard)
1: 1st field:F = 1, 2nd field:F = 0 (non-standard)

Member.name: chrom_swap
Member.description:
Swap function enable of channel data.
0: output in normal mode
1: byte reverse order in the halfword
Note: This function is used only in the high definition (HD) mode of Y/C separation input. Channel 4 and channel 12 are used to transmit chroma. The chroma storage sequence can be adjusted as follows:
0: The chroma storage sequence is Cr1Cb1Cr0Cb0.
1: The chroma storage sequence is Cb1Cr1Cb0Cr0.

Member.name: ch_id_en
Member.description:
Detection enable of a channel number.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: This function is used when the corresponding port works in two or four-channel TDM mode.

Member.name: even_line_sel
Member.description:
Selection of a picture chroma data capture line in an even field.
000: Only the data in odd lines is collected.
001: Only the data in even lines is collected.
010: The data in odd and even lines is collected.
011: Only the data in line 0 and line 3 is collected for every four lines. It is used only in the field storage mode (store_mode is set to 0).
100: Only the data in line 1 and line 2 is collected for every four lines. It is used only in the field storage mode (store_mode is set to 0).
Other values: reserved
Note: The line number starts from 0. The interlaced capture function is valid only for the chroma component. The data in odd and even lines is collected for the luminance component so that YcbCr 4:2:0 data is obtained. When the input mode is a frame mode (DC mode or progressive HD mode), even_line_sel controls the chroma line loss. When the storage mode is a frame mode, it is not allowed that only the data in odd lines is collected in the odd field and only the data in even lines is collected in the even field. It is recommended that only the data in even lines is collected in the odd field and only the data in odd lines is collected in the even field. In HD mode, only channel 2 or 6 needs to be configured.

Member.name: odd_line_sel
Member.description:
Selection of a picture chroma data capture line in an odd field.
000: Only the data in odd lines is collected.
001: Only the data in even lines is collected.
010: The data in odd and even lines is collected.
011: Only the data in line 0 and line 3 is collected for every four lines. It is used only in the field storage mode (store_mode is set to 0).
100: Only the data in line 1 and line 2 is collected for every four lines. It is used only in the field storage mode (store_mode is set to 0).
Other values: reserved
Note: The line number starts from 0. The interlaced capture function is valid only for the chroma component. The data in odd and even lines is collected for the luminance component so that YcbCr 4:2:0 data is obtained. When the input mode is a frame mode (DC mode or progressive HD mode), odd_line_sel is invalid. When the storage mode is a frame mode, it is not allowed that only the data in odd lines is collected in the odd field and only the data in even lines is collected in the even field. It is recommended that only the data in even lines is collected in the odd field and only the data in odd lines is collected in the even field. In HD mode, only channel 2 or 6 needs to be configured.

Member.name: correct_en
Member.description:
SAV/EAV data check enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: down_scaling
Member.description:
1/2 horizontal scaling enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: This function is not supported in HD mode of Y/C separation input.

Member.name: chroma_resample
Member.description:
Chroma resampling.
0: disabled
1: enabled (conversion from the co-sited format to the interspersed format)
Note: Chroma resampling supports only conversion from the co-sited format to the interspersed format. In HD mode of Y/C separation input, this function is not supported.

Member.name: store_method
Member.description:
Storage method.
00: planar Y/Cb/Cr
01: semi-planar YCbCr
10: package YCbCr4:2:2
11: raw data, and it is used only in the HD mode of Y/C separation input.

Member.name: cap_sel
Member.description:
Selection of a picture data capture field.
00: Collect data only in the odd field (top).
01: Collect data only in the even field (bottom).
10: Collect data in the odd and even fields.
Other values: reserved

Member.name: cap_seq
Member.description:
Support bit of the YCbCr input sequence.
00: CbYCrY
01: CrYCbY
10: YCbYCr
11: YCrYCb

Member.name: store_mode
Member.description:
Storage mode.
0: field storage mode
1: frame storage mode
Note: If port input is in progressive mode, this bit must be set to the field storage mode.

Member.name: data_width
Member.description:
Data width.
00: 8 bits
10: 10 bits
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_CH_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_CH_CTRL is a control register and controls start and end of data capture.VIn_CH_CTRL can be used to enable the VIU and control the interrupt of reg_newer.

Member.name: debug_en
Member.description:
Test mode enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
The read-back value of the register is 0 when the test mode is disabled.

Member.name: lum_strh_en
Member.description:
Luminance stretch enable signal.
0: Luminance stretch is not performed.
1: Luminance stretch is performed.
Note: Luminance stretch cannot be performed in the luminance and chroma separation input mode.

Member.name: anc1_en
Member.description:
Capture enable of data block 1 in a blank area.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: anc0_en
Member.description:
Capture enable of data block 0 in a blank area.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: block3_en
Member.description:
Block mask 3 enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: block2_en
Member.description:
Block mask 2 enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: block1_en
Member.description:
Block mask 1 enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: block0_en
Member.description:
Block mask 0 enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ch_en
Member.description:
VIU channel enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled
Note: During switching between any modes (multi-channel switching or switching from the BT.656 mode to the BT.601 mode), the bit must be set to 0. The bit is set to 1 after the switching.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_REG_NEWER
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_REG_NEWER is a channel register configuration done register and used to indicatewhether the next field or frame register of a channel is configured.

Member.name: reg_newer
Member.description:
Preparation status of the next field or frame register.
0: The next field or frame register for receiving data is not prepared. The hardware aborts the reception of the next field or frame.
1: The next field or frame register for receiving data is prepared. When detecting the start of the next field or frame, the hardware starts to receive the next filed data.
Note: After the hardware of the VIU automatically updates the internal working register, it automatically clears the bit.

Member.name: start_y
Member.description: Number of a line from which a picture starts to be captured.

Member.name: start_x
Member.description: Number of a pixel from which a picture starts to be captured.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_CAP_SIZE
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_CAP_SIZE is a picture capture size register.

Member.name: height
Member.description:
Height of a captured picture (unit: line).
In frame storage mode, the captured picture height is a half of the actual height of a frame picture. The data in two fields captured by the VI forms a frame of pictures.
The minimum capture height supported by the VI is one line.

Member.name: width
Member.description:
One line width of a captured picture (unit: pixel).
The minimum capture width supported by the VI is four pixels.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_Y_STORESIZE
RegisterGroup.description: VI_Y_STORESIZE is a component Y data storage size register.

Member.name: y_height
Member.description:
Data storage height of component Y (unit: line).
Note: In luminance and chroma separation mode, if the chroma channel outputs YCbCr4:2:0 data, the chroma height should be set to one half of the luminance.

Member.name: y_width
Member.description: The data storage width of component Y decreases by 1. (The unit is 128 bits. The line end of less than 128 bits is rounded up to 128 bits.)

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_U_STORESIZE
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_U_STORESIZE is a component Cb data storage size register. This register is notapplicable in package storage mode. In the semi-planar YCbCr data format, the registerindicates the chroma storage size. In the planar YCbCr data format, the register indicates thestorage size of component Cb.

Member.name: c_height
Member.description:
Data storage height (unit: line) of the chroma component in semi-planar YCbCr mode.
Data storage height (unit: line) of component Cb in planar YCbCr mode.
It is invalid in package storage mode and raw data receive mode.

Member.name: c_width
Member.description:
In semi-planar YCbCr mode, the data storage width of the chroma component decreases by 1. (The unit is 128 bits. The line end of less than 128 bits is rounded up to 128 bits.)
Data storage width (unit: word; the width of less than one word is rounded up to one word) of component Cb in planar YCbCr mode.
It is invalid in package storage mode and raw data receive mode.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_V_STORESIZE
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_V_STORESIZE is a component Cr data storage size register.

Member.name: v_height
Member.description: Data storage height of component Cr (unit: line).

Member.name: v_width
Member.description:
The data storage width of component Cr decreases by 1. (The unit is 128 bits. The line end of less than 128 bits is rounded up to 128 bits.)
It is invalid in semi-planar YCbCr storage mode, package YCbCr storage mode, and raw data receive mode.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_LINE_OFFSET
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_LINE_OFFSET is a picture storage stride register and used to set the storage stride sizeof captured data. The unit is word, and separate control is performed for each channel.

Member.name: yline_offset
Member.description:
The unit is 128 bits. (The actual stride is 4-bit left stride of yline_offset.)
In raw data storage mode, only the stride is valid.
In package YCbCr4:2:2 storage mode, only the stride is valid.
In planar Y/C or planar Y/Cb/Cr storage mode, it indicates the line stride of Y.

Member.name: uline_offset
Member.description:
The unit is 128 bits. (The actual stride is 4-bit left stride of uline_offset.)
In raw data storage mode, the stride is invalid.
In package YCbCr4:2:2 storage mode, the stride is invalid.
In planar Y/C storage mode, it indicates the line stride of component C.
In planar Y/Cb/Cr storage mode, it indicates the line stride of component Cb.

Member.name: vline_offset
Member.description:
The unit is 128 bits. (The actual stride is 4-bit left stride of vline_offset.)
In raw data storage mode, the stride is invalid.
In package YCbCr4:2:2 storage mode, the stride is invalid.
In planar Y/C storage mode, the stride is invalid.
In planarY/Cb/Cr storage mode, it indicates the line stride of component Cr.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_YBASE_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_YBASE_ADDR0 is a component Y base address 0 register and used to set the startstorage address of component Y. The last three bits are set to 0.

Member.name: vi_ybase_addr
Member.description:
Base address of channel Y.
The least significant four bits are set to 0, and 128 bits are aligned.
In raw data storage mode, only the address is valid.
In package YCbCr4:2:2 storage mode, only the address is valid.
In planar Y/C or planar Y/Cb/Cr storage mode, it indicates the start address of component Y.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_UBASE_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_UBASE_ADDR is a component Cb base address 0 register and used to set the startstorage address of component Cb. The last three bits are set to 0.

Member.name: vi_ubase_addr
Member.description:
Base address of channel Cb.
The least significant four bits are set to 0, and 128 bits are aligned.
In raw data storage mode, the address is invalid.
In package YCbCr4:2:2 storage mode, the address is invalid.
In planar Y/C storage mode, it indicates the start address of component C.
In planar Y/Cb/Cr or planar Y/Cb/Cr storage mode, it indicates the start address of component Cb.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_VBASE_ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_VBASE_ADDR0 is a component Cr base address 0 register and used to set the startstorage address of component Cr. The last three bits are set to 0.

Member.name: vi_vbase_addr
Member.description:
Base address of channel Cr.
The least significant four bits are set to 0, and 128 bits are aligned.
In raw data storage mode, the address is invalid.
In package YCbCr4:2:2 storage mode, the address is invalid.
In planar Y/C storage mode, the address is invalid.
In planar Y/Cb/Cr storage mode, it indicates the start address of component Cr.

RegisterGroup.name: VI_INT_DLY_CNT
RegisterGroup.description: VI_INT_DLY_CNT is an interrupt delay counter register.

Member.name: int_dly_cnt
Member.description:
Interrupt delay counter.
The counter considers the bus clock as a unit. When the register value is counted, the VIU reports an interrupt if an interrupt occurs on 16 channels.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_INT_EN
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_INT_EN is an interrupt enable register.

Member.name: chdiv_err_int_en
Member.description:
Channel allocation error indicator interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ntsc_pal_trans_int_en
Member.description:
Format conversion interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: frame_pulse_int_en
Member.description:
Field start interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: reg_update_int_en
Member.description:
Register update interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: proc_err_int_en
Member.description:
Protection bit error interrupt enable in BT.656 mode.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: err_int_en
Member.description:
Bus error interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: field_throw_int_en
Member.description:
Field or frame loss interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: buf_ovf_int_en
Member.description:
Internal FIFO overflow error interrupt enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: cc_int_en
Member.description:
Data capture completion (CC) interrupt enable.
0: Enable the interrupt after a field of pictures are captured.
1: Enable the interrupt after a frame of pictures are captured.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_INT_STATUS
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_INT_STATUS is an interrupt status register. If the corresponding bit of the interruptstatus register is set to 1, the interrupt bit is cleared. Separate control is performed for eachchannel. The register is used for interaction of software and hardware and can be masked.

Member.name: chdiv_err_int
Member.description:
Status of a channel allocation error indicator interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: ntsc_pal_trans_int
Member.description:
Status of a format conversion interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Note: A format conversion interrupt is reported when the format changes. The format N or P is not restricted. If the number of input data valid lines changes, it considers that the format is converted.

Member.name: frame_pulse_int
Member.description:
Status of a field start interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: reg_update_int
Member.description:
Status of a working register update interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
If VIn_CH_CFG[store_mode] is set to 1, an interrupt is generated after a frame of pictures is captured.
If VIn_CH_CFG[store_mode] is set to 0, an interrupt is generated after a field of pictures is captured.

Member.name: proc_err_int
Member.description:
Status of a protection bit error interrupt in BT.656 mode.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: error_int
Member.description:
Status of an AHB bus error interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: field_throw_int
Member.description:
Status of a field data loss interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
Note: If the configuration is to capture data only in the odd field or capture data only in the even field, the hardware does not report information about a field data loss.

Member.name: buf_ovf_int
Member.description:
Status of an internal buffer FIFO overflow interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: cc_int
Member.description:
Status of a current picture data CC interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.
If VIn_CH_CFG[store_mode] is set to 0, an interrupt is generated after a field of pictures is captured.
If VIn_CH_CFG[store_mode] is set to 1, an interrupt is generated after a frame of pictures is captured.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_RAW_INT
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_RAW_INT is a raw interrupt status register. If the corresponding bit of the interruptstatus register is set to 1, the interrupt bit is cleared. Separate control is performed for variouschannels. The register is used for debugging and cannot be masked.

Member.name: chdiv_err_raw_int
Member.description:
Status of a channel allocation error indicator raw interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: ntsc_pal_trans_raw_int
Member.description:
Status of a format conversion raw interrupt.
0: No raw interrupt is generated.
1: A raw interrupt is generated.
Note: A format conversion interrupt is reported when the format changes. The format N or P is not restricted. If the number of input data valid lines changes, it considers that the format is converted.

Member.name: frame_pulse_raw_int
Member.description:
Status of a field start raw interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: reg_update_raw_int
Member.description:
Status of a working register update raw interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: proc_err_raw_int
Member.description:
Status of a protection bit error raw interrupt in BT.656 mode.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: error_raw_int
Member.description:
Status of an AHB bus error raw interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: field_throw_raw_int
Member.description:
Status of a field data loss raw interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: buf_ovf_raw_int
Member.description:
Status of an internal buffer FIFO overflow raw interrupt.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: cc_raw_int
Member.description:
Status of the current picture data CC raw interrupt.
0: Enable the raw interrupt after a field of pictures are captured.
1: Enable the raw interrupt after a frame of pictures are captured.
If store_mode is set to 0, an interrupt is generated after a field of pictures is captured.
If store_mode is set to 1, an interrupt is generated after a frame of pictures is captured.

RegisterGroup.name: VI_INT_INDICATOR
RegisterGroup.description: VI_INT_INDICATOR is an interrupt indicator register and used to indicate which of the 16channels generates an interrupt.

Member.name: ch1_int_indicator
Member.description:
Channel 1 interrupt indicator.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: ch0_int_indicator
Member.description:
Channel 0 interrupt indicator.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: VI_RAW_INT_INDICATOR
RegisterGroup.description: VI_RAW_INT_INDICATOR is a raw interrupt indicator register and used to indicate whichof the 16 channels generates a raw interrupt.

Member.name: ch1_raw_int_indicator
Member.description:
Channel 1 raw interrupt indicator.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

Member.name: ch0_raw_int_indicator
Member.description:
Channel 0 raw interrupt indicator.
0: No interrupt is generated.
1: An interrupt is generated.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_STATUS
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_STATUS is a status register.

Member.name: act_height
Member.description: Number of lines of valid pixel data in a detected field.

Member.name: vi_busy
Member.description:
Current working status of the VIU
0: idle
1: busy

Member.name: field2
Member.description:
Odd or even field which the currently received data is in.
0: odd field
1: even field

Member.name: snooze
Member.description:
Dormancy status of the VIU.
0: non-dormant
1: dormant

Member.name: proc_err
Member.description:
Status of a protection bit.
0: correct
1: incorrect

Member.name: bus_err
Member.description:
Status of a bus.
0: correct
1: incorrect

Member.name: frame_loss
Member.description:
Whether the VIU losses data of a field.
0: not lost
1: lost

Member.name: buf_ovf
Member.description:
Whether a buffer overflow occurs in the VIU.
0: No overflow occurs.
1: An overflow occurs.

Member.name: picture_done
Member.description:
Whether the VIU completes reception of data in the current field.
0: The reception is not completed.
1: The reception is completed.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_LUM_ADDER
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_LUM_ADDER is a luminance statistics register and used to collect statistics ofluminance information of the entire active picture, but not used to capture the picture arealuminance.

Member.name: vi_lum_adder
Member.description: Luminance value adder.

Member.name: m1
Member.description: Average luminance value 1.

Member.name: m0
Member.description: Average luminance value 0.

Member.name: k
Member.description: Luminance stretch coefficient.

Member.name: lum_diff_adder
Member.description: Luminance difference value adder. (In HD 720p mode, the luminance difference value adder of channel 0 is the luminance difference value adder of input pictures, and the luminance difference value adder of channel 4 is invalid). The value of the luminance difference adder sum register is written to the register when the next frame or frame starts.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_BLOCK0_COLOR
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_BLOCK0_COLOR is a cover block 0 filled color register.Pay attention to the following two points for color filling.The filled picture color must be data in the YCbCr format.When the VIU is configured with multiple cover blocks, and the overlay part is availablebetween various blocks, the color of the overlay output part is covered based on thepriority sequence 0, 1, 2, and 3. That is, the priority of filled block 0 is the highest, andthe priority of filled block 3 is the lowest.

Member.name: block0_y
Member.description: Component Y of the filled color of picture block 0.

Member.name: block0_u
Member.description: Component Cb of the filled color of picture block 0.

Member.name: block0_v
Member.description: Component Cr of the filled color of picture block 0.

RegisterGroup.name: VI_ANC0_START
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_ANC0_START is a blank-area data block 0 start location register.

Member.name: anc0_loc
Member.description:
Blank area of blank area data.
00: front blank area in an odd field
01: back blank area in an odd field
10: front blank area in an even field
11: back blank area in an even field
Note: In progressive mode, only the front blank area in an odd field is available. In DC mode, data in a blank area cannot be received.

Member.name: anc0_vos
Member.description: Distance from the start of a blank area to the line of blank area data (unit: line).

Member.name: anc0_hos
Member.description: Horizontal offset from the start of line valid data to the start of blank area data (unit: clock).

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_ANC0_SIZE
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_ANC0_SIZE is a blank-area data block 0 size register.

Member.name: anc0_size
Member.description: Size of a blank-area data block (unit: clock).

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_ANC1_START
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_ANC1_START is a blank-area data block 1 start location register.

Member.name: anc1_loc
Member.description:
Blank area of blank area data.
00: front blank area in an odd field
01: back blank area in an odd field
10: front blank area in an even field
11: back blank area in an even field
Note: In progressive mode, only the front blank area in an odd field is available. In DC mode, data in a blank area cannot be received.

Member.name: anc1_vos
Member.description: Distance from the start of a blank area to the line of blank area data (unit: line).

Member.name: anc1_hos
Member.description: Horizontal offset from the start of line valid data to the start of blank area data (unit: clock).

Member.name: anc1_size
Member.description: Size of a blank-area data block (unit: clock)

Member.name: vin_anc0_word
Member.description: First word data storage register of the blank area data 1 group.

Member.name: vin_anc1_word
Member.description: First word data storage register of the blank area data 2 group.

RegisterGroup.name: VI_P0_VSYNC1
RegisterGroup.description: When port 0 works in BT.601 mode, VI_P0_VSYNC1 is a vertical synchronizationconfiguration register of the first field. The register is valid only for channel 0. When port 0works in 16-bit synchronization interface mode, and horizontal synchronization uses the pulsemode, VI_P0_VSYNC1 is a vertical synchronization configuration register. The register isvalid for channels 0 and 4.

Member.name: act1_voff
Member.description: In BT.601 mode, vertical distance from the start of the first field to an active picture; in 16-bit synchronization interface mode, vertical distance from the start of the frame to an active picture. The unit is line. The value is the actual number of lines subtracting 1. Default value: 21.

Member.name: act1_height
Member.description: In BT.601 mode, height of an active picture in the first field; in 16-bit synchronization interface mode, height of an active picture. The unit is line. The value is the actual number of lines subtracting 1. Default value: 287.

RegisterGroup.name: VI_P0_VSYNC2
RegisterGroup.description: When port 0 works in BT.601 mode, VI_P0_VSYNC2 is a vertical synchronizationconfiguration register of the second field. The register is valid only for channel 0.

Member.name: act2_voff
Member.description:
Vertical distance from the start of the second field to an active picture (unit: line).
The value is the actual number of lines subtracting 1. Default value: 22.

Member.name: act2_height
Member.description:
Height of an active picture in the second field (unit: line).
The value is the actual number of lines subtracting 1. Default value: 287.

RegisterGroup.name: VI_P0_HSYNC
RegisterGroup.description: VI_P0_HSYNC is a horizontal synchronization configuration register. When port 0 works inBT.601 mode, the register is valid only for channel 0. When port 0 works in 16-bitsynchronization interface mode, and horizontal synchronization uses the pulse mode, theregister is valid for channels 0 and 4.

Member.name: act_hoff
Member.description:
Distance from the end of the previous line to the active data area of the line (unit: clock).
In BT.601 mode, the value is two times of the number of pixels subtracting 1. Default value: 263.
In 16-bit synchronization interface mode, the value is the number of pixels subtracting 1.

Member.name: act_width
Member.description:
Width of an active picture (unit: clock).
In BT.601 mode, the value is two times of the number of pixels subtracting 1. Default value: 1439 (720 pixels).
In 16-bit synchronization interface mode, the value is the number of pixels subtracting 1.

RegisterGroup.name: VI_PRIO_CFG
RegisterGroup.description: VI_PRIO_CFG is a priority configuration register of 16 channels in the VIU. Each channelcan be configured with either of two priority levels.

Member.name: outstanding_max
Member.description: Maximum number of AXI bus outstanding.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_LUM_COEF0
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_LUM_COEF0 is luminance filtering coefficient register 0.The format of the filtering coefficient is as follows: The most significant bit is the sign bit,and the least significant nine bits are the absolute value of the coefficient.The sum of lum_coef0–lum_coef7 is 512.In the case of 1/2 scaling, the recommended values of the luminance filtering coefficient (forlum_coef0–lum_coef7) are –16, 0, 145, 254, 145, 0, –16, and 0.

Member.name: lum_coef1
Member.description: Luminance filtering coefficient 1. Default value: 0.

Member.name: lum_coef0
Member.description: Luminance filtering coefficient 0. Default value: –16.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_LUM_COEF1
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_LUM_COEF1 is luminance filtering coefficient register 1.The filtering coefficient is represented in a supplemental code. The most significant bit is thesign bit.

Member.name: lum_coef3
Member.description: Luminance filtering coefficient 3. Default value: 254.

Member.name: lum_coef2
Member.description: Luminance filtering coefficient 2. Default value: 145.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_LUM_COEF2
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_LUM_COEF2 is luminance filtering coefficient register 2.The filtering coefficient is represented in a supplemental code. The most significant bit is thesign bit.

Member.name: lum_coef5
Member.description: Luminance filtering coefficient 5. Default value: 0.

Member.name: lum_coef4
Member.description: Luminance filtering coefficient 4. Default value: 145.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_LUM_COEF3
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_LUM_COEF3 is luminance filtering coefficient register 3.The filtering coefficient is represented in a supplemental code. The most significant bit is thesign bit.

Member.name: lum_coef7
Member.description: Luminance filtering coefficient 7. Default value: 0.

Member.name: lum_coef6
Member.description: Luminance filtering coefficient 6. Default value: -16.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_CHROMA_COEF0
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_CHROMA_COEF0 is chroma filtering coefficient register 0.The format of the filtering coefficient is as follows: The most significant bit is the sign bit,and the least significant nine bits are the absolute value of the coefficient.The sum of chroma_coef0–chroma_coef3 is 512.In the case of 1/2 scaling, the recommended values of the chroma filtering coefficient (forchroma_coef0–chroma_coef3) are 148, 171, 148, and 45.In the case of chroma resampling, the recommended values of the chroma filtering coefficient(for chroma_coef0–chroma_coef3) are –32, 416, 160, and –32.

Member.name: chroma_coef1
Member.description: Chroma filtering coefficient 1. Default value: 171.

Member.name: chroma_coef0
Member.description: Chroma filtering coefficient 0. Default value: 148.

RegisterGroup.name: VIN_CHROMA_COEF1
RegisterGroup.description: VIn_CHROMA_COEF1 is chroma filtering coefficient register 1.The filtering coefficient is represented in a supplemental code. The most significant bit is thesign bit.

Member.name: chroma_coef3
Member.description: Chroma filtering coefficient 3. Default value: 45.

Member.name: chroma_coef2
Member.description: Chroma filtering coefficient 2. Default value: 148.

RegisterGroup.name: VOMUX
RegisterGroup.description: VOMUX is a VO output interface multiplex register.

Member.name: sync_sel
Member.description:
Selection of Vo_vsync/vo_hsync/vo_dv data.
00: fixed zero
01: SD sync signal
10: direct digital interface
11: SYNC from HD_DATE (dv is fixed to zero)

Member.name: data_sel2
Member.description:
Selection of Vo_pdata[23:16] data. (Default value: 00)
00: hd bt.1120 2 component Y
01: hd separated mode 2 component Y
10: hd bt.1120 3 component Y
11: hd separated mode 3 component Y/R

Member.name: data_sel1
Member.description:
Selection of Vo_pdata[15:8] data. (Default value: 00)
00: hd bt.1120 2component C
01: hd separated mode component C
10: hd bt.1120 3 component Cb
11: hd separated mode component Cb/G

Member.name: data_sel0
Member.description:
Selection of Vo_pdata[7:0] data. (Default value: 00)
00: sd bt.656
01: sd CEA 861-D 8bits YC Mux (bt.601)
10: hd bt.1120 3 component Cr
11: hd separated mode component Cr/B

Member.name: vsync_neg
Member.description:
Vertical synchronization negative phase enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: hsync_neg
Member.description:
Horizontal synchronization negative phase enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: dv_neg
Member.description:
Data valid negative phase enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: hdmi_vid
Member.description:
Selection of an HDMI video output format.
RGB and YCbCr selection is obtained by configuring a DHD channel. (Default value: 100)
000: YCbCr444, 30-bit synchronization embedding mode
001: YCbCr444, 30-bit synchronization separation mode
010: RGB444, 30-bit synchronization embedding mode
011: RGB444, 30-bit synchronization separation mode
100: YCbCr422, 20-bit synchronization embedding mode
101: YCbCr422, 20-bit synchronization separation mode
110: YCbCr422, 10-bit synchronization embedding mode
111: YCbCr422, 10-bit synchronization separation mode
Other values: reserved

Member.name: dhd_to_sd
Member.description:
Selection of an SD output analog modulation mode. Not used and fixed to 0.
0: DHD to HDDATE, and a DHD channel outputs VGA or YpbPr
1: DSD to HDDATE, and a DSD channel outputs VGA or YpbPr.

Member.name: dsd_to_hd
Member.description:
Selection of an HD output analog modulation mode. When a DHD channel outputs 576i/480i, the bit is set to 1. In this case, the clock selection of an HD channel comes from 54 MHz.
0: DSD to SDDATE, and a DSD channel outputs CVBS/S-Video/YpbPr.
1: DHD to SDDATE, and a DHD channel outputs CVBS/S-Video/YpbPr.

Member.name: dac5_sel
Member.description:
Selection of a DAC5 output mode. (Default value: 01)
00: DAC5 debug mode output
01: DAC5 SD analog video output (SDATE)
10: DAC5 digital analog video output
11: DAC5 HD analog video output (HDATE)

Member.name: dac4_sel
Member.description:
Selection of a DAC4 output mode. (Default value: 01)
00: DAC4 debug mode output
01: DAC4 SD analog video output (SDATE)
10: DAC4 digital analog video output
11: DAC4 HD analog video output (HDATE)

Member.name: dac3_sel
Member.description:
Selection of the DAC3 output mode. (Default value: 01)
00: DAC3 debug mode output
01: DAC3 SD analog video output (SDATE)
10: DAC3 digital analog video output
11: DAC3 HD analog video output (HDATE)

Member.name: dac2_sel
Member.description:
Selection of a DAC2 output mode. (Default value: 11).
00: DAC2 debug mode output
01: DAC2 SD analog video output (SDATE)
10: DAC2 digital analog video output
11: DAC2 HD analog video output (HDATE)

Member.name: dac1_sel
Member.description:
Selection of a DAC1 output mode. (Default value: 11)
00: DAC1 debug mode output
01: DAC1 SD analog video output (SDATE)
10: DAC1 digital analog video output
11: DAC1 HD analog video output (HDATE)

Member.name: dac0_sel
Member.description:
Selection of the DAC0 output mode. (Default value: 11)
00: DAC0 debug mode output
01: DAC0 SD analog video output (SDATE)
10: DAC0 digital analog video output
11: DAC0 HD analog video output (HDATE)

RegisterGroup.name: VOLNKLSTCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: VOLNKLSTCTRL is a VOU linked-list control register.

Member.name: lnk_en
Member.description:
Linked-list enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: lnk_fst_node_num
Member.description: Number of the first node in a linked-list.

Member.name: lnk_fst_num
Member.description: Number of words to be updated for the first node of a linked-list. For example, if 10 registers need to be updated, four words are required. Information about the next node uses one word. Therefore, five words need to be configured. The configured value is the actual value subtracting 1.

RegisterGroup.name: VOLNKLSTADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VOLNKLSTADDR is a VOU linked-list start address register.

Member.name: lnk_addr
Member.description: 128-bit word-aligned start address (in bytes) of a linked list.

RegisterGroup.description: VOLNKLSTSTRT is a VOU linked-list start register.

Member.name: lnk_start
Member.description:
Start of a linked-list.

1: enabled

RegisterGroup.description: VOLNKLSTPENDINGSTA is VOU linked-list pending status register 1.

Member.name: addr_pendig
Member.description: Start address of a pending node in a linked-list.

RegisterGroup.name: VOLNKLSTWORKINGSTA
RegisterGroup.description: VOLNKLSTPENDINGSTA is VOU linked-list working status register 1.

Member.name: addr_working
Member.description: Start address of a working node in a linked-list.

RegisterGroup.name: VOLNKLSTENDSTA
RegisterGroup.description: VOLNKLSTENDSTA is VOU linked-list end status register 1.

Member.name: addr_end
Member.description: Start address of a working end node in a linked-list.

RegisterGroup.name: VOLNKLSTNUMSTA
RegisterGroup.description: VOLNKLSTNUMSTA is a VOU linked-list node number status register.

Member.name: node_num_end
Member.description: Number of a recently working end node.

Member.name: node_num_working
Member.description: Number of a working task node.

Member.name: node_num_pending
Member.description: Node number of a task to be executed.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: VHDCTRL is a layer-related information configuration register and is a non-instant register.

Member.name: surface_en
Member.description:
Surface enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: mute_en
Member.description:
VHD mute enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: wbc1_en
Member.description:
VHD write back enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: wbc1_int_en
Member.description:
WBC1 interrupt generation enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ofl_inter
Member.description:
Progressive or interlaced information of WBC1 at the data extraction point of the VHD when the VHD is offline.
0: progressive information
1: interlaced information

Member.name: ofl_btm
Member.description:
Top or bottom field information of interlaced output of WBC1 at the data extraction point of the VHD when the VHD is offline.
0: top field information
1: bottom field information

Member.name: ifir_mode
Member.description:
Horizontal chroma IFIR mode.
00: reserved
01: chroma IFIR copy mode
10: dual linear interpolation
11: 8-tap FIR

Member.name: bfield_first
Member.description:
Bottom field first (T: top field; B: bottom field).
0: top field first, T0B0T1B1… (T0B0 is one frame.)
1: bottom field first, B0T0B1T0… (B0T0 is one frame.)

Member.name: lm_rmode
Member.description:
Progressive or interlaced read mode of luminance.
00: reserved
01: Frame buffer data is read progressively.
10: Data in the top field is read during interlaced read of data.
11: Data in the bottom field is read during interlaced read of data.

Member.name: chm_rmode
Member.description:
Progressive or interlaced read mode of chroma.
00: reserved
01: Frame buffer data is read progressively.
10: Data in the top field is read during interlaced read of data.
11: Data in the bottom field is read during interlaced read of data.

Member.name: ifmt
Member.description:
Data input format.
0x1: SPYCbCr400
0x3: SPYCbCr420
0x4: SPYCbCr422
0x5: SPYCbCr444
0x9: PackageUYVY(Cb0Y0Cr0Y1); (only VDC_HD is unsupported.)
0xA: PackageYUYV(Y0Cb0Y1Cr0); (only VDC_HD is unsupported.)
0xB: PackageYVYU(Y0Cr0Y1Cb0); (only VDC_HD is unsupported.)
Others: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: VHDUPD
RegisterGroup.description: VHDUPD is a VHD channel update enable register.

Member.name: regup
Member.description: Surface register update. After the software configures the register, the surface register is updated when this bit is set to 1. After the surface register is updated, the hardware automatically clears the value of this bit.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDCADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VHDCADDR is a current frame address register. For the package pixel format, the address isthe frame buffer address. For the semi-planar pixel format, the address is the luminance framebuffer address.

Member.name: surface_caddr
Member.description: Luminance address of the current frame.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDCCADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VHDCCADDR is a current frame chroma address register. For the package pixel format, theaddress is invalid. For the semi-planar pixel format, the address is the chroma frame bufferaddress.

Member.name: surface_ccaddr
Member.description: Chroma address of the current frame.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDSTRIDE
RegisterGroup.description: VHDSTRIDE is a surface stride register.

Member.name: surface_cstride
Member.description: Stride of a chroma frame buffer (for the semi-planar format, and byte alignment).

Member.name: surface_stride
Member.description: Stride of a frame buffer (stride of a luminance frame buffer. for the semi-planar format, byte alignment).

RegisterGroup.name: VHDIRESO
RegisterGroup.description: VHDIRESO is an input resolution register and is a non-instant register.

Member.name: ih
Member.description:
Height (unit: line). The value is the actual height subtracting 1.
The frame height serves as a reference, and the unit is line.

Member.name: iw
Member.description: Width (unit: pixel). The value is the actual width subtracting 1.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDCBMPARA
RegisterGroup.description: VHDCBMPARA is a blending-related parameter register and is a non-instant register.

Member.name: galpha
Member.description: Global blending alpha. The value ranges from 0 to 255. The value 255 indicates opaque and the value 0 indicates full transparent.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDWBC1ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: VHDWBC1ADDR is a VHD data write back buffer address register and is a non-instantregister. VDC_SD does not have this register.

Member.name: wbc1addr
Member.description: Data write back buffer address of the VHD.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDWBC1STRD
RegisterGroup.description: VHDWBC1STRD is a VHD data write back stride register and is a non-instant register.VDC_SD does not have this register.

Member.name: wbc1_dft
Member.description:
Output data format of WBC1.
00: PackageUYVY(Cb0Y0Cr0Y1)
01: PackageYUYV(Y0Cb0Y1Cr0)
10: PackageYVYU(Y0Cr0Y1Cb0); the sequence is from 0 to 31.
11: reserved

Member.name: req_interval
Member.description: Minimum interval of WBC1 bus application. The interval between the end of the nth application and the (n+1)th application has req_interval clock periods.

Member.name: wbc1strd
Member.description: Data write back stride of the VHD.

RegisterGroup.name: VHDHSP

Member.name: hlmsc_en

Horizontal luminance scaling enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: hchmsc_en
Member.description:
Horizontal chroma scaling enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

1: enabled

1: filtering mode (filtering is enabled.)

Member.name: hchfir_en

1: filtering mode (filtering is enabled.)

1: Horizontal scaling is behind vertical scaling.

Member.description: Horizontal scaling ratio in the (u,4,12) format.

Member.name: lm_rmode

Progressive or interlaced read mode of luminance.

Member.name: chm_rmode

0xB: PackageYVYU(Y0Cr0Y1Cb0) (not supported by VDC_HD)

Note: Only VDC_HD of Hi3716M V2XX supports the package data format.

RegisterGroup.description: VSDCTRL is a layer-related information configuration register and is a non-instant register.

Member.name: surface_en
Member.description:
Surface enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: mute_en
Member.description:
Mute enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ifir_mode
Member.description:
Horizontal chroma IFIR mode.
01: chroma IFIR copy mode
10: dual linear interpolation
11: 8-tap FIR
Other values: reserved

Member.name: bfield_first
Member.description:
Bottom field first (T: top field; B: bottom field).
0: top field first, T0B0T1B1… (T0B0 is one frame.)
1: bottom field first, B0T0B1T0… (B0T0 is one frame.)

Member.name: lm_rmode
Member.description:
Progressive or interlaced read mode of luminance.
00: reserved
01: Frame buffer data is read progressively.
10: Data in the top field is read during interlaced read of data.
11: Data in the bottom field is read during interlaced read of data.

Member.name: chm_rmode
Member.description:
Progressive or interlaced read mode of chroma.
00: reserved
01: Frame buffer data is read progressively.
10: Data in the top field is read during interlaced read of data.
11: Data in the bottom field is read during interlaced read of data.

Member.name: ifmt
Member.description:
Data input format.
0x1: SPYCbCr400
0x3: SPYCbCr420
0x4: SPYCbCr422
0x5: SPYCbCr444
0x9: PackageUYVY(Cb0Y0Cr0Y1)
0xA: PackageYUYV(Y0Cb0Y1Cr0)
0xB: PackageYVYU(Y0Cr0Y1Cb0)
Others: reserved

Member.name: ifmt
Member.description:
Data input format.
0x00: CLUT 1bpp
0x10: CLUT 2bpp
0x20: CLUT 4bpp
0x30: CLUT 8bpp
0x38: ACLUT44
0x40: RGB444
0x41: RGB555
0x42: RGB565
0x43: PackageUYVY(Cb0Y0Cr0Y1)

RegisterGroup.name: G0UPD
RegisterGroup.description: G0UPD is a graphics layer update enable register.

Member.name: regup
Member.description: Surface register update. After the software configures the register, the surface register is updated when this bit is set to 1. After the surface register is updated, the hardware automatically clears the value of this bit.

RegisterGroup.name: G0ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: G0ADDR is a graphics layer address register. To calculate the address in the case of thehorizontal pixel offset, see the G0SFPOS description.

Member.name: surface_addr
Member.description: Address of a surface frame buffer.

RegisterGroup.name: G0STRIDE
RegisterGroup.description: G0STRIDE is a graphics layer stride register.

Member.name: surface_stride
Member.description: Stride of a frame buffer.

RegisterGroup.name: G0CBMPARA
RegisterGroup.description: G0CBMPARA is a blending-related parameter register and is a non-instant register.

Member.name: key_mode
Member.description:
Colorkey mode.
0: If Keymin is equal to or smaller than Pixel, and Pixel is equal to or smaller than Keymax, set the color to the colorkey.
1: If Pixel is equal to or smaller than Keymin or Pixel is equal to or larger than Keymax, set the color to the colorkey.

Member.name: key_en
Member.description:
Colorkey enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: premult_en
Member.description:
Whether the input bitmap is a pre-multiplying map.
0: no
1: yes

Member.name: palpha_en
Member.description: Pixel alpha enable.

Member.name: palpha_range
Member.description:
Value range of the pixel alpha.
0: The α range of the pixel is 0~128.
1: The α range of the pixel is 0~255.

Member.name: galpha
Member.description: Value of a blending global alpha. The value ranges from 0 to 255. The value 255 indicates opaque and the value 0 indicates full transparent.

RegisterGroup.name: G0CKEYMAX
RegisterGroup.description: G0CKEYMAX is a colorkey maximum value register and is a non-instant register.

Member.name: va0
Member.description: Value of alpha0. If the data format is alphaRGB1555, and the alpha value is 0, the value of this bit is used for replacement.

Member.name: keyr_max
Member.description: Maximum value of colorkey component R.

Member.name: keyg_max
Member.description: Maximum value of colorkey component G.

Member.name: keyb_max
Member.description: Maximum value of colorkey component B.

RegisterGroup.name: G0IRESO
RegisterGroup.description: G0IRESO is an input resolution register and is a non-instant register.

Member.name: ih
Member.description:
Height (unit: line). The value is the actual height subtracting 1.
Note: In the case of interlaced output, the actual layer height must be an even number. In the case of progressive output, there is no such restriction.

Member.name: iw
Member.description:
Width (unit: pixel). The value is the actual width subtracting 1.
Note: The actual layer width must be an even number.

RegisterGroup.name: G0ORESO
RegisterGroup.description: G0ORESO is an output resolution register and is a non-instant register.

Member.name: oh

Member.description:
Width (unit: pixel). The value is the actual width subtracting 1.
Note: The actual layer width must be an even number.

Member.name: src_xfpos
Member.description: Value of the source start X coordinate. The value 0 indicates the first pixel of one line.

RegisterGroup.name: G0HSP
