Member.name: hamid_en
Member.description:
Horizontal scaling median filtering enable of the α value. This bit is valid only when hfir_en is valid.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: hlmid_en
Member.description:
Horizontal luminance scaling median filtering enable. This bit is valid only when hfir_en is valid.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: hchmid_en
Member.description:
Horizontal chroma scaling median filtering enable. This bit is valid only when hfir_en is valid.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: hfir_en
Member.description:
Horizontal luminance and chroma scaling mode.
0: replication mode (filtering is disabled.)
1: filtering mode (filtering is enabled.)

Member.name: hafir_en
Member.description:
Horizontal α scaling mode.
0: replication mode (filtering is disabled.)
1: filtering mode (filtering is enabled.) It uses the same filtering mode as component Y.

Member.name: hfir_order
Member.description:
Horizontal scaling position.
0: Horizontal scaling is in front of vertical scaling.
1: Horizontal scaling is behind vertical scaling.

Member.name: hratio
Member.description: Horizontal scaling ratio in the (u,4,12) format.

RegisterGroup.name: G1CTRL

Member.name: surface_en
Member.description:
Surface enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: g1_sel_zme
Member.description:
Selection of the G1 scaling unit.
0: The scaling unit is on WBC2.
1: The scaling unit is on G1.
Note: When this bit is specified, WBC2 and G1 should be disabled.

Member.name: gmm_en
Member.description:
GAMMA enable of G1.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: upd_mode
Member.description:
Update mode.
0: frame update
1: field update

Member.name: read_mode
Member.description:
Data read mode.
0: automatic selection based on the interface read mode (progressive read in the case of progressive display; interlaced read in the case of interlaced display)
1: forced progressive read

Member.name: bitext
Member.description:
Extension mode of the layer input bitmap bit.
0X: lower-bit extension 0
10: maximum bit of lower-bit extension
11: several maximum bits of lower-bit extension

Member.name: ifmt
Member.description:
Data input format.
0x00: CLUT 1bpp
0x10: CLUT 2bpp
0x20: CLUT 4bpp
0x30: CLUT 8bpp
0x38: ACLUT44
0x40: RGB444
0x41: RGB555
0x42: RGB565
0x43: PackageUYVY(Cb0Y0Cr0Y1)
0x44: PackageYUYV(Y0Cb0Y1Cr0)
0x45: PackageYVYU(Y0Cr0Y1Cb0)
0x46: ACLUT88
0x48: ARGB4444
0x49: ARGB1555
0x50: RGB888 (24 bpp)
0x51: YCbCr888 (24 bpp)
0x5a: ARGB8565 (24 bpp)
0x60: KRGB888

0x69: AYCbCr8888
0xc8: RGBA4444

0xe8: RGBA8888
0xe9: YCbCrA8888

RegisterGroup.description: WBC0CTRL is a WBC0 control register and is a non-instant register.

Member.name: wbc0_en
Member.description:
WBC0 enable.
0: disabled
1: enabled

RegisterGroup.name: WBC0UPD
RegisterGroup.description: WBC0UPD is a WBC0 channel update enable register.

Member.name: regup
Member.description: CAPTURE register update. After the software configures the register, the surface register is updated when this bit is set to 1. After the surface register is updated, the hardware automatically clears the value of this bit.

RegisterGroup.name: WBC0ADDR
RegisterGroup.description: WBC0ADDR is a CAPTURE address write register.

Member.name: wbcaddr
Member.description: Address of a frame buffer. The 4-byte bits are aligned. The two least significant bits are invalid. (The seamless splice is supported.)

RegisterGroup.name: WBC0STRIDE
RegisterGroup.description: WBC0STRIDE is a CAPTURE stride register.

Member.name: wbc0stride
Member.description: Stride of a frame buffer. The 16-byte bits are aligned.

RegisterGroup.name: WBC0ORESO
RegisterGroup.description: WBC0ORESO is an output resolution register and is a non-instant register.

Member.name: oh
Member.description:
Height (unit: line). The value is the actual height subtracting 1.
Note: In the case of interlaced output, the actual layer height must be an even number. In the case of progressive output, there is no such restriction.

Member.name: ow
Member.description:
Width (unit: pixel). The value is the actual width subtracting 1.
Note: The actual layer width must be an even number.

RegisterGroup.name: CBMATTR
RegisterGroup.description: CBMATTR is a crossbar configuration register. Where, sur_attr_x indicates that the xth layeris connected to mixer1 or mixer2; mixer_prio_x indicates the layer configured by the xthpriority. Mixer1 priorities are arranged with mixer2 priorities. The hardware remaps thepriorities of mixer1 and mixer2 based on sur_attr_x and mixer_prio_x.The register is a non-instant register.

Member.name: sur_attr1
Member.description:
HC link mode.
0: Mixer2
1: Mixer1

Member.name: sur_attr0
Member.description:
G1 link mode.
0: Mixer2
1: Mixer1

RegisterGroup.name: CBMMIX1
RegisterGroup.description: CBMMIX1 is a mixer1 priority configuration register. The update at VSYNC is valid.It is a non-instant register.

Member.name: mixer_prio4
Member.description:
For the priority configuration at the mixer1 overlay layer, driving layer at priority 4.
000: no layer driving
001: vhd
010: vad
011: g0
100: g1
101: hc
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mixer_prio3
Member.description:
For the priority configuration at the mixer1 overlay layer, driving layer at priority 3.
000: no layer driving
001: vhd
010: vad
011: g0
100: g1
101: hc
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mixer_prio2
Member.description:
For the priority configuration at the mixer1 overlay layer, driving layer at priority 2.
000: no layer driving
001: vhd
010: vad
011: g0
100: g1
101: hc
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mixer_prio1
Member.description:
For the priority configuration at the mixer1 overlay layer, driving layer at priority 1.
000: no layer driving
001: vhd
010: vad
011: g0
100: g1
101: hc
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mixer_prio0
Member.description:
For the priority configuration at the mixer1 overlay layer, driving layer at priority 0.
000: no layer driving
001: vhd
010: vad
011: g0
100: g1
101: hc
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: CBMMIX2
RegisterGroup.description: CBMMIX2 is a mixer2 priority configuration register. The update at VSYNC is valid. It is anon-instant register.

Member.name: mixer_prio2
Member.description:
For the priority configuration at the mixer2 overlay layer, driving layer at priority 2 (the lowest priority).
000: no layer driving
001: vdc_sd
010: gdc_g1
101: gdc_hc
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mixer_prio1
Member.description:
For the priority configuration at the mixer2 overlay layer, driving layer at priority 1 (the lowest priority).
000: no layer driving
001: vdc_sd
010: gdc_g1
101: gdc_hc
Other values: reserved

Member.name: mixer_prio0
Member.description:
For the priority configuration at the mixer2 overlay layer, driving layer at priority 0 (the lowest priority).
000: no layer driving
001: vdc_sd
010: gdc_g1
101: gdc_hc
Other values: reserved

RegisterGroup.name: DHDCTRL
RegisterGroup.description: DHDCTRL is a display channel overall control register. The configuration of all bits of theregister cannot be later than the configuration of the DHDCTRL.intf_en bit. Otherwise, theconfiguration cannot take effect.

Member.name: intf_en
Member.description:
Display interface enable. The interface outputs data only when the display interface is enabled. It is used for the instant register.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: clipen
Member.description:
Output clip enable; used for the instant register.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: gmmen
Member.description:
Output gamma correction enable; used for the instant register.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: idv
Member.description:
Data valid signal output negative phase enable; used for the instant register.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ihs
Member.description:
Horizontal synchronization pulse output negative phase enable; used for the instant register.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: ivs
Member.description:
Vertical synchronization pulse output negative phase enable; used for the instant register.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: iop
Member.description:
Display mode; used for the instant register.
0: interlaced display
1: progressive display

Member.name: synm
Member.description:
Synchronization mode; used for the instant register.
0: timing label mode (for example, BT.656)
1: synchronization signal mode (for example, LCD display)

Member.name: intfb
Member.description:
Output interface width mode.
00: single-component mode (each clock outputs one component.)
01: dual-component mode (each clock outputs two components.)
10: triple-component mode (each clock outputs three components.)
11: reserved
It is used for the instant register.

Member.name: intfdm
Member.description:
Interface data format.
0x0: YCbCr422 data format
0x1~0xB: reserved
0xC: RGB888/YCbCr444 output
It is used for the instant register.

RegisterGroup.name: DHDVSYNC
RegisterGroup.description: DHDVSYNC is a top vertical synchronization timing register used in the case of interlacedoutput or a frame vertical synchronization timing register used in the case of progressiveoutput. The configuration of the register takes effect immediately. The timing of pin VSYNCis affected immediately. The configuration of the register cannot be later than theconfiguration of the DHDCTRL.intf_en bit. Otherwise, the configuration cannot take effect.

Member.name: vfb
Member.description:
Top vertical blank front porch in the case of interlaced output
Vertical blank front porch in the case of progressive output
The register value is the actual value subtracting 1.

Member.name: vbb
Member.description:
Top vertical blank back porch in the case of interlaced output
Vertical pulse width of the vertical blank back porch in the case of progressive output
The register value is the actual value subtracting 1.

Member.name: vact
Member.description:
Height of a top active picture in the case of interlaced output
Height of a frame of active pictures in the case of progressive output
The register value is the actual value subtracting 1.

RegisterGroup.name: DHDHSYNC1
RegisterGroup.description: DHDHSYNC1 is a horizontal synchronization configuration register used in the case ofinterlaced or progressive output. The configuration of the register takes effect immediately.The timing of pin HSYNC is affected immediately. The configuration of the register cannotbe later than the configuration of the DHDCTRL.intf_en bit. Otherwise, the configurationcannot take effect.

Member.name: hbb
Member.description:
Horizontal blank back porch (unit: pixel).
The register value is the actual value subtracting 1.

Member.name: hact
Member.description:
Number of horizontal pixels in an active area.
The register value is the actual value subtracting 1.

RegisterGroup.name: DHDHSYNC2
RegisterGroup.description: DHDHSYNC2 is a horizontal synchronization configuration register used in the case ofinterlaced or progressive output. The configuration of the register takes effect immediately.The timing of pin HSYNC is affected immediately. The configuration of the register cannotbe later than the configuration of the DHDCTRL.intf_en bit. Otherwise, the configurationcannot take effect.

Member.name: hmid
Member.description:
Value of a bottom vertical synchronization valid pixel (in a valid data area).
The register value is the actual value subtracting 1.

Member.name: hfb
Member.description:
Horizontal blank front porch (unit: pixel).
The register value is the actual value subtracting 1.

RegisterGroup.name: DHDVPLUS
RegisterGroup.description: DHDVPLUS is a bottom vertical synchronization timing register used in the case ofinterlaced output. The configuration of the register cannot be later than the configuration ofthe DHDCTRL.intf_en bit. Otherwise, the configuration cannot take effect.

Member.name: bvfb
Member.description:
Bottom vertical blank front porch in the case of interlaced output
The register value is the actual value subtracting 1.

Member.name: bvbb
Member.description:
Vertical pulse width of the bottom vertical blank back porch in the case of interlaced output
The register value is the actual value subtracting 1.

Member.name: bvact
Member.description:
Height of a bottom active picture in the case of interlaced output
The register value is the actual value subtracting 1.

RegisterGroup.name: DHDPWR
RegisterGroup.description: DHDPWR is a synchronization signal pulse width register. The configuration of the registercannot be later than the configuration of the DHDCTRL.intf_en bit. Otherwise, theconfiguration cannot take effect.

Member.name: vpw
Member.description: The value is the vertical pulse width subtracting 1.

Member.name: hpw
Member.description: The value is the horizontal pulse width subtracting 1.

RegisterGroup.name: DHDVTTHD3
RegisterGroup.description: DHDVTTHD3 is a vertical timing threshold register and is an instant register. The registerincludes the configuration of two thresholds, and two interrupts can be generated separately.

Member.name: thd4_mode
Member.description:
Mode for generating a threshold 4 interrupt.
0: frame mode; the frame is a unit for data counting.
1: field mode; the field is a unit for data counting in the case of interlaced display.

Member.name: vtmgthd4
Member.description: Vertical timing threshold 4 used to trigger the DHD and the DSD synchronously. The time that the DSD interface timing start is later than the DHD is equal to the number of lines configured by vtmgthd4.

Member.name: thd3_mode
Member.description:
Mode for generating a threshold 3 interrupt.
0: frame mode; the frame is a unit for data counting.
1: field mode; the field is a unit for data counting in the case of interlaced display.

Member.name: vtmgthd3
Member.description: Vertical timing threshold 3. When the vertical timing counter reaches the threshold, the VOINTSTA[dhdvtthd3_int] interrupt is triggered.

RegisterGroup.name: DHDVTTHD
RegisterGroup.description: DHDVTTHD is a vertical timing threshold register and is an instant register. The registerincludes the configuration of two thresholds, and two interrupts can be generated separately.

Member.name: thd2_mode
Member.description:
Mode for generating a threshold 2 interrupt.
0: frame mode; the frame is a unit for data counting.
1: field mode; the field is a unit for data counting in the case of interlaced display.

Member.name: vtmgthd2
Member.description: Vertical timing threshold 2. When the vertical timing counter reaches the threshold, the VOINTSTA[dhdvtthd2_int] interrupt is triggered.

Member.name: thd1_mode
Member.description:
Mode for generating a threshold 1 interrupt.
0: frame mode; the frame is a unit for data counting.
1: field mode; the field is a unit for data counting in the case of interlaced display.

Member.name: vtmgthd1
Member.description: Vertical timing threshold 1. When the vertical timing counter reaches the threshold, the VOINTSTA[dhdvtthd_int1] interrupt is triggered.

Module enable.

RegisterGroup.name: HDATE_POLA_CTRL
RegisterGroup.description: HDATE_POLA_CTRL is an HD_DATE input and output synchronization polarityconfiguration register.

Member.name: fid_out_pola
Member.description:
Output FID polarity control.
0: The HD_DATE output top flag is the positive polarity; that is, 1 stands for the top field.
1: The HD_DATE output top flag is the negative polarity; that is, 0 stands for the top field.

Member.name: vsync_out_pola
Member.description:
Output VSYNC polarity control.
0: The HD_DATE output field synchronization is the positive polarity; that is, 1 stands for the synchronization header.
1: The HD_DATE output field synchronization is the negative polarity; that is, 0 stands for the synchronization header.

Member.name: hsync_out_pola
Member.description:
Output HSYNC polarity control.
0: The HD_DATE output horizontal synchronization is the positive polarity; that is, 1 stands for the synchronization header.
1: The HD_DATE output horizontal synchronization is the negative polarity; that is, 0 stands for the synchronization header.

Member.name: fid_in_pola
Member.description:
Input FID polarity control.
0: The HD_DATE input top flag is the positive polarity; that is, 1 stands for the top field.
1: The HD_DATE input top flag is the negative polarity; that is, 0 stands for the top field.

Member.name: vsync_in_pola
Member.description:
Input VSYNC polarity control.
0: The HD_DATE input field synchronization is the positive polarity; that is, 1 stands for the synchronization header.
1: The HD_DATE input field synchronization is the negative polarity; that is, 0 stands for the synchronization header.

Member.name: hsync_in_pola
Member.description:
Input HSYNC polarity control.
0: The HD_DATE input horizontal synchronization is the positive polarity; that is, 1 stands for the synchronization header.
1: The HD_DATE input horizontal synchronization is the negative polarity; that is, 0 stands for the synchronization header.

RegisterGroup.name: HDATE_VIDEO_FORMAT
RegisterGroup.description: HDATE_VIDEO_FORMAT is an HD_DATE video format synchronization overlay andchroma space conversion control register.

Member.name: csc_ctrl
Member.description:
Chroma space conversion control.
000: YCbCr->YPbPr
001: YCbCr->RGB; conversion based on the ITU -R BT709 chroma space
010: YCbCr->RGB; conversion based on the ITU-R BT601 chroma space
011: YCbCr->RGB; conversion based on the SMPTE240 chroma space
Others: configuration coefficient

Member.name: video_out_ctrl
Member.description:
Output video format control.
00: RGB output (RGB embedding synchronization)
01: YPbPr output (YPbPr embedding synchronization)
10: VGA output (RGB+H+V)
11: reserved

Member.name: sync_add_ctrl
Member.description:
Synchronization overlay control.
Three bits control three video components; 1 indicates that the synchronization overlay is performed on the controlled channel, and 1 indicates that the synchronization overlay is not performed.
sync_add_ctrl[2]: It controls whether the synchronization overlay is performed on the R or Pr channel.
sync_add_ctrl[1]: It controls whether the synchronization overlay is performed on the G or Y channel.
sync_add_ctrl[0]: It controls whether the synchronization overlay is performed on the B or Pb channel.

Member.name: video_ft
Member.description:
Synchronization format configuration.
0x0: 480p format; in compliance with SMPTE293M/EIA-770.2/ITU-R BT1358
0x1: 576p format; in compliance with ITU-R BT1358
0x2: 720p format; in compliance with EIA-770.3/SMPTE 296M
0x3: 1080p format; in compliance with SMPTE 274M
0x4: 1080i format; in compliance with EIA-770.3/SMPTE 274M
0x5: 295m1080p format; in compliance with SMPTE 295M
0x6: 295m1080i format; in compliance with SMPTE 295M
0x7: as1152i format; in compliance with AS4933
0x8: as1080i format; in compliance with AS4933
Others: reserved and used for further video format extension

RegisterGroup.name: DATE_COEFF0
RegisterGroup.description: DATE_COEFF0 is a format parameter configuration register.

Member.name: clpf_sel
Member.description:
Selection of a chroma low-pass filter bandwidth.
00: 1.1 MHz bandwidth (NTSC)
01: 1.3 MHz bandwidth (PAL)
10: 1.6 MHz bandwidth (test)
11: reserved

Member.name: dis_ire
Member.description:
For the (M) NTSC and (M, N) PAL formats, the black level is 7.5 IRE higher than the blank level. For other formats, the black level is equal to the blank level.
This bit controls whether the black level is 7.5 IRE higher than the blank level.
0: The black level is 7.5 IRE higher than the blank level.
1: The black level is equal to the blank level.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
Reserved.
It is invalid when it is written. It is set to 0 when it is read.

Member.name: scanline
Member.description:
It is set based on the number of scanning lines included in each frame in different formats. For (M) NTSC, NTSC-J, and (M) PAL formats, each frame includes 525 lines. For (B, D, J, H, and I) PAL, (N) PAL, and (Nc) PAL formats, each frame includes 625 lines.
0: Each frame includes 525 lines.
1: Each frame includes 625 lines.

Member.name: rgb_en
Member.description:
When intf_sel is set to 100, this bit determines that the component signal selects RGB or YPbPr.
0: The component signal selects YPbPr.
1: The component signal selects RGB.

Member.name: vbi_lpf_en
Member.description:
Low-pass filtering enable of VBI data.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: fm_sel
Member.description:
Selection of an FMSECAM frequency modulation mode.
0: The SECAM frequency modulation uses sin.
1: The SECAM frequency modulation uses cos.

Member.name: style_sel
Member.description:
Cooperating with scanline, format of the CVBS/S-Video output signal.
When scanline is set to 0; that is, each frame includes 525 lines, the values of this bit are as follows:
0001: (M) NTSC format
0010: NTSC-J format
0100: (M) PAL format
1000: PAL-60 format
1001: NTSC 4.43 format
When scanline is set to 1; that is, each frame includes 625 lines, the values of this bit are as follows:
0001: (B, D, G, H, and I) PAL format
0010: (N) PAL format
0100: (Nc) PAL format
1000: SECAM format
Other values: reserved

Member.name: sync_mode_sel
Member.description:
The upper-bit specifies whether the component output contains a synchronization signal on three channels. This control bit is valid only when sync_mode_scart is set to 0.
The upper-bit is valid only when intf_sel is set to 100 (that is, there is the component output). The values are as follows:
0: In the case of the component output, only one channel contains a synchronization signal.
1: In the case of the component output, three channels contain a synchronization signal.
When this bit is set to 0, for the YPbPr output, the synchronization channel can be channel Y only; for RGB output, the synchronization channel can be channel G only.
The lower bit specifies whether there is a blank base in the case of the RGB output.
The lower bit is valid only when intf_sel is set to 100 and rgb_en is set to 1. The values are as follows:
0: There is no blank base in the case of RGB output.
1: There is a blank base in the case of RGB output.

Member.name: sync_mode_scart
Member.description:
Whether overlay synchronization is performed on the three channels of a component.
0: The synchronization output of a component is configured based on sync_mode_sel[1].
1: Overlay synchronization is not performed on the three channels of a component. In this case, sync_mode_sel[1] must be set to 0.

Member.name: length_sel
Member.description:
Line valid width (unit: pixel) contained by each video line.
0: line valid pixel width output based on the BT.601 mode
1: line valid pixel width output based on the BT.470 mode
When this bit is set to 0, the line valid width is 720 pixels. When this bit is set to 1, for the 625-line format, the line valid width is 704 pixels; for the 525-line format, the line valid width is 712 pixels.
In the current version, the dynamic configuration in BT601 mode and the dynamic configuration in BT470 mode are not supported. After resetting, the configuration is performed according to the requirements. The configuration cannot be changed in the intermediate process. It is recommended that you use the BT601 mode (that is, use the power-on resetting value).

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
Reserved.
It is invalid when it is written. It is set to 0 when it is read.

Member.name: luma_dl
Member.description:
Earlier or later shift (unit: half pixel width) of a chroma signal in comparison with a luminance signal.
The upper bit specifies a shift direction of a chroma signal in comparison with a luminance signal.
0: A chroma signal is later than a luminance signal.
1: A chroma signal is earlier than a luminance signal.
The lower three bits specify the absolute value of a shift of a chroma signal in comparison with a luminance signal. It is represented by a binary number. The value ranges from 0 to 7.
000: The chroma is aligned with the luminance. Adjustment is not performed.
001~111: A chroma signal is 1~7 units earlier or later than a luminance signal.

Member.name: reserved
Member.description:
Reserved.
It is invalid when it is written. It is set to 0 when it is read.

Member.name: oversam_en
Member.description:
Level-1 over-sampling function control. It controls the luminance over-sampling function and the chroma over-sampling function.
The upper-bit controls whether to enable the luminance over-sampling function.
0: disabled
1: enabled
The lower-bit controls whether to enable the chroma over-sampling function.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: lunt_en
Member.description:
Luminance trap function control.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: oversam2_en
Member.description:
Level-2 over-sampling function control. It controls the luminance channel and the chroma channel.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: chlp_en
Member.description:
Chroma low-pass filtering function control.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: sylp_en
Member.description:
Synchronization low-pass filtering function control.
0: disabled
1: enabled

Member.name: chgain_en
Member.description:

0: disabled
1: enabled

0: from the high bit to the low bit
1: from the low bit to the high bit

Member.name: tt_ready
Member.description:
When the related parameters of the software are configured through a bus, this bit is set to 1. The Teletext module starts to work.
When the Teletext module completes data transmission, this bit is set to low. The software can query the bit status. The chip waits for another configuration by the software.

RegisterGroup.name: TSI0_VI0_TSI1_GPIO_AO
RegisterGroup.description: tsi0_vi0_tsi1_gpio_ao is the multiplexing control register for the TSI0_D0, TSI0_D1,TSI0_D2, and TSI0_D3 pins.

Member.name: tsi0_vi0_tsi1_gpio_ao
Member.description:
Multiplexing of the TSI0_D0 pin.
000: TSI0_D0
010: TSI1_D7
011: GPIO11_5
100: AO_FSCLK
101: TSO_D0
0110: GPIO11_5. This bit is valid only for the Hi3716M V2XX chips, and is reserved for other chips.
Other values: reserved
Multiplexing of the TSI0_D1 pin.
000: TSI0_D1
010: TSI1_VALID
011: GPIO11_6
100: AO_BCLK
101: TSO_VALID
0110: SPI_CSN1. This bit is valid only for the Hi3716M V2XX chips, and is reserved for other chips.
Other values: reserved
Multiplexing of the TSI0_D2 pin.
000: TSI0_D2
010: TSI1_CLK
011: GPIO11_7
100: AO_MCLK
101: TSO_CLK
0110: SPI_SCLK. This bit is valid only for the Hi3716M V2XX chips, and is reserved for other chips.
Other values: reserved
Multiplexing of the TSI0_D3 pin.
000: TSI0_D3
010: TSI1_SYNC
011: GPIO12_0
100: AO_DOUT0
101: TSO_SYNC
0110: SPI_SDI. This bit is valid only for the Hi3716M V2XX chips, and is reserved for other chips.
Other values: reserved
